hara: हर <lex>mf(आ, rarely ई)n.</lex> (only <ab>ifc.</ab>; <ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> हृ) bearing, wearing, taking, conveying, bringing (see कवच-, वार्त्ता-ह्°), taking away, carrying off, removing, destroying (see बल-, शक्ति-ह्°)<info lex="m:f#A:f#I:n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=260675]</L>
the denominator of a fraction, division, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=260683]</L>
jaqa: जड <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (<ab>cf.</ab> जळ्हु) cold, frigid, <ls>Pañcat. i, 12, 4</ls>; <ls>Kāvyād. ii, 34</ls>; <ls>Rājat. iv, 41</ls><info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=76649]</L>
stiff, torpid, motionless, apathetic, senseless, stunned, paralysed, <ls>Ragh. iii, 68</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=76650]</L>

stupid, dull, <ls>Mn. viii, 394</ls> (also अ- <ab>neg.</ab>, <ls n="Mn. viii,">148</ls>), <ls>Yājñ. ii</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> (<ab>ifc.</ab> ‘too stupid for’, <ls n="MBh.">iii, 437</ls>) &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=76651]</L>
void of life, inanimate, unintelligent, <ls>KapS. i, 146</ls>; <ls n="KapS.">vi, 50</ls>; <ls>NṛsUp.</ls>; <ls>Vedāntas.</ls>; <ls>Sarvad.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=76652]</L>
जड <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>g.</ab> अश्वा<स्र्स्>दि) <ab>N.</ab> of <s1>Sumati</s1> (who simulated stupidity) <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>MārkP. x, 9</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=76655]</L>
arRa: अर्ण <lex>m.</lex> <lex>n.</lex> a wave, flood stream, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=15792]</L>
(figuratively applied to the) tumult of battle, <ls>RV. v, 50, 4</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=15793]</L>
अर्ण <lex>m.</lex> a letter, syllable, <ls>RāmatUp.</ls> <ab>N.</ab> of a metre (comprising ten feet, and belonging to the class called <s1>Daṇḍaka</s1>)<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=15794]</L>
the teak tree (see अर्जुना<स्र्स्>पम above), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=15795]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a man (see अर्न चित्ररथ below)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=15796]</L>
jAna: <hom>1.</hom> जान <lex>n.</lex> birth, origin, birth place, <ls>RV. i, 37, 9</ls> and <ls n="RV. i,">95, 3</ls>; <ls n="RV.">v</ls>, <ls n="RV.">x</ls>; <ls>AV. vii, 76, 5</ls>; <ls>ŚBr. iii, 2, 1, 40.</ls><info lex="n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=78782]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> जान <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> जन) <ab>patr.</ab> of <s1>Vṛśa</s1> (= वैजान, ‘son of <s1>Vijānā</s1>’ <ab>Sch.</ab>), <ls>TāṇḍyaBr. xiii, 3</ls>; <ls>ĀrṣBr.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=78783]</L>
Gana: घन <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (√ हन्) a striker, killer, destroyer, <ls>RV. i, 4, 8</ls>; <ls n="RV.">iii, 49, 1</ls>; <ls n="RV.">iv, 38, 1</ls>; <ls n="RV.">viii, 96, 18</ls><info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=69423]</L>
compact, solid, material, hard, firm, dense, <ls n="RV.">i, 8, 3</ls> (घना for °नम् आ), <ls>Suśr.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=69424]</L>
full of (in <ab>comp.</ab>), densely filled with (in <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>MBh. i</ls>, <ls n="MBh.">xiii</ls>; <ls>Ragh. viii, 90</ls>; <ls>Ratnāv. iv, 2</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=69427]</L>
deep (as sound; colour), <ls>MBh. i, 6680</ls>; <ls>VarBṛS. xliii, 19</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=69430]</L>

an iron club, mace, weapon shaped like a hammer, <ls n="RV.">i, 33, 4</ls>; <ls n="RV. i,">36, 16</ls>; <ls n="RV. i,">63, 5</ls>; <ls n="RV.">ix, 97, 16</ls>; <ls>AV. x, 4, 9</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=69434]</L>
any compact mass or substance (generally <ab>ifc.</ab>), <ls>ŚBr. xiv</ls> &c. (said of the foetus in the 2nd month, <ls>Nir. xiv, 6</ls>; <ls>Laghuj. iii, 4</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=69435]</L>

<ab>ifc.</ab> mere, nothing but (<ab>e.g.</ab> विज्ञान-घन, ‘nothing but intuition’, <ls>ŚBr. xiv</ls>), <ls>MāṇḍUp. 5</ls>; <ls>PraśnUp. v, 5</ls>; <ls>BhP. viii f.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> अम्बु-, अयो-)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=69436]</L>
a collection, multitude, mass, quantity, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=69437]</L>
the bulbous root of <bot>Cyperus Hexastachyus communis</bot>, <ls>Suśr. vi</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=69441]</L>
a peculiar form of a temple, <ls>Hcat. ii, 1, 389</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=69442]</L>
a particular method of reciting the <ls>RV.</ls> and <s1>Yajur-veda</s1> (<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>RTL. p. 409</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=69443]</L>
the cube (of a number), solid body (in <ab>geom.</ab>), <ls>Laghuj.</ls>; <ls>Sūryas.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=69444]</L>
घन <lex>n.</lex> any brazen or metallic instrument or plate which is struck (cymbal, bell, gong, &c.), <ls>Hariv. 8688</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=69448]</L>
a mode of dancing (neither quick nor slow), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=69451]</L>
ama: <hom>1.</hom> अम <lex>m.</lex> impetuosity, violence, strength, power, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=13749]</L>
depriving of sensation, fright, terror, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=13750]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> अम <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>pron.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> अमु) this, <ls>AV. xiv, 2, 71</ls> (quoted in <ls>ŚBr. xiv</ls> & <ls>ĀśvGṛ.</ls>) [The word is also explained by प्रा<स्र्स्>ण, ‘soul’, <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Comm.</ab> on <ls>ChUp. v, 2, 6.</ls>]<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=13768]</L>
Ahan: आ-√ हन् <ab>P.</ab> -हन्ति (<ab>Impv.</ab> आ-जहि, <ls>AV.</ls> &c.; <ab>pf.</ab> आ-जघान, <ls>RV.</ls> &c.) <ab>Ā.</ab> -हते (only if no object follows, <ls>Pāṇ. i, 3, 28</ls>, or if the object is a part of one's own body, <ls>Kāty.</ls>; <ab>Pot.</ab> 1. <ab>sg.</ab> -घ्नीय, <ls>Pat.</ls> on <ls>Pāṇ. i, 1, 62</ls>; <ls>Daś.</ls>) <div n="to"/>to strike at, hit, beat; <div n="to"/>to attack, assault, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>TS.</ls>; <ls>ĀśvGṛ.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls> &c.: (<ab>Ā.</ab>) <div n="to"/>to strike one's self (or any part of one's body), <ls>BhP.</ls>; <ls>Pāṇ.</ls> and <ab>Comm.</ab> <ls>Bhaṭṭ.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to make away with one's self, <ls>Daś. 91, 15</ls>; <div n="to"/>to fasten, <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to beat or cause to sound (a drum &c.), <ls>TS.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls>; <ls>Bhaṭṭ.</ls> &c.: <div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab> आ-जङ्घन्ति, <ls>RV. vi, 75, 13</ls>, to strike at or beat violently.<info verb="pre" cp="PĀ" parse="A+han"/><L>[ID=28282]</L>
udaya: उद्-अय <lex>m.</lex> going up, rising<info lex="m"/><info hui="b"/><listinfo n="sup"/><L>[ID=32590]</L>
rising, rise (of the sun &c.), coming up (of a cloud), <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>KātyŚr.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=32592]</L>
the eastern mountain (behind which the sun is supposed to rise), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=32593]</L>
coming forth, becoming visible, appearance, development<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=32595]</L>
a following word, subsequent sound, <ls>Pāṇ. viii, 4, 67</ls>; <ls>RPrāt.</ls>; <ls>APrāt.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=32599]</L>
rising, reaching one's aim, elevation<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=32600]</L>
the orient sine (<ab>i.e.</ab> the sine of the point of the ecliptic on the eastern horizon), <ls>Sūryas.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=32605]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a mountain near <s1>Rāja-gṛha</s1>, <ls>MWB. 403 n. 1</ls><info n="sup"/><info lex="inh"/>
tadanna: तद्—अन्न (तद्-), <lex>mfn.</lex> accustomed to that food, <ls>RV. viii, 47, 16</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=82061]</L>
eating (that <ab>i.e.</ab>) the same food, <ls>R. ii, 103, 30</ls> and <ls n="R. ii,">140, 13.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
DAma: <hom>1.</hom> धाम <lex>m. <ab>pl.</ab></lex> <ab>N.</ab> of a class of superhuman beings, <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=100853]</L>
tara: <hom>1.</hom> तर an affix forming the <ab>compar.</ab> degree of adjectives and rarely (<ab>cf.</ab> वृत्र-तर) of substantives, <ls>Suśr. i, 20, 11</ls><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=83021]</L>
(आम्), added (in older language) to adverbs (see अति-तराम् &c.) and (in later language) to verbs (<ls>Pañcat. i, 14, 7</ls>; <ls>Ratnāv. iii, 9</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls>), intensifying their meaning
तर <lex>ind.</lex> with न, not at all, <ls>BhP. x, 46, 43.</ls><info lex="ind"/>

<hom>2.</hom> तर <lex>mfn.</lex> (√ तॄ; <ab>g.</ab> पचा<स्र्स्>दि) carrying across or beyond, saving (?, said of <s1>Śiva</s1>), <ls>MBh. xii, 10380</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=83023]</L>

तर <lex>m.</lex> crossing, passage, <ls>RV. ii, 13, 12</ls>; <ls n="RV.">viii, 96, 1</ls>; <ls>Mn. viii, 404</ls> and <ls n="Mn. viii,">407</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls> (<ab>ifc.</ab>), <ls>MBh. xii</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=83027]</L>
तर <lex>m.</lex> (अ-तर <lex type="phw">mfn.</lex> ‘impassable’), <ls>Bhaṭṭ. vii, 55</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> दुस्-)<info phwchild="2532.01"/><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=83028]</L>
तर <lex>m.</lex> ‘excelling, conquering’, see दुष्-टर, सु-तर, दुस्-<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=83029]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a magical spell (against evil spirits supposed to possess certain weapons), <ls>R. i, 30, 4</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=83033]</L>
cara: चर <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>g.</ab> पचा<स्र्स्>दि) moving, locomotive (as animals opposed to plants, or as the <s1>Karaṇa</s1>s in <ab>astrol.</ab>), <ls>VPrāt.</ls>; <ls>ŚvetUp. iii, 18</ls>; <ls>Mn. vii, 15</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f:n"/><listinfo n="sup"/><L>[ID=72174]</L>
(= संचारिन्) forming the retinue of any one, <ls>BhP. iv, 29, 23</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=72175]</L>

<ab>ifc.</ab> going, walking, wandering, being, living, practising (<ab>e.g.</ab> अधश्-, अन्त-, अन्तरिक्ष-, अप्-, आदाय-, उदके-, &c.; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 2, 16</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=72177]</L>

चर <lex>mf(ई)n.</lex> <ab>ifc.</ab> (<ls>Pāṇ. v, 3, 53 f.</ls>; <ls n="Pāṇ.">vi, 3, 35 f.</ls>) having been formerly (<ab>e.g.</ab> आढ्य-, देवदत्त-, <ab>qq.vv.</ab>; अ-दृष्ट- or नदृष्ट-, ‘not seen before’, <ls>Kathās.</ls> [once <lex type="hwinfo">f.</lex> <ab>irr.</ab> आ, <ls n="Kathās.">lx, 58</ls>] <ls>Sarvad. iii, 16</ls>; <ls n="Sarvad.">vii, 19</ls>; अन्-आलोकित- <ab>id.</ab>, <ls>Bālar. iv, 54/55</ls>)<info lex="m:f#I:n"/><L>[ID=72178]</L>
चर <lex>m.</lex> a spy, secret emissary or agent, <ls>Mn. vii, 122</ls>; <ls>Hariv. 10316</ls>; <ls>R.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=72179]</L>
a game played with dice (similar to backgammon), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=72184]</L>

(in <ab>astron.</ab>, read, ‘the difference of time between the rising of a heavenly body at <s1>Laṅkā</s1> or Ceylon, over which the first meridian passes, and that of its rising at any <ab>partic.</ab> place’).<info n="sup"/><info lex="inh"/>
rava: रव <lex>m.</lex> (√ <hom>1.</hom> रु) a roar, yell, cry, howl (of animals, wild beasts &c.), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=175305]</L>
any noise or sound (<ab>e.g.</ab> the whizz of a bow, the ringing of a bell &c.), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=175311]</L>
dara: दर <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ls>Pāṇ. iii, 3, 58</ls>) (√ दॄ) <ab>ifc.</ab>, cleaving, breaking See पुरं-दर, भगं-<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=90371]</L>
a conch-shell, <ls>BhP. i</ls>, <ls n="BhP.">v f.</ls>, <ls n="BhP.">x</ls>; <ls>Kramadīp.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
idDa: इद्ध <lex>mfn.</lex> kindled, lighted, alight<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="b"/><listinfo n="sup"/><L>[ID=29259]</L>
acala: <ab>N.</ab> of <s1>Śiva</s1> and of the first of the nine deified persons, called ‘white <s1>Bala</s1>s’ among the <s1>Jaina</s1>s<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=1794]</L>
namana: नमन <lex>mfn.</lex> bending, bowing (<ab>ifc.</ab>), <ls>Śiś. vi, 30</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> नृ-)<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=103837]</L>
tana: तन <lex>n.</lex> offspring, posterity, <ls n="RV.">i, 39, 7</ls>; <ls n="RV.">viii, 18, 18</ls> and <ls n="RV. viii,">25, 2</ls>; <ls>AV. vii, 73, 5</ls> (°नाया for °नाय)<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=82251]</L>
lAsam: लास <lex>m.</lex> the act of jumping, sporting, dancing, <ls>Ṛt.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> रास)<info lex="m"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=182015]</L>
dancing as practised by women, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=182016]</L>
लास लासिन्, लास्य See <pcol>p. 899, col. 2</pcol>.<info hui="b"/><L>[ID=182319]</L>
ta[m]: तम् <ab>cl.</ab> 4. ताम्यति (<ls>Pāṇ. vii, 3, 74</ls>; rarely <ab>Ā.</ab> <ls>R. ii, 63, 46</ls>; <ls>Gīt. v, 16</ls>; <ab>pf.</ab> तताम, <ls>ŚBr. iv</ls>; <ab>aor.</ab> <ab>Pass.</ab> अतमि, <ls>Pāṇ. vii, 3, 34</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>; <lang>Ved.</lang> <ab>inf.</ab> तमितोस्, with आ preceding, ‘till exhaustion’, <ls>TBr. i, 4, 4, 2</ls>; <ls>TāṇḍyaBr. xii</ls>; <ls>Lāṭy.</ls>; <ls>Āp.</ls>; <ab>pf.</ab> <ab>Pass.</ab> <ab>p.</ab> -तान्त, <ab>q.v.</ab>) <div n="to"/>to gasp for breath (as one suffocating), choke, be suffocated, faint away, be exhausted, perish, be distressed or disturbed or perplexed, <ls>RV. ii, 30, 7</ls> (न मा तमत् [<ab>aor.</ab> <ab>subj.</ab>] ‘may I not be exhausted’), <ls>Kāṭh.</ls>; <ls>TBr.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to stop (as breath), become immovable or stiff, <ls>Suśr.</ls>; <ls>Mālatīm.</ls>; <ls>Amar.</ls>; <ls>Rājat. v, 344</ls>; <div n="to"/>to desire (<ab>cf.</ab> <hom>2.</hom> °म, °मत), <ls>Dhātup. xxvi, 93</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> तमयति (<ab>aor.</ab> <ab>Pass.</ab> अतामि, <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 4, 93</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>) to suffocate, deprive of breath, <ls>ŚBr. iii, 3, 2, 19</ls> and <ls n="ŚBr. iii,">8, 1, 15</ls>; <ls>KātyŚr. vi, 5, 18</ls>; <div n="vp"/> <ab>cf.</ab> अ-तमेरु.<info westergaard="tamu,26.93,04.0100"/><info whitneyroots="tam,61"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="4Ā"/><L>[ID=82867]</L>
Ana: exhaling the breath through the nose, <ls>T.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=24316]</L>
inhalation, breath inspired, breathing, blowing, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=24317]</L>
Sam: <hom>1.</hom> शम् <ab>cl.</ab> 4. <ab>P.</ab> (<ls>Dhātup. xxvi, 92</ls>), शाम्यति (rarely °ते, and <lang>ep.</lang> also शमति, °ते; <lang>Ved.</lang> शम्यति, शिम्यति, and <ab>cl.</ab> 9. शम्नाति [<ls>Naigh. ii, 9</ls>], शम्नीषे, शम्नीथास् <ab>Impv.</ab> शम्नीष्व, शमीष्व, शमिष्व, शमीध्वम्; <ab>pf.</ab> शशाम, शेमुः, <ls>Br.</ls> &c.; शशमे <ab>Subj.</ab> शशमते, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ab>p.</ab> शशमान [<ab>q.v.</ab>]; <ab>aor.</ab> अशमिष्ठास्, <ls>RV.</ls>; अशमत्, <ls>Br.</ls> [<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>pres.</ab>]; <ab>Prec.</ab> शम्यात् <ab>Gr.</ab>; <ab>fut.</ab> शमिता, शमिष्यति, <ls>ib.</ls>; <ab>ind.p.</ab> शमित्वा, शान्त्वा, शामम् or शमम्, <ls>ib.</ls>), <div n="to"/>to toil at, fatigue or exert one's self (<ab>esp.</ab> in performing ritual acts), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>TBr.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to prepare, arrange, <ls>VS.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to become tired, finish, stop, come to an end, rest, be quiet or calm or satisfied or contented, <ls>TS.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to cease, be allayed or extinguished, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/> <ab>cl.</ab> 9. (<ab>cf.</ab> above) to put an end to, hurt, injure, destroy, <ls>Kāṭh.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Pass.</ab> शम्यते (<ab>aor.</ab> अशमि), <ls>Pāṇ. vii, 3, 34</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> शमयति (<ab>mc.</ab> also शामयति; <ab>aor.</ab> अशीशमत्; <ab>Pass.</ab> शाम्यते), <div n="to"/>to appease, allay, alleviate, pacify, calm, soothe, settle, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.; <div n="to"/>to put to an end or to death, kill, slay, destroy, remove, extinguish, suppress, <ls>TS.</ls> &c. &c.; <div n="to"/>to leave off, desist, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to conquer, subdue, <ls>Kālid.</ls>; <ls>Bhaṭṭ.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Desid.</ab> शिशमिषति <ab>Gr.</ab>: <div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab> शंशमीति (<ls>Bālar.</ls>), शंशम्यते, शंशन्ति (<ab>Gr.</ab>), to be entirely appeased or extinguished (<ab>pf.</ab> शंशमां चक्रुः, <ls>Bhaṭṭ.</ls>). [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang>Gk.</lang> <gk>κάμνω</gk>], <info westergaard="Samu,26.92,04.0099"/><info whitneyroots="Sam1,171;Sam2,171;Sam3,171"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="4P,9"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=212911]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> शम् <lex>ind.</lex> (<ab>g.</ab> चा<स्र्स्>दि and स्वर्-आदि) auspiciously, fortunately, happily, well (frequently used in the <s1>Veda</s1>, rarely in later language; often to be translated by a <ab>subst.</ab>, <ab>esp.</ab> in the frequent phrase शं योः or शं च योश् च, ‘happiness and welfare’, sometimes joined with the verbs भू, अस्, कृ, दा, वह्, या, sometimes occurring without any verb; with <ab>dat.</ab> or <ab>gen.</ab> [<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. ii, 3, 73</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>]; in some cases corresponding to an <ab>adj.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> शं तद् अस्मै, that is pleasant to him), <ls>RV.</ls>; &c.<info lex="ind"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=213058]</L>
ha: 1. ह the thirty-third and last consonant of the Nāgarī alphabet (in Pāṇini's system belonging to the guttural class, and usually pronounced like the English h in hard; it is not an original letter, but is mostly derived from an older घ्, rarely from ध् or भ्).[ID=260028]
<hom>2.</hom> ह <lex>m.</lex> (only <ls>L.</ls>) a form of <s1>Śiva</s1> or <s1>Bhairava</s1> (<ab>cf.</ab> नकुली<स्र्स्>श)<info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=260031]</L>
a cipher (<ab>i.e.</ab> the arithmetical figure which symbolizes o)<info lex="inh"/>
the sparkling of a gem<info lex="inh"/>
calling, calling to the sound of a lute<info lex="inh"/>

<hom>3.</hom> ह <lex>ind.</lex> (<ab>prob.</ab> <ab>orig.</ab> identical with <hom>2.</hom> घ, and used as a particle for emphasizing a preceding word, <ab>esp.</ab> if it begins a sentence closely connected with another; very frequent in the <s1>Brāhmaṇa</s1>s and <s1>Sūtra</s1>s, and often translatable by) indeed, assuredly, verily, of course, then &c. (often with other particles, <ab>e.g.</ab> with त्व् एव, उ, स्म, वै &c.; न ह, ‘not indeed’; also with interrogatives and relatives, <ab>e.g.</ab> यद् ध, ‘when indeed’; कद् ध, ‘what then?’ sometimes with <ab>impf.</ab> or <ab>pf.</ab> [<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 2, 116</ls>]; in later language very commonly used as a mere expletive, <ab>esp.</ab> at the end of a verse), <ls>RV.</ls>; &c.<info lex="ind"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=260032]</L>
<hom>4.</hom> ह <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ हन्) killing, destroying, removing (only <ab>ifc.</ab>; see अराति-, वृत्र-, शत्रुह &c.)<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><info hui="4"/><L>[ID=260033]</L>
<hom>5.</hom> ह <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>3.</hom> हा) abandoning, deserting, avoiding (<ab>ifc.</ab>; see अन्-ओक- and वापी-ह)<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><info hui="5"/><L>[ID=260034]</L>
ra: 1. र the 2nd semivowel (corresponding to the vowels ऋ and ॠ, and having the sound of r in ring).[ID=173008]
<hom>3.</hom> र <lex>mfn.</lex> (√ रा) acquiring, possessing, <ls>Naiṣ.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=173016]</L>
र <lex>n.</lex> brightness, splendour (used in explaining an etymology), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=173025]</L>
nAman: नामन् <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>prob.</ab> neither <ab>fr.</ab> √ ज्ञा nor <ab>fr.</ab> √ म्ना [<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Uṇ. iv, 150</ls>]; <ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f.</lex> either = <lex type="hwinfo">m.</lex> or °म्नी) a characteristic mark or sign, form, nature, kind, manner, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls><info lex="f:n"/><L>[ID=105825]</L>

personal name (as <ab>opp.</ab> to गोत्रे, family <ab n="name">n°</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> नम-गोत्र above), <ls>Kāś.</ls> on <ls>Pāṇ. viii, 2, 23</ls> (often <ab>ifc.</ab> = named, called, <ab>e.g.</ab> विष्णु-शर्म-नामा पण्डितः, a sage named <s1 n="ViṣṇuŚarma">V°</s1>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=105827]</L>

merely the <ab n="name">n°</ab> (as <ab>opp.</ab> to reality; <ab>cf.</ab> नाम-धारक, -मात्र, -शेष &c.), a noun (as <ab>opp.</ab> to a verb), <ls>Nir.</ls>; <ls>Prāt.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=105828]</L>
substance, essence (in the <s1>Mīmāṃsā</s1> <ab>phil.</ab> <ab>opp.</ab> to गुण, accidental quality)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=105829]</L>
a good or great name, renown, fame (only <ab>ifc.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> स्व-, सुमन्तु-)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=105830]</L>
kam: <hom>1.</hom> कम् <lex>ind.</lex> (<lang>Gk.</lang> <gk>κεν</gk>) well (opposed to अ-कम्, ‘ill’), <ls>TS.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c.<info lex="ind"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=43756]</L>

a particle placed after the word to which it belongs with an affirmative sense, ‘yes’, ‘well’ (but this sense is generally so weak that Indian grammarians are perhaps right in enumerating कम् among the expletives, <ls>Nir.</ls>; it is often found attached to a <ab>dat.</ab> case, giving to that case a stronger meaning, and is generally placed at the end of the <s1>Pāda</s1>, <ab>e.g.</ab> अजीजन ओषधीर् भोजनाय कम्, thou didst create the plants for actual food, <ls>RV. v, 83, 10</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>TS. v</ls><info lex="inh"/>

कम् is also used as an enclitic with the particles नु, सु, and हि (but is treated in the <s1>Pada-pāṭha</s1> as a separate word; in this connection कम् has no accent but once, <ls>AV. vi, 110, 1</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
a particle of interrogation (like कद् and किम्), <ls>RV. x, 52, 3</ls><info lex="inh"/>
(sometimes, like किम् and कद्, at the beginning of compounds) marking the strange or unusual character of anything or expressing reproach, <ls>L.</ls> <pb n="252,1"/><info lex="inh"/>

<hom>2.</hom> कम् <ab>cl.</ab> 1. <ab>Ā.</ab> (not used in the conjugational tenses) चकमे, कमिता, कमिष्यते, अचकमत, <ls>Dhātup. xii, 10</ls> to wish, desire, long for, <ls>RV. v, 36, 1</ls>; <ls n="RV.">x, 117, 2</ls>; <ls>AV. xix, 52, 3</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>Ragh.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to love, be in love with, have sexual intercourse with, <ls>ŚBr. xi</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> <ab>Ā.</ab> (<lang>ep.</lang> also <ab>P.</ab>) कामयते, -ति, कामयां-चक्रे, अचीकमत, &c.; <div n="to"/>to wish, desire, long for (with <ab>acc.</ab> or <ab>inf.</ab> or <ab>Pot.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 3, 157</ls>; <ab>e.g.</ab> कामये भुञ्जीत भवान्, I wish your worship may eat; कामये दातुम्, I wish to give, <ls>Kāś.</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>TS.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to love, be in love with, have sexual intercourse with, <ls>RV. x, 124, 5</ls>; <ls n="RV. x,">125, 5</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to cause any one to love, <ls>Ṛtus.</ls> (in that sense <ab>P.</ab> <ls>Vop.</ls>); <div n="to"/> (with बहु or अत्य्-अर्थम्) to rate or value highly, <ls>R.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Desid.</ab> चिकमिषते and चिकामयिषते: <div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab> चंकम्यते; <info westergaard="kamu,12.10,01.0295"/><info whitneyroots="kam,17"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="1Ā,1P"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=43768]</L>

कम् [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang>Lat.</lang> <etym>comis</etym>; also <etym>amo</etym>, with the loss of the initial, for <etym>camo</etym>; <etym>câ-rus</etym> for <etym>cam-rus</etym>: <lang>Hib.</lang> <etym>caemh</etym>, ‘love, desire; fine, handsome, pleasant’; <etym>caomhach</etym>, ‘a friend, companion’; <etym>caomhaim</etym>, ‘I save, spare, protect’; <lang>Armen.</lang> <etym>kamim</etym>.]
jaya: जय <lex>mfn.</lex> (√ जि) <ab>ifc.</ab> conquering, winning See ऋतं-, कृतं-, धनं-जय, पुरं-, शत्रुं-<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=77322]</L>

जय <lex>m.</lex> (<ls>Pāṇ. iii, 3, 56</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>) conquest, victory, triumph, winning, being victorious (in battle or in playing with dice or in a lawsuit), <ls>AV. vii, 50, 8</ls>; <ls>ŚBr. vi</ls>; <ls>Mn. vii</ls> (इन्द्रियाणांज्° victory over or restraint of the senses) & <ls n="Mn.">x</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=77323]</L>
<ab>cf.</ab> आत्म-, प्रा<स्र्स्>ण-, रुग्-<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77324]</L>

जय <lex>m. <ab>pl.</ab></lex> (<ab>parox.</ab>) <ab>N.</ab> of particular verses causing victory (personified as deities, <ls>VāyuP. ii, 6, 4 ff.</ls>), <ls>MaitrS. i, 4, 14</ls>; <ls>TS. iii</ls>; <ls>PārGṛ. i, 5</ls>; <ls>Nyāyam. iii, 4, 24</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=77325]</L>
जय <lex>m.</lex> <ab>sg.</ab> <bot>Premna spinosa</bot> or <bot>longifolia</bot>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=77326]</L>
a yellow variety of <bot>Phaseolus Mungo</bot>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77327]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of the 3rd year of the 6th lustrum of the <s1>Bṛhaspati</s1> cycle, <ls>VarBṛS. viii, 38</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77328]</L>
a kind of flute<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77329]</L>
(in music) a kind of measure<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77330]</L>
the sun, <ls>MBh. iii, 154</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77331]</L>
<s1>Arjuna</s1> (son of <s1>Pāṇḍu</s1>), <ls n="MBh. iii,">266, 7</ls> and <ls n="MBh.">iv, 5, 35</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77332]</L>
<s1>Indra</s1>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77333]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of a <s1>Ṛṣi</s1> (author of <ls>RV. x, 180</ls>; son of <s1>Aṅgiras</s1> [<ls>RAnukr.</ls>] or of <s1>Indra</s1>; living under the 10th <s1>Manu</s1>, <ls>BhP. viii, 13, 22</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77334]</L>
of a spirit, <ls>VarBṛS. liii, 48</ls>; <ls>Hcat. i, 9, 149</ls> and <ls n="Hcat. i, 9,">172</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77335]</L>
of an attendant of <s1>Viṣṇu</s1>, <ls>BhP. iii, 16, 2</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77336]</L>
of a <s1>Nāga</s1>, <ls>MBh. v, 3632</ls>; <ls n="MBh.">ix, 2554</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77337]</L>
of a <s1>Dānava</s1>, <ls>Hariv. 13093</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77338]</L>

of a son (of <s1>Dhṛtarāṣṭra</s1>, <ls>MBh. i</ls>, <ls n="MBh.">vii</ls>; of <s1>Sṛñjaya</s1>, <ls>Hariv. 1514</ls>; of <s1>Suśruta</s1>, <ls>VP. iv, 5, 12</ls>; of <s1>Sruta</s1>, <ls>BhP. ix, 13, 25</ls>; of <s1>Saṃjaya</s1>, <ls n="BhP. ix,">17, 16</ls>; of <s1>Saṃkṛti</s1>, <ls n="BhP. ix, 7,">18</ls>; of <s1>Mañju</s1>, <ls n="BhP. ix,">21, 1</ls>; of <s1>Yuyudhāna</s1>, <ls n="BhP. ix,">24, 13</ls>; of <s1>Kaṅka</s1>, <ls n="BhP. ix, 24,">43</ls>; of <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1>, <ls n="BhP.">x, 61, 17</ls>; of <s1>Vatsara</s1> by <s1>Svar-vīthi</s1>, <ls n="BhP.">iv, 13, 12</ls>; of <s1>Viśvāmitra</s1>, <ls>Hariv. 1462</ls>; <ls>BhP. ix, 16, 36</ls>; of <s1>Purūravas</s1> by <s1>Urvaśī</s1>, <ls n="BhP. ix,">15, 1 f.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77339]</L>
of an ancient king (11th <s1>Cakravartin</s1> in <s1>Bhārata</s1>, <ls>L.</ls>), <ls>MBh. ii, 326</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77340]</L>
of a <s1>Pāṇḍava</s1> hero, <ls n="MBh.">vii, 6911</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77341]</L>
of <s1>Yudhiṣṭhira</s1> at <s1>Virāṭa</s1>'s court, <ls n="MBh.">iv, 176</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77342]</L>
of <s1>Aśoka</s1> in a former birth, <ls>Divyāv. xxvi, 336 f.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77343]</L>
of a carpenter, <ls>Rājat. iii, 351</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77344]</L>
ana: <hom>1.</hom> अन्-, occasionally अन-, (before a vowel) the substitute for <hom>3.</hom> अ, or अ privative.
hAna: <hom>1.</hom> हान <lex>mfn.</lex> gone or departed &c. (in संहान, ‘risen’), <ls>VS.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=262504]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> हान <lex>n.</lex> the act of abandoning, relinquishing, giving up, escaping, getting rid of <ls>Gaut.</ls>; <ls>Śaṃk.</ls>; <ls>Sarvad.</ls><info lex="n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=262516]</L>
vanA: वना <lex>f.</lex> the piece of wood used for kindling fire by attrition (= अरणि, <ab>q.v.</ab>; sometimes personified), <ls>RV. iii, 13</ls><info lex="f"/><L>[ID=185732]</L>
raRa: <hom>1.</hom> रण <lex>m.</lex> delight, pleasure, gladness, joy, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=174076]</L>
रण <lex>n.</lex> battle (as an object of delight), war, combat, fight, conflict, <ls>RV.</ls>; &c.<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=174077]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> रण <lex>m.</lex> (for <hom>1.</hom> See <pcol>p. 863, col. 3</pcol>) sound, noise, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=174198]</L>
the quill or bow of a lute (= कोण), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=174199]</L>
A: 1. आ the second vowel of the alphabet corresponding to the a in far.[ID=22010]
<hom>2.</hom> आ <lex>ind.</lex> a particle of reminiscence, <ls>Pāṇ. i, 1, 14</ls>; <ls>Pat.</ls><info lex="ind"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=22011]</L>

also of compassion or pain [more correctly written <hom>1.</hom> आस्, <ab>q.v.</ab>], and of assent, <ls>L.</ls> [This particle remains unaltered in orthography even before vowels (which causes it to be sometimes confounded with <hom>1.</hom> आस्), <ls>Pāṇ. i, 1, 14.</ls>]<info lex="inh"/>
<hom>3.</hom> आ <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of <s1>Śiva</s1>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=22012]</L>
grandfather, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=22013]</L>
आ <lex>f.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of <s1>Lakṣmī</s1>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="f"/><L>[ID=22014]</L>

<hom>4.</hom> आ (as a prefix to verbs, especially of motion, and their derivatives) near, near to, towards (see आ-√ क्रम् &c.; in the <s1>Veda</s1>, of course, the prefix is separable from the verb; in a few cases, <ls>RV. i, 10, 11</ls> and <ls n="RV.">v, 64, 5</ls>, a verb in the imperative is to be supplied; with roots like गम्, या, and इ, ‘to go’, and <hom>1.</hom> दा, ‘to give’, it reverses the action; <ab>e.g.</ab> आ-गच्छति, ‘he comes’; आ-दत्ते, ‘he takes’). (As a <ab>prep.</ab> with a preceding <ab>acc.</ab>) near to, towards, to, <ls>RV.</ls><info hui="4"/><L>[ID=22015]</L>
(with a preceding noun in the <ab>acc.</ab>, as जोषम् or वरम्) for, <ls>RV.</ls>
(with a following <ab>acc.</ab>) up to … exclusively, <ls>AitBr.</ls>
(with a preceding <ab>abl.</ab>) from, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>
out of, from among (<ab>e.g.</ab> बहुभ्य आ, ‘from among many’), <ls>RV.</ls>
towards (only in अस्मद् आ, ‘towards us’), <ls>RV.</ls>
(with a following <ab>abl.</ab> <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. ii, 1, 13</ls> & <ls n="Pāṇ. ii">3, 10</ls>) up to, to, as far as, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls> &c.
from, <ls>RV. i, 30, 21</ls>

(with a preceding <ab>loc.</ab>) in, at, on <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls> (As an <ab>adv.</ab> after words expressing a number or degree) fully, really, indeed (<ab>e.g.</ab> त्रिर् आ दिवस्, ‘quite or fully three times a day’; महिमा वाम् इन्द्रा<स्र्स्>ग्नी पनिष्ठ आ,, ‘your greatness, O <s1>Indra</s1> and <s1>Agni</s1>, is most praiseworthy indeed’, &c.), <ls>RV.</ls>
(after a <ab>subst.</ab> or <ab>adj.</ab>) ‘as, like’, (or it simply strengthens the sense of the preceding word), <ls>RV.</ls>, (after a verb), <ls>RV. v, 7, 7</ls>; <ls>KenaUp.</ls> <pb n="126,2"/>

(as a conjunctive particle) moreover, further, and (it is placed either between the two words connected [rarely after the second, <ls>RV. x, 16, 11</ls>, or after both, <ls>RV. x, 92, 8</ls>] or, if there are more, after the last [<ls>RV. iv, 57, 1</ls> and <ls n="RV.">x, 75, 5</ls>]; see also आ<स्र्स्>तश् च <ab>s.v.</ab>) In <lang>classical Sanskṛt</lang> it may denote the limit ‘to’, ‘until’, ‘as far as’, ‘from’, either not including the object named or including it (sometimes with <ab>acc.</ab> or <ab>abl.</ab> or forming an <ab>adv.</ab>) <ab>e.g.</ab> आ-मरणम् or आ-मरणात्, ‘till death’, <ls>Pañcat.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> आ-मरणा<स्र्स्>न्त &c.)
आ-गोपाला द्विजातयः, ‘the twice-born including the cowherds’, <ls>MBh. ii, 531</ls>
आ-समुद्रम् or आ-समुद्रात्, ‘as far as the ocean’ or ‘from the ocean’ (but not including it)
आ-कुमारम्, ‘from a child’ or ‘from childhood’ or ‘to a child’ (<ab>cf.</ab> <lang>Lat.</lang> <etym>a puero</etym>), <ls>MBh. iii, 1403</ls>
आ-कुमारम् यशः पाणिनेः, ‘the fame of <s1>Pāṇini</s1> extends even to children’
आ आजानु-बाहु <lex type="nhw">mfn.</lex> ‘one whose arms reach down to the knees’, <ls>R. i, 1, 12</ls>
आ (see also आकर्ण- and आजन्म-)

आ (<ab>cf.</ab> आ-जरसम्, आ-व्युषम्, आ-सप्तम, ओ<स्र्स्>त्सूर्यम्.) Prefixed to <ab>adj.</ab> [rarely to <ab>subst.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> आ-कोप] it implies diminution, <ls>Pāṇ. ii, 2, 18</ls> <ab>Comm.</ab> ‘a little’ <ab>e.g.</ab> आ-पिञ्जर <lex type="nhw">mfn.</lex> a little red, reddish, <ls>Ragh. xvi, 51</ls>

आ (see also आ-पक्व, ओ<स्र्स्>ष्ण, &c.) Some commentaries (<ab>e.g.</ab> <ab>Comm.</ab> on <ls>Ragh. iii, 8</ls>) occasionally give to आ in this application the meaning समन्तात्, ‘all through, completely’, as आ-नील, ‘blue all round’.
Ka: <hom>1.</hom> ख the second consonant of the alphabet (being the aspirate of the preceding consonant; often in <ab>MSS.</ab> & <ls>Inscr.</ls> confounded with ष).<info hui="1"/><L>[ID=60669]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> ख अम्, <lex>m.</lex> the sun, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=60671]</L>
<hom>3.</hom> ख <lex>n.</lex> (√ खन्) a cavity, hollow, cave, cavern, aperture, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="n"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=60672]</L>

an aperture of the human body (of which there are nine, <ab>viz.</ab> the mouth, the two ears, the two eyes, the two nostrils, and the organs of excretion and generation), <ls>AV. xiv, 2, 1</ls> and <ls n="AV. xiv, 2,">6</ls>; <ls>Prāt.</ls>; <ls>KaṭhUp.</ls>; <ls>Gaut.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=60673]</L>
(hence) an organ of sense, <ls>BhP. viii, 3, 23</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=60674]</L>
(in <ab>anat.</ab>) the glottis, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=60675]</L>
‘the hole made by an arrow’, wound, <ls>Mn. ix, 43</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=60676]</L>
the hole in the nave of a wheel through which the axis runs, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr. xiv</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=60677]</L>
vacuity, empty space, air, ether, sky, <ls>ŚBr. xiv</ls>; <ls>PraśnUp.</ls>; <ls>Mn. xii, 120</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=60678]</L>

manas: मनस् <lex>n.</lex> mind (in its widest sense as applied to all the mental powers), intellect, intelligence, understanding, perception, sense, conscience, will, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (in <ab>phil.</ab> the internal organ or अन्तः-करण of perception and cognition, the faculty or instrument through which thoughts enter or by which objects of sense affect the soul, <ls>IW. 53</ls>; in this sense मनस् is always regarded as distinct from आत्मन् and पुरुष, ‘spirit or soul’ and belonging only to the body, like which it is — except in the <s1>Nyāya</s1> — considered perishable; as to its position in the various systems See for <s1>Nyāya</s1> and <s1>Vaiśeṣika</s1>, <ls>IW. 63</ls>; <ls n="IW.">67</ls>; <ls n="IW.">76</ls>, for <s1>Sāṃkhya</s1> and <s1>Vedānta</s1>, <ls>ib.</ls> <ls n="IW.">84</ls>; <ls n="IW.">109</ls>; <ls n="IW.">117</ls>; in <ls>RV.</ls> it is sometimes joined with हृद् or हृदय, the heart, <ls>Mn. vii, 6</ls> with चक्षुस्, the eye)<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=156776]</L>
the spirit or spiritual principle, the breath or living soul which escapes from the body at death (called असु in animals; <ab>cf.</ab> above), <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=156777]</L>

thought, imagination, excogitation, invention, reflection, opinion, intention, inclination, affection, desire, mood, temper, spirit, <ls>ib.</ls> (<ab>ifc.</ab> after a verbal noun or an <ab>inf.</ab> stem in °तु = having a mind or wishing to; <ab>cf.</ab> द्रष्टु-म्° &c.; मनः √ कृ, to make up one's mind; with <ab>gen.</ab>, to feel inclination for <pb n="784,1"/>; मनः √ कृ, प्र-√ कृ, √ धा, vi-√ धा, √ धृ, √ बन्ध् and <ab>Caus.</ab> of नि-√ विश् with <ab>loc.</ab> <ab>dat.</ab> <ab>acc.</ab> with प्रति, or <ab>inf.</ab>, to direct the mind or thoughts towards, think of or upon; मनः with सम्-आ-√ धा, to recover the senses, collect one's self; with √ हन् See मनो-हत्य; मनसा <lex type="phw">ind.</lex> in the mind; in thought or imagination; with all the heart, willingly; with <ab>gen.</ab>, by the leave of; with इव = °से<स्र्स्>व, as with a thought, in a moment; with √ मन्, to think in one's mind, be willing or inclined; with सं-√ गम्, to become unanimous, agree; मनसि with √ कृ, to bear or ponder in the mind, meditate on, remember; with नि-√ धा, to impress on the mind, consider; with √ वृत्, to be passing in one's mind)<info phwchild="156781.1"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=156778]</L>
da: <hom>1.</hom> द the 3rd and soft letter of the 4th or dental class.<info hui="1"/><L>[ID=89217]</L>

(<ab>cf.</ab> अग्नि-; अ-दोम-द; अन्न-, अर्थ-, गर्भ-, जन्म- &c.)<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=89219]</L>

a metal or mineral in a state of fusion (<ab>cf.</ab> उप-, महा-र्°)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=175500]</L>

(in <ab>rhet.</ab>) the taste or character of a work, the feeling or sentiment prevailing in it (from 8 to 10 <s1>Rasa</s1>s are generally enumerated, <ab>viz.</ab> शृङ्गार, love; वीर, heroism; बीभत्स, disgust; रौद्र, anger or fury; हास्य, mirth; भयानक, terror; करुण, pity; अद्भुत, wonder; शान्त, tranquillity or contentment; वात्सल्य, paternal fondness; the last or last two are sometimes omitted; <ab>cf.</ab> under भाव), <ls>Bhar.</ls>; <ls>Daśar.</ls>; <ls>Kāvyād.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=175513]</L>
