a leaf (regarded as the plumage of a tree), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>, but in <ab>N.</ab> of plants <lex type="hwifc">f(ई). </lex>; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. iv, 1, 64</ls>)<info lex="f#A:f#I"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=119473]</L>

पर्ण <lex>m.</lex> <bot>Butea Frondosa</bot> (a large-leaved sacred tree whose wood is used for making sacred vessels, later generally called पलाश), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>Br.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls> (-त्व <lex type="phw">n.</lex>, <ls>MaitrS.</ls>)<info phwchild="119492.1"/><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=119475]</L>
पर्ण <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of a teacher, <ls>VāyuP.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>g.</ab> शिवा<स्र्स्>दि)<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=119476]</L>

पर्ण [According to <ls>Uṇ. iv, 6</ls> <ab>fr.</ab> √ पॄ. but more probably <ab>fr.</ab> a √ पृ, <ab>orig.</ab> स्पृ; <ab>cf.</ab> <lang>Lith.</lang> <etym>sparna</etym>; <lang>HGerm.</lang> <etym>varn</etym>, <etym>Farn</etym>; <lang>Angl.Sax.</lang> <etym>fearn</etym>; <lang>Eng.</lang> <etym>fern</etym>.]
kara: <hom>1.</hom> कर <lex>mf(ई, rarely आ)n.</lex> (for <hom>2.</hom> See <pcol>p. 254, col. 3</pcol>) (√ <hom>1.</hom> कृ), a doer, maker, causer, doing, making, causing, producing (<ab>esp.</ab> <ab>ifc.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> दुःखकर, भयं-क्°, सम्पत्-क्°, &c.; <ab>cf.</ab> <lang>Lat.</lang> <etym>cerus</etym>, ‘creator’), <ls>AV. xii, 2, 2</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f#A:f#I:n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=44037]</L>
कर <lex>m.</lex> the act of doing, making &c. (<ab>ifc.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> ईषत्कर, सु-क्°, दुष्-क्°, &c.)<info lex="m"/>
a measure (the breadth of twenty-four thumbs)<info lex="inh"/>
the claws of a crab, <ls>Hit.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
symbolical expression for the number two<info lex="inh"/>

<hom>2.</hom> कर <lex>m.</lex> (for <hom>1.</hom> See <pcol>p. 253, col. 1</pcol>) (√ कॄ), a ray of light, sunbeam, moonbeam, <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Megh.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=44366]</L>
royal revenue, toll, tax, tribute, duty, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/>
rada: रद <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab>) scratching, splitting, gnawing at, <ls>Ghaṭ.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=174790]</L>
रद <lex>m.</lex> the act of splitting or gnawing, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=174791]</L>
a tooth (and therefore <ab>N.</ab> of the number 32), <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>Var.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=174792]</L>
the tusk of an elephant, <ls>Var.</ls>; <ls>Nalod.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=174793]</L>
datta: <hom>2.</hom> दत्त <lex>mfn.</lex> (√ <hom>1.</hom> दा) given, granted, presented, <ls>RV. i f.</ls>, <ls n="RV.">viii</ls>, <ls n="RV.">x</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=89793]</L>

दत्त <lex>m.</lex> a short form [<ls>Pāṇ. v, 3, 83</ls>; <ls>Kār.</ls>; <ls>Pat.</ls>] of names so terminating (यज्ञ-, देव-, जय &c.) which chiefly are given to <s1>Vaiśya</s1> men, <ls n="Pāṇ.">vi, 2, 148</ls>; <ls n="Pāṇ.">v, 3, 78 ff.</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>; <ls>Mn. ii, 32</ls>; <ls>Kull.</ls>; <ls>Sāh. vi, 141</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=89796]</L>
(<ls>Pāṇ. vi, 1, 205</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>) <ab>N.</ab> of an ascetic, <ls>TāṇḍyaBr. xxv, 15, 3</ls> (snake-priest), <ls>MBh. xii, 10875</ls>; <ls>BhP. iv, 19, 6</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=89797]</L>
of a sage in the 2nd <s1>Manv-antara</s1>, 417<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=89800]</L>
of the 8th <s1>Tīrtha-kara</s1> of the past <s1>Utsarpiṇī</s1>, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=89802]</L>
दत्त <lex>n.</lex> a gift, donation, <ls>ChUp. v</ls>; <ls>BhP. i, 5, 22</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=89803]</L>
a: <hom>1.</hom> अ the first letter of the alphabet<info hui="1"/><L>[ID=1]</L>
the first short vowel inherent in consonants.
<hom>2.</hom> अ (प्रगृह्य, <ab>q.v.</ab>), a vocative particle [अ अनन्त, O <s1>Viṣṇu</s1>], <ls>T.</ls><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=3]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> अ (before a vowel अन्, <ab>exc.</ab> अ-ऋणिन्), a prefix corresponding to <lang>Gk.</lang> <gk>ἀ</gk>, <gk>ἀν</gk>, <lang>Lat.</lang> <etym>in</etym>, <lang>Goth.</lang> and <lang>Germ.</lang> <etym>un</etym>, <lang>Eng.</lang> <etym>in</etym> or <etym>un</etym>, and having a negative or privative or contrary sense (अन्-एक not one; अन्-अन्त endless; अ-सत् not good; अ-पश्यत् not seeing)<info hui="3"/><L>[ID=4]</L>

rarely prefixed to <ab>Inf.</ab> (अ-स्वप्तुम् not to sleep, <ls>TāṇḍyaBr.</ls>) and even to forms of the finite verb (अ-स्पृहयन्ति they do not desire, <ls>BhP.</ls>; <ls>Śiś.</ls>) and to pronouns (अ-सः not he, <ls>Śiś.</ls>; अ-तद् not that, <ls>BhP.</ls>)

rarely an expletive (<ab>cf.</ab> अ-कुप्य, अ-पूप). According to <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 2, 161</ls>, the accent may be optionally either on the first or last syllable in certain compounds formed with अ (as अ-तीक्ष्ण or अ-तीक्ष्ण, अ-शुचि or अ-शुचि, अन्-अन्न or अन्-अन्न)
the same applies to stems ending in तृ accentuated on the first syllable before अ is prefixed
<ab>cf.</ab> also अ-तूर्त and अ-तूर्त, अ-भिन्न and अ-भिन्न, &c.
<hom>4.</hom> अ the base of some pronouns and <ab>pronom.</ab> forms, in अस्य, अत्र, &c.<info lexcat="LEXID=pron,STEM=idam"/><info hui="4"/><L>[ID=5]</L>

<hom>5.</hom> अ the augment prefixed to the root in the formation of the imperfect, aorist, and conditional tenses (in the <s1>Veda</s1> often wanting, as in Homer, the fact being that originally the augment was only prefixed in principal sentences where it was accentuated, whilst it was dropped in subordinate sentences where the root-vowel took the accent).<info hui="5"/><L>[ID=6]</L>
<hom>6.</hom> अ <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of <s1>Viṣṇu</s1>, <ls>L.</ls> (especially as the first of the three sounds in the sacred syllable ओम्). <info lex="m"/><info hui="6"/><L>[ID=7]</L>
ya: 1. य the 1st semivowel (corresponding to the vowels इ and ई, and having the sound of the English y, in Bengal usually pronounced j).[ID=168971]
<hom>2.</hom> य <lex>m.</lex> (in prosody) a bacchic (˘ ¯ ¯), <ls>Piṅg.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=168975]</L>
<hom>3.</hom> य the actual base of the relative pronoun in declension [<ab>cf.</ab> यद् and <lang>Gk.</lang> <gk>ὅς</gk>, <gk>ἥ</gk>, <gk>ὅ</gk>].<info hui="3"/><L>[ID=168976]</L>
<hom>4.</hom> य <lex>m.</lex> (in some senses <ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> या, only, <ls>L.</ls>) a goer or mover<info lex="m"/><info hui="4"/><L>[ID=168983]</L>
na: <hom>1.</hom> न the dental nasal (found at the beginning of words and before or after dental consonants as well as between vowels; subject to conversion into ण, <ls>Pāṇ. viii, 4, 1</ls>-<ls n="Pāṇ. viii, 4">39</ls>).<info hui="1"/><L>[ID=102617]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> न <lex>ind.</lex> not, no, nor, neither, <ls>RV.</ls> (ना, <ls n="RV.">x, 34, 8</ls>) &c. &c. (as well in simple negation as in wishing, requesting and commanding, except in prohibition before an <ab>Impv.</ab> or an augmentless <ab>aor.</ab> [<ab>cf.</ab> <hom>1.</hom> मा]; in successive sentences or clauses either simply repeated, <ab>e.g.</ab> <ls>Mn. iv, 34</ls>; or strengthened by another particle, <ab>esp.</ab> at the second place or further on in the sentence, <ab>e.g.</ab> by उ [<ab>cf.</ab> नो<स्र्स्>], उत, अपि, चा<स्र्स्>पि, वा, वा<स्र्स्>पि or अथ वा, <ls>RV. i, 170, 1</ls>; <ls n="RV. i,">151, 9</ls>; <ls>Nal. iii, 24</ls>, &c.; it may even be replaced by च, वा, अपि च, अपि वा, &c. alone, as, <ls>Mn. ii, 98</ls>; <ls>Nal. i, 14</ls>, &c.; often joined with other particles, beside those mentioned above <ab>esp.</ab> with a following तु, त्व् एव, त्व् एव तु, चे<स्र्स्>द्, <ab>q.v.</ab>, खलु, <ab>q.v.</ab>, ह [<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>g.</ab> चा<स्र्स्>दि and <ls>Pāṇ. viii, 1, 31</ls>] &c.; before round or collective numbers and after any numeral in the <ab>instr.</ab> or <ab>abl.</ab> it expresses deficiency, <ab>e.g.</ab> एकया न विंशति, not 20 by 1 <ab>i.e.</ab> 19 <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; पञ्चभिर् न चत्वारि शतानि, 395 <ls>ib.</ls>; with another न or an अ <ab>priv.</ab> it generally forms a strong affirmation [<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Vām. v, 1, 9</ls>] <ab>e.g.</ab> ने<स्र्स्>यं न वक्ष्यति, she will most certainly declare, <ls>Śak. iii, 9</ls>; ना<स्र्स्>दण्ड्यो ऽस्ति, he must certainly be punished, <ls>Mn. viii, 335</ls>; it may also, like अ, form compounds, <ls>Vām. v, 2, 13</ls> [<ab>cf.</ab> below])<info lex="ind"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=102621]</L>
that not, lest, for fear lest (with <ab>Pot.</ab>), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Daś.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/>

like, as, as it were (only in <s1>Veda</s1> and later artificial language, <ab>e.g.</ab> गौरो न तृषितः पिब, drink like [<ab>lit.</ab> ‘not’ <ab>i.e.</ab> ‘although not being’] a thirsty deer; in this sense it does not coalesce metrically with a following vowel). <info lex="inh"/>
mA: मा <lex>f.</lex> a mother, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="f"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=153882]</L>
measure, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=153883]</L>
authority (-त्व <lex type="phw">n.</lex>), <ls>Nyāyam.</ls><info phwchild="153891.1"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=153884]</L>
light, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=153885]</L>
knowledge, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=153886]</L>
binding, fettering, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=153887]</L>
death, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=153888]</L>
a woman's waist, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=153889]</L>

<hom>1.</hom> मा <lex>ind.</lex> (causing a following छ् to be changed to च्छ्, <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 1, 74</ls>) not, that not, lest, would that not, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="ind"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=161686]</L>

a particle of prohibition or negation = <lang>Gk.</lang> <gk>μή</gk>, most commonly joined with the Subjunctive <ab>i.e.</ab> the augmentless form of a past tense (<ab>esp.</ab> of the <ab>aor.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> मा नो वधीर् इन्द्र, do not slay us, O <s1>Indra</s1>, <ls>RV.</ls>; मा भैषीः or मा भैः, do not be afraid, <ls>MBh.</ls>; तपोवन-वासिनाम् उपरोधो मा भूत्, let there not be any disturbance of the inhabitants of the sacred grove, <ls>Śak.</ls>; often also with स्म, <ab>e.g.</ab> मा स्म गमः, do not go, <ls>Bhag.</ls> <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 3, 175</ls>; <ls n="Pāṇ. iii, 3">176</ls>; in the sense of ‘that not, lest’ also यथा मा, <ab>e.g.</ab> यथा मा वो मृत्युः परि-व्यत्का इति, that death may not disturb you, <ls>PraśnaUp.</ls>; or मा यथा, <ab>e.g.</ab> मा भूत् काला<स्र्स्>त्ययो यथा, lest there be any loss of time, <ls>R.</ls>; मा न with <ab>aor.</ab> <ab>Subj.</ab> = <ab>Ind.</ab> without a negative, <ab>e.g.</ab> मा द्विषो न वधीर् मम, do slay my enemies, <ls>Bhaṭṭ.</ls> <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Vām. v, 1, 9</ls>; rarely with the augmentless <ab>impf.</ab> with or without स्म, <ab>e.g.</ab> मै<स्र्स्>नम् अभिभाषथाः, do not speak to him, <ls>R.</ls>; मा स्म करोत्, let him not do it, <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 4, 74</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>; exceptionally also with the <ab>Ind.</ab> of the <ab>aor.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab>, मा कालस् त्वाम् अत्य्-अगात्, may not the season pass by thee, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 4, 75</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>)

or with the <ab>Impv.</ab> (in <ls>RV.</ls> only <ls n="RV.">viii, 103, 6</ls>, मा नो हृणीताम् [<ls>SV.</ls> हृणीतास्] अग्निः, may <s1>Agni</s1> not be angry with us; but very often in later language, <ab>e.g.</ab> मा क्रन्द do not cry, <ls>MBh.</ls>; गच्छ वा मा वा, you can go or not go, <ls>ib.</ls>; रिपुर् अयम् मा जायताम्, may not this foe arise, <ls>Śāntiś.</ls>; also with स्म, <ab>e.g.</ab> मा स्म किं चिद् वचो वद do not speak a word, <ls>MBh.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/>
or with the <ab>Pot.</ab> (<ab>e.g.</ab> मा यमम् पश्येयम्, may I not see <s1>Yama</s1>; <ab>esp.</ab> माभुजेम in <ls>RV.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/>
or with the <ab>Prec.</ab> (only once in मा भूयात्, may it not be, <ls>R. [B.] ii, 75, 45</ls>)<info lex="inh"/>
or sometimes with the <ab>fut.</ab> (= that not, lest, <ab>e.g.</ab> मा त्वां शप्स्ये, lest I curse thee, <ls>MBh.</ls> <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Vop. xxv, 27</ls>)<info lex="inh"/>

or with a participle (<ab>e.g.</ab> मा जीवन्यो दुःखदग्धो जीवति, he ought not to live who lives consumed by pain, <ls>Pañcat.</ls>; गतः स मा, he cannot have gone, <ls>Kathās.</ls>; मई<स्र्स्>वम्प्रा<स्र्स्>र्थ्यम्, it must not be so requested, <ls>BhP.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/>

sometimes for the simple negative न (<ab>e.g.</ab> कथम् मा भूत्, how may it not be, <ls>Kathās.</ls>; मा गन्तुम् अर्हसि, thou oughtest not to go, <ls>R.</ls>; मा भूद् आगतः, can he not <ab>i.e.</ab> surely he <pb n="804,2"/> must have arrived, <ls>Amar.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/>

occasionally without a verb (e. <ab>g.</ab> मा शब्दः or शब्दम्, do not make a noise, <ls>Hariv.</ls>; मा नाम रक्षिणः, may it not be the watchmen, <ls>Mṛcch.</ls>; मा भवन्तम् अनलः पवनो वा, may not fire or wind harm thee, <ls>Vām. v, 1, 14</ls>; <ab>esp.</ab> = not so, <ab>e.g.</ab> मा प्रातृद, not so, O <s1 n="Prātṛda">Pr°</s1>, <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; in this meaning also मा मा, मा मै<स्र्स्>वम्, मा तावत्)<info lex="inh"/>

in the <s1>Veda</s1> often with उ (मो<स्र्स्>) = and not, nor (<ab>e.g.</ab> मा मघोनः परि ख्यतम् मो<स्र्स्> अस्माकम् ऋष्णाम्, do not forget the rich lords nor us the poets, <ls>RV. v, 65, 6</ls>; and then usually followed by षु = सु, <ab>e.g.</ab> मो<स्र्स्> षु णः निरृतिर् वधीत्, let not <s1 n="Nírṛtir">N°</s1> on any account destroy us, <ls n="RV.">i, 38, 6</ls>)<info lex="inh"/>
in <ls>ŚBr.</ls> स्म मा — मो स्म = neither — nor (in a prohibitive sense). <info lex="inh"/>

<hom>2.</hom> मा <ab>cl.</ab> 3. <ab>P.</ab> मिमाति (<ab>accord.</ab> to <ls>Dhātup. xxv, 6</ls> <ab>Ā.</ab> मिमीते, <ls>SV.</ls> मिमेति; <ab>Pot.</ab> मिमीयत्, <ls>Kāṭh.</ls>; <ab>pf.</ab>, मिमाय; <ab>aor.</ab> अमीमेत् <ab>Subj.</ab> मीमयत्; <ab>inf.</ab> मातवै), <div n="to"/>to sound, bellow, roar, bleat (<ab>esp.</ab> said of cows, calves, goats &c.), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>Br.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab>, only <ab>pr. p.</ab> मेम्यत्, bleating (as a goat), <ls>RV. i, 162, 2.</ls><info westergaard="mAN,25.6,03.0009"/><info whitneyroots="mA3,119"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="3P,3Ā"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=161693]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> मा <ab>cl.</ab> 2. <ab>P.</ab> (<ls>Dhātup. xxiv, 54</ls>) माति; <div n="vp"/> <ab>cl.</ab> 3. <ab>Ā.</ab> (<ls n="Dhātup.">xxv, 6</ls>) मिमीते; <div n="vp"/> <ab>cl.</ab> 4. <ab>Ā.</ab> (<ls n="Dhātup.">xxvi, 33</ls>) मायते (<lang>Ved.</lang> and <lang>ep.</lang> also मिमाति <ab>Pot.</ab> मिमीयात् <ab>Impv.</ab>, मिमीहि; <ab>Pot.</ab> मिमेत्, <ls>Br.</ls>; <ab>pf.</ab> ममौ, ममे, ममिरे, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ab>aor.</ab> अमासि <ab>Subj.</ab> मासातै, <ls>AV.</ls>; अमासीत् <ab>Gr.</ab>; <ab>Prec.</ab> मासीष्ट, मेयात्, <ls>ib.</ls>; <ab>fut.</ab> माता; मास्यति, मास्यते, <ls>ib.</ls>; <ab>inf.</ab> -मे, -मै, <ls>RV.</ls>; मातुम्, <ls>Br.</ls>; <ab>ind.p.</ab> मित्वा, -माय, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.), <div n="to"/>to measure, mete out, mark off, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.; <div n="to"/>to measure across = traverse, <ls>RV.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to measure (by any standard), compare with (<ab>instr.</ab>), <ls>Kum.</ls>; <div n="to"/> (माति) to correspond in measure (either with <ab>gen.</ab>, ‘to be large or long enough for’, <ls>BhP.</ls>; or with <ab>loc.</ab>, ‘to find room or be contained in’, <ls>Inscr.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls>; or with न and <ab>instr.</ab>, ‘to be beside one's self with’, <ls>Vcar.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls>); <div n="to"/>to measure out, apportion, grant, <ls>RV.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to help any one (<ab>acc.</ab>) to anything (<ab>dat.</ab>), <ls>ib.</ls>, <ls n="RV.">i, 120, 9</ls>; <div n="to"/>to prepare, arrange, fashion, form, build, make, <ls>RV.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to show, display, exhibit (अमिमीत, ‘he displayed or developed himself’, <ls n="RV.">iii, 29, 11</ls>), <ls>ib.</ls>; <div n="to"/> (in <ab>phil.</ab>) to infer, conclude; <div n="to"/>to pray (याच्ञा-कर्मणि), <ls>Naigh. iii, 59</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Pass.</ab> मीयते (<ab>aor.</ab> अमायि); <div n="to"/>to be measured &c., <ls>RV.</ls>; &c. <ab>Caus.</ab>, मापयति, °ते (<ab>aor.</ab> अमीमपत्, <ls>Pāṇ. vii, 4, 93</ls>, <ab>Vārtt.</ab> 2 <ls>Pat.</ls>), <div n="to"/>to cause to be measured or built, measure, build, erect, <ls>Up.</ls>; <ls>GṛS.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.: <div n="vp"/><ab>Desid.</ab> मित्सति, °ते, <ls>Pāṇ. vii, 4, 54</ls>; <ls n="Pāṇ. vii, 4">58</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> निर्-√ मा) : <div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab> मेमीयते, <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 4, 66.</ls> <info westergaard="mA,24.54,02.0065"/><info whitneyroots="mA1,119;mA2,119"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="2P,3Ā,4Ā"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=161697]</L>

मा [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang>Zd.</lang> <etym>mā</etym>; <lang>Gk.</lang> <gk>μέτρον</gk>, <gk>μετρέω</gk>; <lang>Lat.</lang> <etym>mētior</etym>, <etym>mensus</etym>, <etym>mensura</etym>; <lang>Slav.</lang> <etym>měra</etym>; <lang>Lith.</lang> <etym>mėrà</etym>.]
<hom>4.</hom> मा <lex>f.</lex> See under <hom>4.</hom> म, <pcol>p. 771, col. 2</pcol>. <info n="rev" pc="1331,2"/><info lex="f"/><info hui="4"/><L>[ID=161698]</L>
i: 1. इ the third vowel of the alphabet, corresponding to i short, and pronounced as that letter in kill &c.[ID=28533]

<hom>2.</hom> इ <lex>ind.</lex> an interjection of anger, calling, sorrow, distress, compassion, &c., (<ab>g.</ab> चा<स्र्स्>दि, <ls>Pāṇ. i, 4, 57</ls>, &c.)<info lex="ind"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=28536]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> इ base of <ab n="Nominative case">Nom.</ab> and <ab>Acc.</ab> <ab>sg.</ab> <ab>du.</ab> and <ab>pl.</ab> of the demonstrative pronoun इदम्, ‘this’ or ‘that’<info lexcat="LEXID=pron,STEM=idam"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=28537]</L>

इ [<ab>cf.</ab> इतर, इतस्, इति, इद्, इदा, इयत्, इव, इह: <ab>cf.</ab> also <lang>Lat.</lang> <etym>id</etym>; <lang>Goth.</lang> <etym>ita</etym>; <lang>Eng.</lang> <etym>it</etym>; <lang>Old Germ.</lang> <etym>iz</etym>; <lang>Mod. Germ.</lang> <etym>es</etym>.]

<hom>5.</hom> इ <ab>cl.</ab> 2. <ab>P.</ab> एति (<ab>Impv.</ab> 2. <ab>sg.</ab> इहि) and 1. <ab>P.</ab> <ab>Ā.</ab> अयति, अयते [<ab>cf.</ab> √ अय्], (<ab>pf.</ab> इयाय [2. <ab>sg.</ab> इयथ, <ls>AV. viii, 1, 10</ls>, and इयेथ, <ls>RV.</ls>] <ab>fut.</ab> एष्यति; <ab>aor.</ab> ऐषीत्; <ab>inf.</ab> एतुम्, एतवे, <ls>RV.</ls> & <ls>AV.</ls>, एतवै, <ls>RV.</ls> एतोस्, <ls>RV.</ls> इत्यै, <ls>RV. i, 113, 6</ls>; <ls n="RV. i,">124, 1</ls>) <div n="to"/>to go, walk; <div n="to"/>to flow; <div n="to"/>to blow; <div n="to"/>to advance, spread, get about; <div n="to"/>to go to or towards (with <ab>acc.</ab>), come, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Hit.</ls>; <ls>Ragh.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to go away, escape, pass, retire, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to arise from, come from, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>ChUp.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to return (in this sense only <ab>fut.</ab>), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <div n="to"/> (with पुनर्) to come back again, return, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to succeed, <ls>Mn. iii, 127</ls>; <div n="to"/>to arrive at, reach, obtain, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls>; <ls>Hit.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to fall into, come to; <div n="to"/>to approach with prayers, gain by asking (<ab>cf.</ab> इत); <div n="to"/>to undertake anything (with <ab>acc.</ab>); <div n="to"/>to be employed in, go on with, continue in any condition or relation (with a <ab>part.</ab> or <ab>instr.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> असुर-रक्षसानि मृद्यमानानि यन्ति, ‘the <s1>Asura</s1>s and <ns>Rakshases</ns> are being continually crushed’, <ls>ŚBr. i, 1, 4, 14</ls>; गवामयनेने<स्र्स्>युः, ‘they, were engaged in the [festival called] <s1>Gavāmayana</s1>’, <ls>KātyŚr. xxv, 5, 2</ls>); <div n="to"/>to appear, be, <ls>KaṭhUp.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab> <ab>Ā.</ab> ईयते (<ls>RV. i, 30, 18</ls>; <ab>p.</ab> इयान, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ab>inf.</ab> इयध्यै, <ls>RV. vi, 20, 8</ls>) <div n="to"/>to go quickly or repeatedly; <div n="to"/>to come, wander, run, spread, get about, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to appear, make one's appearance, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>BṛĀrUp.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to approach any one with requests (with two <ab>acc.</ab>), ask, request, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>: <div n="vp"/><ab>Pass.</ab> ईयते, to be asked or requested, <ls>RV.</ls>: <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> आययति, to cause to go or escape, <ls>Vop.</ls>; <div n="vp"/> <info whitneyroots="i1,7"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="2P,2Ā"/><info hui="5"/><L>[ID=28539]</L>
u: 1. उ the fifth letter and third short vowel of the alphabet, pronounced as the u in full.[ID=29997]
<hom>2.</hom> उ <lex>ind.</lex> an interjection of compassion, anger, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="ind"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=29999]</L>
a particle implying assent, calling, command, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
<hom>3.</hom> उ <lex>ind.</lex> an enclitic copula used frequently in the <s1>Veda</s1>s;<info lex="ind"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=30000]</L>

(as a particle implying restriction and antithesis, generally after pronominals, prepositions, particles, and before नु and सु, equivalent to) and, also, further; on the other hand (especially in connexion with a relative, <ab>e.g.</ab> य उ, he on the contrary who &c.)<info lex="inh"/>

This particle may serve to give emphasis, like इद् and एव, especially after prepositions or demonstrative pronouns, in conjunction with नु, वै, हि, चिद्, &c. (<ab>e.g.</ab> अयम् उ वाम् पुरुतमो … जोहवीति [<ls>RV. iii, 62, 2</ls>], this very person [your worshipper] invokes you &c.) It is especially used in the figure of speech called Anaphora, and particularly when the pronouns are repeated (<ab>e.g.</ab> तम् उ स्तुष इन्द्रम् तम् गृणीषे [<ls>RV. ii, 20, 4</ls>], him I praise, <s1>Indra</s1>, him I sing). It may be used in drawing a conclusion, like the <lang>English</lang> ‘now’ (<ab>e.g.</ab> तद् उ तथा न कुर्यात् [<ls>ŚBr. v, 2, 2, 3</ls>], that now he should not do in such a manner), and is frequently found in interrogative sentences (<ab>e.g.</ab> क उ तच् चिकेत [<ls>RV. i, 164, 48</ls>], who, I ask, should know that?)<info lex="inh"/>
<s1>Pāṇini</s1> calls this particle उञ् to distinguish it from the interrogative उ. In the <s1>Pada-pāṭha</s1> it is written ऊम्.<info lex="inh"/>
In the classical language उ occurs only after अथ, न, and किम्, with a slight modification of the sense, and often only as an expletive (see किम्);<info lex="inh"/>
उ — उ or उ — उत, on the one hand — on the other hand; partly — partly; as well — as.<info lex="inh"/>

<hom>4.</hom> उ <ab>cl.</ab> 5. <ab>P.</ab> उनोति (see व्य्-उ, <ls>RV. v, 31, 1</ls>) : <ab>cl.</ab> 2. <ab>Ā.</ab> (1. <ab>sg.</ab> उवे, <ls>RV. x, 86, 7</ls>) : <ab>cl.</ab> 1. <ab>Ā.</ab> अवते, <ls>Dhātup.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to call to, hail; <div n="to"/>to roar, bellow (see also ओ<स्र्स्>त = आ-उत). <info verb="genuineroot" cp="5P,2Ā,1Ā"/><info hui="4"/><L>[ID=30001]</L>
anam: <hom>1.</hom> अन्-, occasionally अन-, (before a vowel) the substitute for <hom>3.</hom> अ, or अ privative.
as: <hom>1.</hom> अस् <ab>cl.</ab> 2. <ab>P.</ab> अस्ति (2. <ab>sg.</ab> असि, 1. <ab>sg.</ab> अस्मि; <ab>pl.</ab> स्मसि or स्मस्, स्थ, सन्ति; (rarely <ab>Ā.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> 1. <ab>pl.</ab> स्महे, <ls>MBh. xiii, 13</ls>); <ab>Subj.</ab> असत्; <ab>Imper.</ab> अस्तु, 2. <ab>sg.</ab> एधि (<ab>fr.</ab> अस्-धि <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 4, 119</ls>); <ab>Pot.</ab> स्यात्; <ab>impf.</ab> आसीत्, rarely आस् [only in <ls>RV. x</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. vii, 3, 97</ls>] <pb n="117,2"/>; <ab>perf.</ab> 1. and 3. <ab>sg.</ab>, आस, 2. <ab>sg.</ab> आसिथ, 3. <ab>pl.</ab> आसुः; <ab>p.</ab> <lex type="part">m.</lex> सत् <lex type="part">f.</lex> सती) <div n="to"/>to be, live, exist, be present; <div n="to"/>to take place, happen; <div n="to"/>to abide, dwell, stay; <div n="to"/>to belong to (<ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>dat.</ab>); <div n="to"/>to fall to the share of, happen to any one (<ab>gen.</ab>); <div n="to"/>to be equal to (<ab>dat.</ab>), <ls>ŚBr. xiv</ls>; <ls>Mn. xi, 85</ls>; <div n="to"/>to turn out, tend towards any result, prove (with <ab>dat.</ab>); <div n="to"/>to become, <ls>BṛĀrUp.</ls> &c., (<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. v, 4, 51</ls>-<ls n="Pāṇ. v, 4">55</ls>); <div n="to"/>to be (<ab>i.e.</ab> used as copula, but not only with <ab>adj.</ab>, but also with <ab>adv.</ab> [<ab>e.g.</ab> तूष्णीम् आसीत्, <ls>MBh. iii, 4041</ls>], and often with <ab>part.</ab>, [<ab>e.g.</ab> <ab>perf.</ab> <ab>Pass.</ab> <ab>p.</ab> प्रस्थिताः स्म, <ls>N.</ls>; <ab>fut.</ab> <ab>p.p.</ab> हन्तव्यो ऽस्मि, <ls>N.</ls>; <ab>fut.</ab> <ab>p.</ab> especially with <ab>Pot.</ab>, and only in <ls>ŚBr.</ls>, as यदि दास्यन्-त्-स्यात्, ‘if he should intend to give’]; the <ab>pf.</ab> आस helps to form the periphrastic <ab>perf.</ab>, and अस्मि &c. the <ab>fut.</ab>); <info whitneyroots="as1,5"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="2P,2Ā"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=20353]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> अस् <ab>cl.</ab> 4. <ab>P.</ab> अस्यति (<ab>p.</ab> अस्यत्; <ab>impf.</ab> आस्यत्, <ls>AV.</ls> [<ab>cf.</ab> परा<स्र्स्>स् and व्य्-अस्]; <ab>fut.</ab> <ab>p.</ab> असिष्यत्; <ab>aor.</ab> आस्थत् [<ls>Nir. ii, 2</ls>; <ls>Pāṇ. vii, 4, 17</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> व्य्-अस्]; <ab>perf.</ab> <ab>P.</ab> आस [<ab>cf.</ab> परा<स्र्स्>स्] <ab>Ā.</ab> आसे [<ab>cf.</ab> व्य्-अस्]; <lang>Ved.</lang> <ab>Inf.</ab> अस्तवे, <ls>VS.</ls>) <div n="to"/>to throw, cast, shoot at (<ab>loc.</ab> <ab>dat.</ab>, or <ab>gen.</ab>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to drive or frighten away, <ls>Nalod. iv, 36</ls>; <div n="vp"/> See also <hom>1.</hom> अस्त <ab>s.v.</ab><info whitneyroots="as2,5"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="4P,4Ā"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=20354]</L>
caRa: चण <lex>mfn.</lex> <ab>ifc.</ab> (<ls>Pāṇ. v, 2, 26</ls>; = चञ्चु) renowned or famous for, <ls>HPariś. viii, 195</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=70884]</L>
चण <lex>m.</lex> the chick-pea, <ls>MBh. xiii, 5468</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> अक्षर-, कथा-, चार-, माया-). <info lex="m"/><L>[ID=70885]</L>
mana: <hom>1.</hom> मन <lex>m.</lex> Indian spikenard, <bot>Nardostachys Jatamansi</bot>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=156712]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a son of <s1>Śambara</s1>, <ls>Hariv.</ls> (<ab>v.l.</ab> मत). <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=156713]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> मन <lex>m. <ab>du.</ab></lex> (for <hom>1.</hom> and <hom>2.</hom> See <pcol>p. 783, col. 2</pcol>) a <ab>partic.</ab> ornament, <ls>RV. viii, 78, 2.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=157519]</L>
ka: 1. क the first consonant of the alphabet, and the first guttural letter (corresponding in sound to k in keep or king).[ID=41332]

<hom>2.</hom> क कस्, का, किम्, <ab>interrog.</ab> <ab>pron.</ab> (see किम् and <hom>2.</hom> कद्, and <ab>cf.</ab> the following words in which the interrogative base क appears, कतम, कतर, कति, कथम्, कदा, कर्हि, का, &c.), who? which? what? In its declension क follows the pronoun तद् except in <ab>nom.</ab> <ab>acc.</ab> <ab>sing.</ab> <ab>neut.</ab>, where किम् has taken the place of कद् or कत् in <lang>classical Sanskṛt</lang>; but the old form कद् is found in the <s1>Veda</s1> (see <ls>Gram. 227</ls>); <info lexcat="LEXID=pron,STEM=kim"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=41336]</L>

The interrogative sentence introduced by क is often terminated by इति (<ab>e.g.</ab> कस्य स पुत्र इति कथ्यताम्, let it be said, ‘whose son is he?’), but इति may be omitted and the sentence lose its direct interrogative character (<ab>e.g.</ab> कस्य स पुत्रो न ज्ञायते, it is not known whose son he is). क with or without √ <hom>1.</hom> अस् may express ‘how is it possible that?’ ‘what power have I, you, they, &c.?’ (<ab>e.g.</ab> के मम धन्विनोऽन्ये, what can the other archers do against me? के आवाम् परित्रातुम्, what power have we to rescue you?) क is often connected with a demonstrative <ab>pron.</ab> (<ab>e.g.</ab> को ऽयम् आयाति, who comes here?) or with the potential (<ab>e.g.</ab> को हरिं निन्देत्, who will blame <s1>Hari</s1>?) क is sometimes repeated (<ab>e.g.</ab> कः को ऽत्र, who is there? कान् कान्, whom? whom? <ab>i.e.</ab> which of them? <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Gram. 54</ls>), and the repetition is often due to a kind of attraction (<ab>e.g.</ab> केषां किं शास्त्रम् अध्ययनीयम्, which book is to be read by whom? <ls>Gram. 836. a</ls>). When किम् is connected with the <ab>inst.</ab> <ab>c.</ab> of a noun or with the <ab n="indeclinable">indecl.</ab> participle it may express ‘what is gained by doing so, &c.?’ (= कोऽर्थस्); (<ab>e.g.</ab> किं विलम्बेन, what is gained by delay? किम् बहुना, what is the use of more words? धनेन किं यो न ददाति, what is the use of wealth to him who does not give? with <ab>inst.</ab> and <ab>gen.</ab>, नीरुजः किम् औषधैः, what is the use of medicine to the healthy?)

क is often followed by the particles इव, उ, नाम, नु, वा, स्विद्, some of which serve merely to generalize the interrogation (<ab>e.g.</ab> किम् इव एतद्, what can this be? क उ श्रवत्, who can possibly hear? को नाम जानाति, who indeed knows? को न्वयम्, who, pray, is this? किं नु कार्यम्, what is to be done? को वा देवाद् अन्यः, who possibly other than a god? कस्य स्विद् हृदयं ना<स्र्स्>स्ति, of what person is there no heart?)

क is occasionally used alone as an indefinite pronoun, especially in negative sentences (<ab>e.g.</ab> न कस्य को वल्लभः, no one is a favourite of any one; ना<स्र्स्>न्यो जानाति कः, no one else knows; कथं स घातयति कम्, how does he kill any one?) Generally, however, क is only made indefinite when connected with the particles च, चन, चिद्, वा, and अपि, in which case क may sometimes be preceded by the relative य (<ab>e.g.</ab> ये के च, any persons whatsoever; यस्यै कस्यै च देवतायै, to any deity whatsoever; यानि कानि च मित्राणि, any friends whatsoever; यत् किंच, whatever). The particle चन, being composed of च and न, properly gives a negative force to the pronoun (<ab>e.g.</ab> यस्माद् इन्द्राद् ऋते किंचन, without which <s1>Indra</s1> there is nothing), but the negative sense is generally dropped (<ab>e.g.</ab> कश्चन, any one; न कश्चन, no one), and a relative is sometimes connected with it (<ab>e.g.</ab> यत् किंचन, anything whatsoever). Examples of चिद् with the interrogative are common; वा and अपि are not so common, but the latter is often found in <lang>classical Sanskṛt</lang> (<ab>e.g.</ab> कश्चिद्, any one; केचिद्, some; न कश्चिद्, no one; न किंचिद् अपि, nothing whatsoever; यः कश्चिद्, any one whatsoever; केचित् — केचित्, some — others; यस्मिन् कस्मिन् वा देशे, in any country whatsoever; न को ऽपि, no one; न किमपि, nothing whatever). क may sometimes be used, like <hom>2.</hom> कद्, at the beginning of a compound. See क-पूय, &c.

<hom>3.</hom> क अस्, <lex>m.</lex> (according to native authorities) <ab>N.</ab> of <s1>Prajāpati</s1> or of a <s1>Prajāpati</s1>, <ls>VS. xx, 4</ls>; <ls n="VS.">xxii, 20</ls>; <ls>TS. i</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=41337]</L>
of <s1>Brahman</s1>, <ls>MBh. i, 32</ls>; <ls>BhP. iii, 12, 51</ls>; <ls n="BhP.">xii, 13, 19</ls>; <ls n="BhP. xii, 13,">20</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=41338]</L>
क (अम्), <lex>n.</lex> happiness, joy, pleasure, <ls>ChUp. iv, 10, 5</ls>; <ls>Nir.</ls> &c.<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=41356]</L>
hair, a head of hair, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=41359]</L>
क <lex>n.</lex> (also regarded as <lex type="hwalt">ind.</lex>; <ab>cf.</ab> <hom>1.</hom> कम्.)<info lex="n:ind"/><L>[ID=41360]</L>

<hom>4.</hom> क a <s1>Taddhita</s1> affix (much used in forming adjectives; it may also be added to nouns to express diminution, deterioration, or similarity, <ab>e.g.</ab> पुत्रक, a little son; अश्वक, a bad horse or like a horse).<info hui="4"/><L>[ID=41365]</L>
sajjana: सज्जन <lex>mfn.</lex> (for सज्-जन See <pcol>p. 1135, col. 1</pcol>) hanging round (<ab>e.g.</ab> कण्ठ-स्°, ‘<ab n="hanging">h°</ab> <ab n="round">r°</ab> the neck’), <ls>Mn. ii, 63</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=229033]</L>
सज्जन <lex>n.</lex> a flight of steps or <ns>Ghāt</ns> leading down to the water, ferry, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=229034]</L>
सज्जन <lex>n.</lex> caparisoning an elephant (also <lex type="hwalt">f(आ). </lex>)<info lex="f#A:n"/><L>[ID=229036]</L>
सज्-जन See under सत्, <pcol>p. 1135, col. 1</pcol>.<info hui="b"/><L>[ID=229050]</L>
सज्—जन <lex>mfn.</lex> (for सज्जन See <pcol>p. 1131, col. 2</pcol>) well-born, respectable, virtuous, <ls>Hariv.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="c"/><L>[ID=229681]</L>
सज्—जन <lex>m.</lex> a good or virtuous or wise man, <ls>Mn.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=229682]</L>
jana: जन <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>g.</ab> वृषा<स्र्स्>दि) creature, living being, man, person, race (पञ्च जनास्, ‘the five races’ = प्° कृष्टयस्, <ls>RV. iii</ls>, <ls n="RV.">viii ff.</ls>; <ls>MBh. iii, 14160</ls>), people, subjects (the <ab>sg.</ab> used collectively, <ab>e.g.</ab> दैव्य or दिव्या ज्°, ‘divine race’, the gods collectively, <ls>RV.</ls>; महत् ज्°, many people, <ls>R. vi, 101, 2</ls>; often <ab>ifc.</ab> denoting one person or a number of persons collectively, <ab>e.g.</ab> प्रेष्य-, बन्धु-, सखी- &c., <ab>qq.vv.</ab> <pb n="410,2"/>; with names of peoples, <ls>VarBṛS. iv, 22</ls> and <ls n="VarBṛS.">v, 74</ls>; अयं जनः, ‘this person, these persons’, I, we, <ls>MBh. viii, 709</ls>; <ls>Hariv. 7110</ls>; <ls>R. ii, 41, 2</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls> &c.; एष ज्°, <ab>id.</ab>, <ls>Kāvyād. ii, 75</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=76737]</L>

the person nearest to the speaker (also with अयम् or असौ, ‘this my lover’, <ls>Kāvyād. ii, 271</ls>; <ls>Ratnāv. i, 24/25</ls>), <ls>Nal. x, 10</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls>; <ls>Mālav.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=76738]</L>
a common person, one of the people, <ls>Kir. ii, 42</ls> and <ls n="Kir. ii,">47</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=76739]</L>
the world beyond the <s1>Mahar-loka</s1>, <ls>BhP. iii, 11, 29</ls>; <ls>SkandaP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=76740]</L>
जन (°न), <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>g.</ab> अश्वा<स्र्स्>दि) <ab>N.</ab> of a man (with the <ab>patr.</ab> <s1>Śārkarākṣya</s1>), <ls>ŚBr. x</ls>; <ls>ChUp.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=76741]</L>
raja: <hom>1.</hom> रज <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>g.</ab> पचा<स्र्स्>दि) = रजस्, dust (<ab>cf.</ab> नी-, वि-र्°)<info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=173860]</L>
the menstrual excretion (also <lex type="hwalt">n.</lex>), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=173862]</L>
emotion, affection, <ls>L.</ls> : the quality of passion, <ls>Uṇ. iv, 216</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=173863]</L>
tman: त्मन् <lex>m.</lex> (= आत्मन्) the vital breath, <ls>RV. i, 63, 8</ls> (<ab>acc.</ab> त्मनम्), <ls>ĀśvŚr. vi, 9, 1</ls> (<ab>acc.</ab> त्मानम्)<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=87332]</L>
one's own person, self, <ls>RV.</ls>; ऽत्मन् after ए, or ओ for आत्मन्, <ls>KaṭhUp. iii, 12</ls>; <ls>MBh. i</ls>-<ls n="MBh.">iii</ls>; <ls>BhP. vii, 9, 32</ls><info lex="inh"/>
त्मन् <lex>ind.</lex> उत त्मना or त्मनाच ‘and also, and certainly’, इव or न त्मना ‘just as’, अध त्मना, ‘and even’, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="ind"/>
SAsa: <hom>2.</hom> शास <lex>m.</lex> (for <hom>1.</hom> See <pcol>p. 1068, col. 3</pcol>) a butcher's knife, <ls>Br.</ls>; <ls>ŚrS.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=216470]</L>
he: हे <lex>ind.</lex> a vocative particle (‘oh!’ ‘ho!’ &c.; also said to express envy or ill-will or disapprobation), <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; &c.<info lex="ind"/><L>[ID=263973]</L>
raRva: <hom>1.</hom> रण्व <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> pleasant, delightful, agreeable, lovely, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="m:f#A:n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=174191]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> रण्व <ab>Nom.</ab> <ab>P.</ab> °वति, to rejoice, delight, <ls>TS.</ls><info verb="nom" cp="P"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=174194]</L>
I: 1. ई the fourth letter of the alphabet, corresponding to इ long, and having the sound of ee in feel.[ID=29689]
<hom>2.</hom> ई <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of <s1>Kandarpa</s1>, the god of love, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=29691]</L>
ई <lex>f.</lex> (ई or ईस्) <ab>N.</ab> of <s1>Lakṣmī</s1>, <ls>L.</ls> [also in <ls>MBh. xii, 11220</ls>, according to <ls>Nīlak.</ls> (who reads पुण्यचञ्चुर् ई)]. <info lex="f"/><L>[ID=29692]</L>
<hom>3.</hom> ई <lex>ind.</lex> an interjection of pain or anger<info lex="ind"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=29693]</L>
a particle implying consciousness or perception, consideration, compassion.<info lex="inh"/>
<hom>4.</hom> ई for √ इ. See <hom>5.</hom> इ.<info verb="root" cp="0"/><info hui="4"/><L>[ID=29694]</L>
pAna(m): <hom>1.</hom> पान <lex>n.</lex> drinking (<ab>esp.</ab> <ab n="drinking">d°</ab> spirituous liquors), draught, <ls>RV.</ls> (only <ab>ifc.</ab>), <ls>AV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=120867]</L>
drinking the saliva <ab>i.e.</ab> kissing, <ls>Kāv.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> अधर-)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=120868]</L>
पान <lex>m.</lex> a distiller or vender of spirituous liquors, an inn-keeper, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=120872]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> पान <lex>mfn.</lex> observing, keeping (see तनू-)<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=120941]</L>
पान <lex>n.</lex> protection, defence (see <ls>ib.</ls> and वात-). <info lex="n"/><L>[ID=120942]</L>
<hom>3.</hom> पान <lex>m.</lex> = अपा<स्र्स्>न, breathing out, expiration, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=122154]</L>
aSna: <hom>1.</hom> अश्न <lex>mfn.</lex> (√ <hom>2.</hom> अश्), voracious [<ls>RV. i, 164, 1</ls> and <ls n="RV. i,">173, 2</ls>] See अशन् at end<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=19699]</L>
अश्न (अस्), <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of a demon, <ls>RV. ii, 14, 5</ls>; <ls n="RV. ii,">20, 5</ls>; <ls n="RV.">vi, 4, 3.</ls><info lex="m"/>
<hom>2.</hom> अश्न <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>cf.</ab> अशन्), a stone, <ls>RV. viii, 2, 2</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=19706]</L>
saDI: स—धी (स-), <lex>mfn.</lex> endowed with reason or intellect, <ls>ŚBr.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=230997]</L>
damanasya: दमन <lex>mf(ई)n.</lex> <ab>ifc.</ab> taming, subduing, overpowering, <ls>MBh. viii</ls>; <ls>Bhartṛ.</ls><info lex="m:f#I:n"/><L>[ID=90271]</L>
दमन <lex>m.</lex> a tamer of horses, charioteer, <ls>BhP. iv, 26, 2</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=90272]</L>
of a son of <s1>Vasu-deva</s1> by <s1>Rohiṇī</s1>, <ls>Hariv. 1951</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=90276]</L>
of a son of <s1>Bharadvāja</s1>, <ls>KāśīKh. lxxiv</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=90278]</L>
of an old king, <ls>MBh. i, 224</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=90279]</L>
SamanI: शमनी <lex>f.</lex> ‘the calming one’, night, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="f"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=212966]</L>
mAna[m]: <hom>1.</hom> मान <lex>m.</lex> (√ मन्) opinion, notion, conception, idea, <ls>Tattvas.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> आत्म-म्°)<info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=162719]</L>

self-conceit, arrogance, pride, <ls>KauṣUp.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls> &c. (with <ns>Buddhists</ns> one of the 6 evil feelings, <ls>Dharmas. 67</ls>; or one of the 10 fetters to be got rid of <ls>MWB. 127</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=162721]</L>
(also <lex type="hwalt">n.</lex>) consideration, regard, respect, honour, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="n"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=162722]</L>
a wounded sense of honour, anger or indignation excited by jealousy (<ab>esp.</ab> in women), caprice, sulking, <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>Daśar.</ls>; <ls>Sāh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=162723]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of the father of <s1>Agastya</s1> (perhaps also of <s1 n="Agastya">A°</s1> himself, <ls>Pāṇ.</ls> the family of <s1>Māna</s1>), <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=162724]</L>
(in <ab>astron.</ab>) <ab>N.</ab> of the tenth house, <ls>VarBṛS.</ls> (<ls>W.</ls> also a ‘blockhead <pb n="809,2"/>; an agent; a barbarian’). <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=162725]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> मान <lex>m.</lex> (√ <hom>3.</hom> मा) a building, house, dwelling, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="m"/><listinfo n="sup"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=162832]</L>
(<ab>accord.</ab> to some in <ls>RV. i, 39, 1</ls> = ‘light, sheen’).<info n="sup"/><info lex="inh"/>
dimension, size, height, length (in space and time), weight, <ls>ib.</ls> (<ab>ifc.</ab> = fold See शत-म्°)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=162839]</L>

a <ab>partic.</ab> measure or weight (= कृष्णल or रक्तिका; <ab>accord.</ab> to <ab>Sch.</ab> on <ls>TS.</ls> & <ls>KātyŚr.</ls> 100 <s1>Māna</s1>s = 5 <s1>Pala</s1>s or <s1>Paṇa</s1>s)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=162840]</L>
(in <ab>phil.</ab>) proof, demonstration, means of proof (= प्र-माण. <ab>q.v.</ab>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=162843]</L>
E: 1. ऐ the twelfth vowel of the alphabet and having the sound of ei in height.[ID=40290]
Ana[m]: आ-√ नम् <ab>P.</ab> (3. <ab>pl.</ab> आ-नमन्ति, <ls>RV.</ls> &c.; <ab>inf.</ab> -नमम्, <ls>RV. iv, 8, 3</ls>) <ab>Ā.</ab> (<ab>Impv.</ab> 3. <ab>pl.</ab> आनमन्ताम्, <ls>RV. vi, 49, 4</ls>) <div n="to"/>to bend down, bend, bow, incline, <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls>; <ls>Ragh.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to do homage, salute reverently, <ls>BhP.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to condescend; <div n="to"/>to be propitious (as gods to men), <ls>RV. vi, 50, 4</ls>; <div n="to"/>to bring near; <div n="to"/>to bend towards or near; <div n="to"/>to subdue, <ls>RV.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> -नामयति and -नमयति, to inflect, bend (a bow), cause to bend, subdue, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Mālav.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls><info verb="pre" cp="PĀ" parse="A+nam"/><L>[ID=24452]</L>
mAKa: माख (<ab>prob.</ab>) <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> मभ) any relationship based upon an oblation offered in common, <ls>Hariv.</ls> (<ab>v.l.</ab> मौख). <info lex="n"/><L>[ID=161941]</L>
varam: वरम् (अम्), <lex>ind.</lex> (<ab>g.</ab> स्वर्-आदि) preferably, rather, better (also = preferable, sometimes with <ab>abl.</ab> which in <s1>Veda</s1> is often followed by आ, <ab>e.g.</ab> अग्निभ्यो वरम्, ‘better than fires’, <ls>RV.</ls>; सखिभ्य आ वरम्, ‘better than companions’, <ls>ib.</ls>; exceptionally with <ab>acc.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> शिष्यैः शत-हुतान् होमान्, एकः पुत्र-हुतो वरम्, ‘better one sacrifice offered by a son than a hundred offered by disciples’, <ls>ṢaḍvBr.</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="ind"/>

वरम् <lex>ind.</lex> it is better that, it would be best if (with <ab>pres.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> वरं गच्छामि, ‘it is better that I go’; or with <ab>Impv.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> वरं नये स्थाप्यताम्, ‘it would be better if he were initiated into our plan’, <ls>Kathās.</ls>; or without any verb, <ab>e.g.</ab> वरं सिंहात्, ‘better [death caused] by a lion’, <ls>Pañcat.</ls>; sometimes with <ab>Pot.</ab>, e.g. वरं तत् कुर्यात्, ‘better that he should do that’, <ls>Kām.</ls>), <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls> &c.<info lex="ind"/>

it is better than, rather than (in these senses वरम् is followed by न, न च, न तु, न पुनः, तद् अपि न or तथा<स्र्स्>पि न, with <ab>nom.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> वरं मृत्युर् नचा<स्र्स्>कीर्तिः, ‘better death than [<ab>lit.</ab> ‘and not’] infamy’; exceptionally with <ab>instr.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> वरम् एको गुणी पुत्रो न च मूर्ख-शतैर् अपि, ‘better one virtuous son than hundreds of fools’, <ls>Hit.</ls>; न हि-वरम्, ‘by no mean — but rather’), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/>
jawAm: जटा <lex>f.</lex> the hair twisted together (as worn by ascetics, by <s1>Śiva</s1>, and persons in mourning), <ls>PārGṛ. ii, 6</ls>; <ls>Mn. vi, 6</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>, <ls n="MBh.">iii, 16137</ls>) &c.<info lex="f:f#A"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=76521]</L>
a fibrous root, root (in general), <ls>Bhpr. v, 111</ls>; <ls>ŚārṅgS. i, 46</ls> and <ls n="ŚārṅgS. i,">58</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=76522]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of several plants (= टा-वती, <ls>L.</ls>; <bot>Mucuna pruritus</bot>, <ls>L.</ls>; <bot>Flacourtia cataphracta</bot>, <ls>L.</ls>; = °टा-मूला, <ls>L.</ls>; = रुद्र-जटा, <ls>L.</ls>), <ls>Suśr. v f.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=76523]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of a <s1>Pāṭha</s1> or arrangement of the Vedic text (still more artificial than the <s1>Krama</s1>, each pair of words being repeated thrice and one repetition being in inverted order), <ls>Caraṇ.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=76524]</L>
mahat: महत् <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>orig.</ab> <ab>pr. p.</ab> of √ <hom>1.</hom> मह्; strong form, महान्त् <lex type="hwinfo">f.</lex> महती; in <lang>ep.</lang> often महत् for महान्तम्; <ab>ibc.</ab> mostly महा, <ab>q.v.</ab>) great (in space, time, quantity or degree) <ab>i.e.</ab> large, big, huge, ample, extensive, long, abundant, numerous, considerable, important, high, eminent, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (also <lex type="hwinfo">ind.</lex> in महद्-√ भू, to become great or full [said of the moon] <ls>Śiś.</ls>)<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=159193]</L>

many (people, with जन <ab>sg.</ab>), <ls>MBh.</ls> (with उक्थ <lex type="nhw">n.</lex> a <ab>partic.</ab> <s1>Uktha</s1> of 720 verses; with औक्थ्य <lex type="nhw">n.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of a <s1>Sāman</s1>, <ls>MBh.</ls>; महान्ति भूतानि, the gross elements, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> महाभूत)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=159201]</L>
महत् <lex>m.</lex> a great or noble man (<ab>opp.</ab> to नीच, अल्प or दीन), <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>Kām.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=159202]</L>
the leader of a sect or superior of a monastery, <ls>RTL. 87 n. 1</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=159203]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of <s1>Rudra</s1> or of a <ab>partic.</ab> <s1 n="Rudra">R°</s1>, <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=159205]</L>
(<ab>scil.</ab> गण), a <ab>partic.</ab> class of deceased progenitors, <ls>MārkP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=159207]</L>

महत् m. (rarely n. scil. तत्त्व), ‘the great principle’, N. of Buddhi, ‘Intellect’, or the intellectual principle (according to the Sāṃkhya philosophy the second of the 23 principles produced from Prakṛti and so called as the great source of Ahaṃkāra, ‘self-consciousness’, and Manas, ‘the mind’; cf. IW. 83, 91 &c.), MaitrUp.; Mn.; Sāṃkhyak.; MBh. &c.[ID=159209]
महत् <lex>n.</lex> anything great or important, <ls>ChUp.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=159213]</L>
a great thing, important matter, the greater part, <ls>ĀśvGṛ.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=159216]</L>
advanced state or time (महति रात्रियै or रात्र्यै, in the middle of the night, <ls>TS.</ls>; <ls>Br.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=159217]</L>
amaram: अ-मर <lex>mf(आ, <ls>Mn. ii, 148</ls>; ई, <ls>R. i, 34, 16</ls>)n.</lex> undying, immortal, imperishable, <ls>ŚBr. xiv</ls>, &c.<info lex="m:f#A:f#I:n"/><L>[ID=13861]</L>
अ-मर <lex>m.</lex> a god, a deity, <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=13862]</L>
mystical signification of the letter उ<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=13871]</L>
imam: इम the base of some cases of the demonstrative pronoun इदम्, <ab>q.v.</ab> (<ab>acc.</ab> <ab>sg.</ab> <lex type="hwinfo">m.</lex> इमम् <lex type="hwinfo">f.</lex> इमाम् <pb n="168,1"/>; <ab>nom.</ab> <ab>pl.</ab> <lex type="hwinfo">m.</lex> इमे, &c.; irregular <ab>gen.</ab> <ab>sg.</ab> इमस्य, <ls>RV. viii, 13, 21</ls>[once]).<L>[ID=29325]</L>
rajam: <hom>1.</hom> रज <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>g.</ab> पचा<स्र्स्>दि) = रजस्, dust (<ab>cf.</ab> नी-, वि-र्°)<info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=173860]</L>
the menstrual excretion (also <lex type="hwalt">n.</lex>), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=173862]</L>
emotion, affection, <ls>L.</ls> : the quality of passion, <ls>Uṇ. iv, 216</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=173863]</L>
marya: मर्य <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>prob.</ab> <ab>fr.</ab> √ मृ) a mortal, man, (<ab>esp.</ab>) young man, lover, suitor, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>Br.</ls> (<ab>pl.</ab> people; <ab>voc.</ab> often used as a kind of particle; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>VPrāt. ii, 16</ls> and भोस्)<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=158586]</L>
ca: 1. च the 20th letter of the alphabet, 1st of the 2nd (or palatal) class of consonants, having the sound of ch in church.[ID=70281]

<hom>2.</hom> च <lex>ind.</lex> and, both, also, moreover, as well as (= <gk>τε</gk>, <lang>Lat.</lang> <etym>que</etym>, placed like these particles as an enclitic after the word which it connects with what precedes; when used with a personal pronoun this must appear in its fuller accented form (<ab>e.g.</ab> तव च मम च [not ते च मे च], ‘both of thee and me’), when used after verbs the first of them is accented, <ls>Pāṇ. viii, 1, 58 f.</ls>; it connects whole sentences as well as parts of sentences; in <ls>RV.</ls> the double च occurs more frequently than the single (<ab>e.g.</ab> अहं च त्वं च, ‘I and thou’, <ls n="RV.">viii, 62, 11</ls>); the double च may also be used somewhat redundantly in <lang>class. Sanskṛt</lang> (<ab>e.g.</ab> क्व हरिणकानां जीवितं चा<स्र्स्>तिलोलं क्व च वज्र-साराः शरास् ते, ‘where is the frail existence, of fawns and where are thy adamantine arrows?’, <ls>Śak. i, 10</ls>); in later literature, however, the first च is more usually omitted (<ab>e.g.</ab> अहं त्वं च), and when more than two things are enumerated only one च is often found (<ab>e.g.</ab> तेजसा यशसा लक्ष्म्या स्थित्या च परया, ‘in glory, in fame, in beauty, and in high position’, <ls>Nal. xii, 6</ls>); elsewhere, when more than two things are enumerated, च is placed after some and omitted after others (<ab>e.g.</ab> ऋण-दाता च वैद्यश् च श्रोत्रियो नदी, ‘the payer of a debt and a physician [and] a <ns>Brāhman</ns> [and] a river’, <ls>Hit. i, 4, 55</ls>); in <lang>Ved.</lang> and even in <lang>class. Sanskṛt</lang> [<ls>Mn. iii, 20</ls>; <ls n="Mn.">ix, 322</ls>; <ls>Hit.</ls>], when the double च would generally be used, the second may occasionally be omitted (<ab>e.g.</ab> इन्द्रश् च सोम, ‘both <s1>Indra</s1> [and thou] <s1>Soma</s1>’, <ls>RV. vii, 104, 25</ls>; दुर्भेद्यश् चा<स्र्स्>शुसंधेयः, ‘both difficult to be divided [and] quickly united’, <ls>Hit. i</ls>); with lexicographers च may imply a reference to certain other words which are not expressed (<ab>e.g.</ab> कमण्डलौ च करकः, ‘the word करक has the meaning ‘pitcher’ and other meanings’); sometimes च is = एव, even, indeed, certainly, just (<ab>e.g.</ab> सु-चिन्तितं चौ<स्र्स्>षधं न नाम-मात्रेण करोत्य् अरोगम्, ‘even a well-devised remedy does not cure a disease by its mere name’, <ls>Hit.</ls>; यावन्त एव ते तावांश्च सः, ‘as great as they [were] just so great was he’, <ls>Ragh. xii, 45</ls>); occasionally च is disjunctive, ‘but’, ‘on the contrary’, ‘on the other hand’, ‘yet’, ‘nevertheless’ (वरम् आद्यौ न चा<स्र्स्>न्तिमः, ‘better the two first but not the last’, <ls>Hit.</ls> <pb n="380,2"/>; शान्तम् इदम् आश्रम-पदं स्फुरति च बाहुः, ‘this hermitage is tranquil yet my arm throbs’, <ls>Śak. i, 15</ls>); च-च, though — yet, <ls>Vikr. ii, 9</ls>; च-न च, though — yet not, <ls>Pat.</ls>; च — न तु (<ab>v.l.</ab> ननु) <ab>id.</ab>, <ls>Mālav. iv, 8</ls>; न च — च, though not — yet, <ls>Pat.</ls>; च may be used for वा, ‘either’, ‘or’ (<ab>e.g.</ab> इह चा<स्र्स्>मुत्र वा, ‘either here or hereafter’, <ls>Mn. xii, 89</ls>; स्त्री वा पुमान् वा यच् चा<स्र्स्>न्यत् सत्त्वम्, ‘either a woman or a man or any other being’, <ls>R.</ls>), and when a <ab>neg.</ab> particle is joined with च the two may then be translated by ‘neither’, ‘nor’; occasionally one च or one न is omitted (<ab>e.g.</ab> न च परिभोक्तुं नै<स्र्स्>व शक्नोमि हातुम्, ‘I am able neither to enjoy nor to abandon’, <ls>Śak. v, 18</ls>; न पूर्वा<स्र्स्>ह्णे न च परा<स्र्स्>ह्णे, ‘neither in the forenoon nor in the afternoon’); च-च may express immediate connection between two acts or their simultaneous occurrence (<ab>e.g.</ab> मम च मुक्तं तमसा मनो मनसिजेन धनुषि शरश् च निवेशितः, ‘no sooner is my mind freed from darkness than a shaft is fixed on his bow by the heart-born god’, <ls n="Śak.">vi, 8</ls>); च is sometimes = चे<स्र्स्>द्, ‘if’ (<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. viii, 1, 30</ls>; the verb is accented), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Vikr. ii, 20</ls>; <ls>Bhartṛ. ii, 45</ls>; च may be used as an expletive (<ab>e.g.</ab> अन्यैश् च क्रतुभिश् च, ‘and with other sacrifices’); च is often joined to an <ab>adv.</ab> like एव, अपि, तथा, तथै<स्र्स्>व, &c., either with or without a <ab>neg.</ab> particle (<ab>e.g.</ab> वैरिणं नो<स्र्स्>पसेवेत सहा<स्र्स्>यं चैव वैरिणः, ‘one ought not to serve either an enemy or the ally of an enemy’, <ls>Mn. iv, 133</ls>); (see एव, अपि, &c.) For the meaning of च after an interrogative See <hom>2.</hom> क, <hom>2.</hom> कथा, किम्, क्व); <info lex="ind"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=70283]</L>
jU: <hom>1.</hom> जू (<ab>cf.</ab> √ जिन्व्), <ab>cl.</ab> 1. <ab>Ā.</ab> <ab>cl.</ab> 9. <ab>P.</ab> जवते, जुनाति (√ जु <ab>cl.</ab> 1. <ab>P.</ab> जवति, <ls>Dhātup. xxii, 60</ls> <ab>v.l.</ab>; a <s1>Sautra</s1> root, <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 2, 177</ls>; <ls n="Pāṇ. iii">3, 97</ls> and <ls n="Pāṇ. iii">4, 80</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>; <ab>Subj.</ab> 2. <ab>sg.</ab> जुनास्; <ab>aor.</ab> <ab>Subj.</ab> जूजुवत्; <ab>pf.</ab> 3. <ab>pl.</ab> जूजुवुर्) <div n="to"/>to press forwards, hurry on, be quick, <ls>RV. iii, 33, 1</ls>; <ls>ŚBr. x</ls>; <div n="to"/>to impel quickly, urge or drive on, incite, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>TS. vi</ls>; <div n="to"/>to scare, <ls>RV. i, 169, 3</ls>; <div n="to"/>to excite, promote, animate, inspire, <ls>RV.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> <ab>aor.</ab> अजीजवत्, <ls>Pāṇ. vii, 4, 80</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>: <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> <ab>Desid.</ab> जिजवयिषति, <ls>ib.</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>; <div n="vp"/> <ab>cf.</ab> प्र-.<info westergaard="CyuN,22.60,01.0673"/><info whitneyroots="jU,55"/><info verb="root" cp="1Ā,9P,1P"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=80068]</L>

ud: <hom>1.</hom> उद् a particle and prefix to verbs and nouns. (As implying superiority in place, rank, station, or power) up, upwards<info hui="1"/><L>[ID=32058]</L>

over, above. (As implying separation and disjunction) out, out of, from, off, away from, apart. (According to native authorities उद् may also imply publicity, pride, indisposition, weakness, helplessness, binding, loosing, existence, acquisition.) उद् is not used as a separable adverb or preposition

in those rare cases, in which it appears in the <s1>Veda</s1> uncompounded with a verb, the latter has to be supplied from the context (<ab>e.g.</ab> उद् उत्सम् शतधारम्, <ls>AV. iii, 24, 4</ls>, out (pour) a fountain of a hundred streams). उद् is sometimes repeated in the <s1>Veda</s1> to fill out the verse, <ls>Pāṇ. viii, 1, 6</ls> (किं न उद् उद् उ हर्षसे दातवा उ, <ls>Kāś.</ls> on <ls>Pāṇ.</ls>)

going, moving, riding, marching &c. to (<ab>loc.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>) or upon (<ab>instr.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>) or against (<ab>acc.</ab> with प्रति), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=171106]</L>
a vehicle of any kind, carriage, waggon, vessel, ship, litter, palanquin, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=171107]</L>

(with <ns>Buddhists</ns>) the vehicle or method of arriving at knowledge, the means of release from repeated births (there are either 3 systems, the श्रावक-यान, the प्रत्येक-बुद्ध-य्° or प्रत्येक-य्°, and the महा-य्°; or more generally only 2, the महा-यान or ‘Great method’ and the हिन-य्° or ‘Lesser method’; sometimes there is only ‘One Vehicle’, the एक-यान, or ‘one way to beatitude’), <ls>SaddhP.</ls>; <ls>Dharmas. 2</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>MWB. 159</ls> &c.)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=171108]</L>
nara: नर <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>cf.</ab> नृ) a man, a male, a person (<ab>pl.</ab> men, people), <ls>TS.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=104026]</L>
a man or piece at chess or draughts &c., <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104029]</L>
the pin or gnomon of a sun-dial, <ls>Sūryas.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> -यन्त्र)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104030]</L>
person, personal termination, <ls>Kāś.</ls> on <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 1, 85</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> पुरुष)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104031]</L>

the primeval Man or eternal Spirit pervading the universe (always associated with <s1>Nārāyaṇa</s1>, ‘son of the <ab n="primeval">pr°</ab> man’ <pb n="529,1"/>; both are considered either as gods or sages and accordingly called देवौ, ऋषी, तापसौ &c.; in <lang>ep.</lang> poetry they are the sons of <s1>Dharma</s1> by <s1>Mūrti</s1> or <s1>A-hiṃsā</s1> and emanations of <s1>Viṣṇu</s1>, <s1>Arjuna</s1> being identified with <s1>Nara</s1>, and <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1> with <s1>Nārāyaṇa</s1>), <ls>Mn.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> -सूनु), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>Pur.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104032]</L>
(<ab>pl.</ab>) a class of <ab>myth.</ab> beings allied to the <s1>Gandharva</s1>s and <s1>Kiṃ-nara</s1>s, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Pur.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104033]</L>
of a <ab n="son">s°</ab> of <s1>Gaya</s1> and father of <s1>Virāj</s1>, <ls>VP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104036]</L>
of a <ab n="son">s°</ab> of <s1>Su-dhṛti</s1> and <ab n="father">f°</ab> of <s1>Kevala</s1>, <ls>Pur.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104037]</L>
of a <ab n="son">s°</ab> of <s1>Bhavan-manyu</s1> (<s1>Manyu</s1>) and <ab n="father">f°</ab> of <s1>Saṃkṛti</s1>, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104038]</L>
of <s1>Bhāradvāja</s1> (author of <ls>RV. vi, 35</ls> and <ls n="RV. vi,">36</ls>), <ls>Anukr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104039]</L>
of one of the 10 horses of the Moon, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104041]</L>
नर <lex>n.</lex> a kind of fragrant grass.<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=104043]</L>
anta: अन्त <lex>m.</lex> end, limit, boundary, term<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=7901]</L>
end of life, death, destruction (in these latter senses sometimes <ab>neut.</ab>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=7904]</L>
last word of a compound<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=7906]</L>
pause, settlement, definite ascertainment, certainty<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=7907]</L>
border, outskirt (<ab>e.g.</ab> ग्रामा<स्र्स्>न्ते, in the outskirts of the village)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=7909]</L>

अन्त [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang>Goth.</lang> <etym>andeis</etym>, <ab>Theme</ab> <etym>andja</etym>; <lang>Germ.</lang> <etym>Ende</etym>; <lang>Eng.</lang> <etym>end</etym>: with अन्त are also compared the <lang>Gk.</lang> <gk>ἄντα</gk>, <gk>ἀντί</gk>; <lang>Lat.</lang> <etym>ante</etym>; the <lang>Goth.</lang> <etym>anda</etym> in <etym>anda-vaurd</etym>, &c.; and the <lang>Germ.</lang> <etym>ent</etym>, <ab>e.g.</ab> in <etym>entsagen</etym>].
Arza[m]: आर्ष <lex>mf(ई)n.</lex> relating or belonging to or derived from <s1>Ṛṣi</s1>s (<ab>i.e.</ab> the poets of the Vedic and other old hymns), archaistic, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f#I:n"/><L>[ID=26630]</L>

आर्ष <lex>m.</lex> a form of marriage derived from the <s1>Ṛṣi</s1>s (the father of the bride receiving one or two pairs of kine from the bridegroom), <ls>ĀśvGṛ. i, 6, 4</ls>; <ls>Mn. iii, 21</ls>; <ls>Yājñ. i, 58</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> विवाह)<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=26631]</L>
आर्ष <lex>n.</lex> the speech of a <s1>Ṛṣi</s1>, the holy text, the <s1>Veda</s1>s, <ls>Nir.</ls>; <ls>RPrāt.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=26633]</L>
the derivation (of a poem) from a <s1>Ṛṣi</s1> author.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=26635]</L>
haraRa: हरण <lex>mf(आ or ई)n.</lex> (only <ab>ifc.</ab>) carrying, holding, containing (<ab>e.g.</ab> बलि-हरणी दर्वी, ‘a ladle containing an oblation’), <ls>ĀśvGṛ.</ls><info lex="m:f#A:f#I:n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=260758]</L>
taking away, removing (<ab>e.g.</ab> रजो-ह्° ‘removing dust’), <ls>Kauś.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=260759]</L>
हरण <lex>n.</lex> the act of carrying or bringing or fetching, <ls>KātyŚr.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=260763]</L>
a gift to a student at his initiation, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=260769]</L>
fodder given to a stallion (= वाडब-ह्°), <ls>Kāś.</ls> on <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 2, 65</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=260770]</L>
(<ls>L.</ls> also ‘a <ab>partic.</ab> gesture’ [<ab>esp.</ab> of an archer in shooting]; ‘boiling water’; ‘semen virile’; ‘gold’). <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=260771]</L>
tAna[m]: तान <lex>m.</lex> (√ <hom>3.</hom> तन्) a fibre, <ls>Suśr. i, 25</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=83833]</L>
a tone, <ls>MBh. ii, 133</ls> and <ls n="MBh. ii,">391</ls>; <ls n="MBh.">xiii, 3888</ls>; <ls>Kum. i, 8</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=83834]</L>
a monotonous tone (in reciting, एक-श्रुति), <ls>KātyŚr. i, 8, 18</ls>; <ls>Vait.</ls>; <ls>Bhāṣik.</ls>; <ls>Nyāyam.</ls>; <ls>VPrāt.</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=83835]</L>
an object of sense (or = तात्पर्य), <ls>L.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> एक-)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=83836]</L>
tamam: तमम् <lex>ind.</lex> so as to faint away, <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 4, 93.</ls><info lex="ind"/><L>[ID=82893]</L>
tama: <hom>1.</hom> तम <lex>m.</lex> (<ls>Pāṇ. vii, 3, 34</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>) = तमस् (‘the ascending node’, <ls>VarBṛ.</ls> [?] <ls>Jyot.</ls>), <ls>L.</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=82868]</L>
the point of the foot, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=82872]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> तम an affix forming the <ab>superl.</ab> degree of adjectives and rarely of substantives (कण्व-, &c.), <ls>Suśr. i, 20, 11</ls><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=83005]</L>
Adaram: आ-दर <lex>m.</lex> respect, regard, notice<info lex="m"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=24022]</L>
आदरं- √ <hom>1.</hom> कृ, to exert or interest one's self for<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=24024]</L>
sahya: सह्य <lex>mfn.</lex> to be borne or endured, endurable, tolerable, resistible, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=240067]</L>
able to bear, equal to, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=240068]</L>
सह्य <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of one of the 7 principal ranges of mountains in India (see कुल-गिरि)<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=240071]</L>
of a mountainous district (in which the <s1>Go-dāvarī</s1> rises in the <ab>N.W.</ab> of the Deccan), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>VarBṛS.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=240072]</L>
of a son of <s1>Vivasvat</s1> (<ab>v.l.</ab> मह्य), <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=240073]</L>
kzaya: क्षय See √ <hom>1.</hom> <hom>2.</hom> and <hom>4.</hom> क्षि.<info hui="a"/><listinfo n="rev1"/><L>[ID=59135]</L>
<hom>1.</hom> क्षय <lex>m.</lex> ‘dominion’, <ls>Sāy.</ls> (on, <ls>RV. vii, 46, 2</ls>). <info n="rev" pc="1325,3"/><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=59267]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> क्षय <lex>mfn.</lex> dwelling, residing, <ls>RV. iii, 2, 13</ls>; <ls n="RV.">viii, 64, 4</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><listinfo n="rev1"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=59273]</L>

क्षय <lex>m.</lex> an abode, dwelling-place, seat, house (<ab>cf.</ab> उरु- and सु-क्षय, रथ-, दिविक्षय), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>VS. v, 38</ls>; <ls>TS.</ls>; <ls>Pāṇ.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=59274]</L>
the house of <s1>Yama</s1> (<ab>cf.</ab> यम-क्ष्°, वैवस्वत-क्ष्°)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=59275]</L>
abode in <s1>Yama</s1>'s dominion <ab>Comm.</ab> on <ls>R. (ed. Bomb.) ii, 109, 11</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=59276]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> क्षय (the accent is on the last syllable in the sense ‘destruction’, <ab>accord.</ab> to <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 3, 56</ls> and <ls n="Pāṇ.">vi, 1, 63</ls>.) <lex>m.</lex> (<ls>Pāṇ. vi, 1, 201</ls>) loss, waste, wane, diminution, destruction, decay, wasting or wearing away (often <ab>ifc.</ab>), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c. <info n="rev" pc="1325,3"/><info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=59377]</L>
fall (as of prices, opposed to वृद्धि, <ab>e.g.</ab> क्षयो वृद्धिश् च पण्यानाम्, ‘the fall and rise in the price of commodities’), <ls>Yājñ. ii, 258</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=59378]</L>

end, termination (<ab>e.g.</ab> निद्रा-क्ष्°, the end of sleep, <ls>R. vi, 105, 14</ls>; दिन-क्षये, at the end of day, <ls>MBh. i, 699</ls>; <ls>R. iv, 3, 10</ls>; जीवित-क्षये, at the end of life, <ls>Daś.</ls>; आयुषः क्ष्° <ab>id.</ab>, <ls>Ragh.</ls>; क्षयं √ गम्, √ या, √ इ, or उप√ इ, to become less, be diminished, go to destruction, come to an end, perish, <ls>Nal.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Suśr.</ls>; <ls>VarBṛS.</ls>; <ls>Daś.</ls>; <ls>Amar.</ls>; <ls>Hit.</ls>; क्षयं√ नी, to destroy, <ls>R. v, 36, 51</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=59380]</L>
the destruction of the universe, <ls>Pañcat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=59383]</L>
क्षय (अम्), <lex>n.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of the last year in the sixty years' <s1>Bṛhaspati</s1> cycle, <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=59389]</L>
malla: मल्ल <lex>m.</lex> a wrestler or boxer by profession (the offspring of an out-caste <s1>Kṣatriya</s1> by a <s1 n="Kṣatriya">Kṣ°</s1> female who was previously the wife of another out-caste, <ls>Mn. x, 22</ls>; <ls n="Mn.">xii, 45</ls>), an athlete, a very strong man, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>Var.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=158872]</L>
of the 21st <s1>Arhat</s1> of the future <s1>Utsarpiṇī</s1>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=158874]</L>
a vessel, boiler, <ls>Divyāv.</ls> (also <lex type="hwalt">f(ई). </lex>, <ls>L.</ls>)<info lex="f#I"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=158877]</L>
the remnant of an oblation, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=158878]</L>
a kind of fish (= कपालिन्), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=158879]</L>
vajra: वज्र <lex>m.</lex> <lex>n.</lex> ‘the hard or mighty one’, a thunderbolt (<ab>esp.</ab> that of <s1>Indra</s1>, said to have been formed out of the bones of the <s1>Ṛṣi</s1> <s1>Dadhīca</s1> or <s1>Dadhīci</s1> [<ab>q.v.</ab>], and shaped like a circular discus, or in later times regarded as having the form of two transverse bolts crossing each other thus x; sometimes also applied to similar weapons used by various gods or superhuman beings, or to any mythical weapon destructive of spells or charms, also to मन्यु, ‘wrath’, <ls>RV.</ls> or [with अपाम्] to a jet of water, <ls>AV.</ls> &c. &c.; also applied to a thunderbolt in general or to the lightning evolved from the centrifugal energy of the circular <ab n="thunderbolt">th°</ab> of <s1>Indra</s1> when launched at a foe; in Northern <ns>Buddhist</ns> countries it is shaped like a dumb-bell and called Dorje; see <ls>MWB. 201</ls>; <ls n="MWB.">322</ls> &c.), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. <info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=184795]</L>
a diamond (thought to be as hard as the <ab n="thunderbolt">th°</ab> or of the same substance with it), <ls>ṢaḍvBr.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184796]</L>
a kind of penance (feeding for a month on only barley prepared with cow's urine), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184798]</L>
वज्र <lex>m.</lex> a form of military array, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c. (<ab>cf.</ab> -व्यूह)<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=184800]</L>
a kind of column or pillar, <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184801]</L>
a <ab>partic.</ab> form of the moon, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184802]</L>
a kind of hard mortar or cement (कल्क), <ls>VarBṛS.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> -लेप)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184804]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of the 15th of the 27 <s1>Yoga</s1>s or astronomical divisions of time, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184805]</L>
वज्र <lex>n.</lex> denunciation in strong language (compared to thunder), <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Sāh.</ls>; <ls>Pratāp.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> वाक्य- and वाग्-व्°)<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=184823]</L>
a kind of hard iron or steel, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184824]</L>
a <ab>partic.</ab> posture in sitting, <ls>Cat.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> वज्रा<स्र्स्>सन)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184825]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of a <ab>partic.</ab> configurations of the planets and stars (in which favourable planets are situated in the 1st and 7th houses and unfavourable in the 4th and 10th), <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184826]</L>
the blossom of the <bot>sesamum</bot> or of any plant called <s1>Vajra</s1>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184828]</L>
shaped like a kind of cross (<ab>cf.</ab> above), forked, zigzag, <ls>ib.</ls> <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184832]</L>
dAva: दाव <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>2.</hom> दु, <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 1, 142</ls>) conflagration, <ab>esp.</ab> a forest conflagration, <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=91836]</L>
दाव <lex>m.</lex> <lex>n.</lex> a forest, <ls>MBh.</ls> (always connected with fire), <ls>Ragh. ii, 8.</ls><info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=91839]</L>
Sama: शम <lex>m.</lex> tranquillity, calmness, rest, equanimity, quietude or quietism, absence of passion, abstraction from external objects through intense meditation (शमं √ कृ, ‘to calm one's self’, ‘be tranquil’), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=212912]</L>
Quietism or Tranquillity (personified as a son of <s1>Dharma</s1> and husband of <s1>Prāpti</s1>), <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=212914]</L>
tranquillization, pacification, allayment, alleviation, cessation, extinction, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=212915]</L>
absence of sexual passion or excitement, impotence, <ls>TāṇḍBr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=212916]</L>
alleviation or cure of disease, convalescence, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=212917]</L>
final happiness, emancipation from all the illusions of existence, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=212918]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a king of the <s1>Nandi-vega</s1>s, <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=212922]</L>
शम <lex>mfn.</lex> tame, domestic, <ls>RV. i, 32, 15</ls>; <ls n="RV. i,">33, 15.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=212926]</L>
Sokam: शोक <lex>mfn.</lex> (√ शुच्) burning, hot, <ls>AV.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=221341]</L>
शोक <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>) flame, glow, heat, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls><info lex="m:f#A"/><L>[ID=221342]</L>

vaham: वह <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab>) carrying, bearing, conveying, bringing, causing, producing, effecting (<ab>cf.</ab> गन्ध-, दारु-, पुण्य-व्° &c.)<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=189254]</L>
flowing through or into or towards (<ab>cf.</ab> पर-लोक-व्°, सर्व-लोक-व्° &c.)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=189255]</L>

वह <lex>m.</lex> the act of bearing or conveying (<ab>cf.</ab> दुर्-, सुख-व्°)<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=189259]</L>
the shoulder of an ox or any draught animal, <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>Br.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=189260]</L>

Samana: शमन <lex>mf(ई)n.</lex> calming, tranquillizing, soothing, allaying, extinguishing, destroying, <ls>KātyŚr.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f#I:n"/><L>[ID=212955]</L>

शमन <lex>n.</lex> the act of calming, appeasing, allaying, tranquillization, pacification, extinction, destruction, <ls>Kauś.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c. killing, slaying, immolation, <ls>Kauś.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=212960]</L>
a mode of sipping water (<ab>prob.</ab> for चमन), <ls>MW.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=212962]</L>
aSani: अशनि <lex>f.</lex> (rarely <lex type="hwalt">m.</lex>, <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Pāṇ.</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>) the thunderbolt, a flash of lightning, <ls>RV.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f"/><listinfo n="sup"/><L>[ID=19476]</L>
the tip of a missile, <ls>RV. x, 87, 4</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=19477]</L>

AnI: आ-√ नी <ab>P.</ab> -नयति (1. <ab>pl.</ab> आ-नयामसि, <ls>AV. v, 25, 8</ls>; <ab>Impv.</ab> 2. <ab>sg.</ab> आ-नय, 3. <ab>sg.</ab> आ-नयतु; <ab>pf.</ab> आ-निनाय, <ls>AV. v, 17, 2</ls>, and आ-निनाय, <ls>RV. viii, 21, 9</ls> <pb n="140,3"/>; <ab>inf.</ab> -नेतवै, <ls>ŚBr. ii, 1, 14, 16</ls>) <ab>Ā.</ab> (1. <ab>sg.</ab> -नये, <ls>R.</ls>) <div n="to"/>to lead towards or near; <div n="to"/>to bring, carry to a place (<ab>acc.</ab> or <ab>loc.</ab>); <div n="to"/>to fetch, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>SV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/> (<ab>perf.</ab> <ab>periphr.</ab> -नयामास, <ls>MBh. iii, 2282</ls>) to cause to bring or fetch; <div n="to"/>to bring back or take back, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to pour in, mix in <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to bring any one to, reduce to any state, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to deduce, calculate; <div n="to"/>to use, employ, prove: <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> <ab>P.</ab> -नाययति, to cause to be brought or fetched or led near, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Ragh.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls> &c.: <div n="vp"/><ab>Desid.</ab> -निनीषति, to intend or wish to bring near, <ls>BhP. x, 89, 42.</ls><info verb="pre" cp="PĀ" parse="A+nI"/><L>[ID=24523]</L>
rama: रम <lex>mfn.</lex> pleasing, delighting, rejoicing (only <ab>ifc.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> मनो-र्°)<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=175086]</L>
aSma: <hom>1.</hom> अश्म <ab>ifc.</ab> for <hom>2.</hom> अश्मन्, a stone, <ls>Pāṇ. v, 4, 94.</ls><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=19708]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of the 5th house from the <s1>Lagna</s1>, <ls>Var.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=101270]</L>

authority, power, control, dominion (in <ls>AV.</ls> personified), <ls>ib.</ls> (<ab>acc.</ab> with verbs of going, <ab>e.g.</ab> with √ इ, अनु-√ इ, √ गम्, आ-√ गम्, √ य, आ-√ पद्, आ-√ स्था &c., ‘to fall into a person's [<ab>gen.</ab>] power, become subject or give way to’; <ab>acc.</ab> with √ नी, आ-√ नी and प्र-√ युज्, or <ab>loc.</ab> with √ कृ, √ लभ् or <ab>Caus.</ab> of √ स्था or सं-√ स्था, ‘to reduce to subjection, subdue’; <ab>loc.</ab> with √ भू, √ वृत्, √ स्था and सं-√ स्था, ‘to be in a person's [<ab>gen.</ab>] power’; वशेन, °शात्, and °श-तः, with <ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>ifc.</ab>, ‘by command of, by force of, on account of, by means of, according to’)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=188396]</L>

the hand (= हस्त, also as a measure of length), <ls>VarBṛS.</ls>; <ls>Naiṣ.</ls>; <ls>KātyŚr.</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=213353]</L>

raTa: <hom>1.</hom> रथ <lex>m.</lex> (√ <hom>4.</hom> ऋ) ‘goer’, a chariot, car, <ab>esp.</ab> a two-wheeled war-chariot (lighter and swifter than the अनस्, <ab>q.v.</ab>), any vehicle or equipage or carriage (applied also to the vehicles of the gods), waggon, cart, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>)<info lex="m:f#A"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=174494]</L>

in that place, there, <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/>

thereupon, then, after that, afterwards (sometimes corresponding to preceding particles like अग्रे, पुरस्, पूर्वम्, प्रथमम्, प्राक्, <ls>ŚBr. xiv</ls>; <ls>Mn. ii, 60</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls> &c.; corresponding to प्रथम, <ls>RV. i, 83, 5</ls>; also correlative of यद् [<ls n="RV.">x, 85, 5</ls> and <ls n="RV. x,">121, 7</ls>; <ls>AV. xii, 4, 7 ff.</ls>], यत्र <pb n="432,3"/>[<ls>ŚBr. i</ls>], यदा [<ls>Nal. xx</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>], यदि [<ls>ChUp.</ls>; <ls>Nal.</ls> &c.], चे<स्र्स्>द् [<ls>TUp. ii, 6</ls>; <ls>Śak. v, 28/29</ls> <ab>v.l.</ab>]; often superfluous after an <ab>ind.p.</ab> or after तदा or अथ, <ls>Mn.</ls> &c.)<info lex="inh"/>

त°तः पश्चात् <ab>id.</ab>, <ls>Mn. iii, 116 f.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=81795]</L>
त°तः-प्रभृति thenceforth, <ls>Nal. ii</ls>, <ls n="Nal.">i</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/>
त°तस् ततः (in <ab>dram.</ab>) what then? what took place after that? <ls>Ratnāv.</ls>; <ls>Hit.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=81796]</L>

त°तस् ततः, from that and that place, here and there, hither and thither, from all sides, to everyplace, everywhere, <ls>PārGṛ. iii, 13, 6</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
त°तस् ततः (correlative of यतो-यतः, from whatever place, wherever) to that place, <ls>Śak. i, 23</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
त°तो ऽन्यतस्, ‘to another place than that’, to some other place, <ls>Mn. ii, 200</ls><info lex="inh"/>
त°तो ऽन्यत्र = तस्माद् अन्यस्मिन्, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
त°तो ऽपरम् afterwards, at another time, <ls>AitBr. vii, 17, 4</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=81797]</L>
[<ab>cf.</ab> <gk>τότε</gk>, <gk>τόθεν</gk>], <info lex="inh"/>
araRi: <hom>1.</hom> अरणि <lex>f.</lex> ‘being fitted into’ or ‘turning round’, the piece of wood (taken from the <bot>Ficus Religiosa</bot> or <bot>Premna Spinosa</bot>) used for kindling fire by attrition, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. (generally distinction is made between the lower one and the upper one, अधरा<स्र्स्>रणि and उत्तरा<स्र्स्>रणि, the former may also be meant by अरणि alone without अधर)<info lex="f"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=15052]</L>
(figuratively) a mother, <ls>Hariv.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> पाण्डवा<स्र्स्>रणि and सुरा<स्र्स्>रणि)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=15053]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> अ-रणि <lex>f.</lex> discomfort, pain, <ls>AV. i, 18, 2.</ls><info lex="f"/><listinfo n="sup"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=15060]</L>
<ab>accord.</ab> to some, ‘uncouthness’ [<ls>Sāy.</ls> reads अरणीम्], <ls>AV. i, 18, 2</ls>.<info n="sup"/>
sa: 1. स the last of the three sibilants (it belongs to the dental class and in sound corresponds to s in sin).[ID=225584]
<hom>2.</hom> स (in prosody) an anapest (˘ ˘ ¯)<info hui="2"/><L>[ID=225587]</L>
<hom>3.</hom> स (in music) an abbreviated term for षड्-ज (see <pcol>p. 1109, col. 2</pcol>).<info hui="3"/><L>[ID=225590]</L>
<hom>4.</hom> स <lex>m.</lex> (only <ls>L.</ls>) a snake<info lex="m"/><info hui="4"/><L>[ID=225591]</L>
air, wind<info lex="inh"/>
a bird<info lex="inh"/>
<ab>N.</ab> of <s1>Viṣṇu</s1> or <s1>Śiva</s1><info lex="inh"/>
स <lex>n.</lex> knowledge<info lex="n"/>
meditation<info lex="inh"/>
a carriage road<info lex="inh"/>
a fence.<info lex="inh"/>
<hom>5.</hom> स <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ सन्) procuring, bestowing (only <ab>ifc.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> पलु-ष and प्रिय-स). <info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="5"/><L>[ID=225592]</L>

<hom>6.</hom> स the actual base for the <ab>nom.</ab> case of the 3rd <ab>pers.</ab> <ab>pron.</ab> तद्, <ab>q.v.</ab> (occurring only in the <ab>nom.</ab> <ab>sg.</ab> <lex type="hwinfo">mf.</lex> [स or सस्, सा], and in the <lang>Ved.</lang> <ab>loc.</ab> [सस्मिन्, <ls>RV. i, 152, 6</ls>; <ls n="RV.">i, 174, 4</ls>; <ls n="RV.">x, 95, 11</ls>]; the final स् of the <ab>nom.</ab> <lex type="hwinfo">m.</lex> is dropped before all consonants [except before प् in <ls>RV. v, 2, 4</ls>, and before त् in <ls>RV. viii, 33, 16</ls>] and appears only at the end of a sentence in the form of <s1>Visarga</s1>; स occasionally blends with another vowel [as in सई<स्र्स्>षः]; and it is often for emphasis connected with another <ab>pron.</ab> as with अहम्, त्वम्, एष, अयम् &c. [<ab>e.g.</ab> सो ऽहम्, स त्वम्, ‘I (or thou) that very person’; <ab>cf.</ab> under तद्, <ab>p.</ab> 434], the verb then following in the 1st and 2nd <ab>pers.</ab> even if अहम् or त्वम् be omitted [<ab>e.g.</ab> स त्वा पृच्छामि ‘I that very person ask you’, <ls>BṛĀrUp.</ls>; स वै नो ब्रूहि ‘do thou tell us’, <ls>ŚBr.</ls>]; similarly, to denote emphasis, with भवान् [<ab>e.g.</ab> स भवान् विजयाय प्रतिष्ठताम्, ‘let your Highness set out for victory’, <ls>Śak.</ls>]; it sometimes [and frequently in the <s1>Brāhmaṇa</s1>s] stands as the first word of a sentence preceding a <ab>rel.</ab> pronoun or <ab>adv.</ab> such as य, यद्, यदि, यथा, चे<स्र्स्>द्; in this position स may be used pleonastically or as a kind of <lex type="hwinfo">ind.</lex>, even where another gender or number is required [<ab>e.g.</ab> स यदि स्थावरा आपो भनन्ति, ‘if those waters are stagnant’, <ls>ŚBr.</ls>]; in the <s1>Sāṃkhya</s1> स, like एष, क, and य, is used to denote <s1>Puruṣa</s1>, ‘the Universal Soul’), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. <info lexcat="LEXID=pron,STEM=tad"/><info hui="6"/><L>[ID=225593]</L>
स [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang>Zd.</lang> <etym>hō</etym>, <etym>hā</etym>; <lang>Gk.</lang> <gk>ὁ</gk>, <gk>ἡ</gk>.]

<hom>7.</hom> स <lex>ind.</lex> (connected with सह, सम्, सम, and occasionally in <ls>BhP.</ls> standing for सह with <ab>instr.</ab>) an inseparable prefix expressing ‘junction’, ‘conjunction’, ‘possession’ (as <ab>opp.</ab> to अ <ab>priv.</ab>), ‘similarity’, ‘equality’<info lex="ind"/><info hui="7"/><L>[ID=225596]</L>

(and when compounded with nouns to form adjectives and adverbs it may be translated by ‘with’, ‘together or along with’, ‘accompanied by’, ‘added to’, ‘having’, ‘possessing’, ‘containing’, ‘having the same’ [<ab>cf.</ab> स-कोप, सा<स्र्स्>ग्नि, स-भाय, स-द्रोण, स-धर्मन्, स-वर्ण]; or it may = ‘ly’, as in स-कोपम्, ‘angrily’, सो<स्र्स्>पधि, ‘fraudulently’), <ls>RV.</ls>; &c. <info lex="inh"/>

स [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang>Gk.</lang> <gk>ἁ</gk> in <gk>ἁπλοῦς</gk>; <lang>Lat.</lang> <etym>sim</etym> in <etym>simplex</etym>; <etym>sem</etym> in <etym>semel</etym>, <etym>semper</etym> <lang>Eng.</lang> <etym>same</etym>.]
