vaSA: वशा <lex>f.</lex> (rather <ab>fr.</ab> √ वाश्, as ‘the lowing animal’, than <ab>fr.</ab> √ वश्) a cow (<ab>esp.</ab> barren), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>Br.</ls>; <ls>GṛŚrS.</ls><info lex="f"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=188522]</L>
Atata: आ-तत <lex>mfn.</lex> spread, extended, stretched or drawn (as a bow or bow string), <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=23344]</L>
fixed on, clinging to (<ab>loc.</ab>), <ls>RV. i, 22, 20</ls>; <ls n="RV. i,">105, 9</ls>; <ls>PraśnaUp.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> अन्-आत्°.)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=23346]</L>
sTAna: स्थान <lex>n.</lex> (also said to be <lex type="hwalt">m.</lex>, <ls>Siddh.</ls>) the act of standing, standing firmly, being fixed or stationary, <ls>AV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m:n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=255374]</L>
position or posture of the body (in shooting &c.), <ls>R.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255375]</L>
staying, abiding, being in or on (<ab>loc.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>Daś.</ls>; <ls>Kām.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>Sāh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255376]</L>
storing-place or storage (of goods), <ls>Mn. viii, 401</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255377]</L>
firm bearing (of troops), sustaining a charge (as <ab>opp.</ab> to युद्ध, ‘charging’), <ls>ib.</ls> <ls n="Mn.">vii, 190</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255378]</L>
state, condition (<ab>ifc.</ab> = ‘being in the state of’), <ls>Up.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255379]</L>

continued existence, continuance in the same state (<ab>i.e.</ab> in a kind of neutral state unmarked by loss or gain), continuing as or as long as (with <ab>instr.</ab>), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255380]</L>
a state of perfect tranquillity, <ls>Sarvad.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255381]</L>
station, rank, office, appointment, dignity, degree, <ls>MaitrUp.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255382]</L>

place of standing or staying, any place, spot, locality, abode, dwelling, house, site (स्थाने स्थाने or स्थाने स्थानेषु, ‘in different places’, ‘here and there’), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255383]</L>

place or room, stead (स्थाने with <ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>ifc.</ab> ‘in place of’, ‘instead of’, ‘in lieu of’; रिपु-स्थाने-√ वृत्, ‘to act in the place of an enemy’; विलोचन-स्थान-गत, ‘acting the part of eyes’; also स्थान <ab>ifc.</ab> = ‘taking the place of’, ‘acting as’, ‘representing’ or ‘represented by’ <ab>e.g.</ab> पितृ-स्थ्°, ‘acting as a father’ or ‘represented by a <ab n="father">f°</ab>’; इयङ्-उवङ्-स्थान, ‘<ab n="represented">repr°</ab> by इय् or उव्’ [as ई and ऊ, <ls>Pāṇ. i, 4, 4</ls>]; in <s1>Pāṇini</s1>'s grammar the <ab>gen.</ab> case is often used alone, when the word स्थाने has to be supplied, <ab>e.g.</ab> हन्तेर् जः, ‘ज is to be substituted in place of हन्’, <ls n="Pāṇ.">i, 1, 49</ls>), <ls>AitBr.</ls>; <ls>GṛŚrS.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255384]</L>
place for, receptacle of (<ab>gen.</ab>), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255385]</L>
proper or right place (स्थाने, ‘in the right place or at the right time, seasonably, justly’), <ls>PañcavBr.</ls> &c. &c. (<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>g.</ab> स्वर्-आदि)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255386]</L>

province, region, domain, sphere (of gods or virtuous men; said to be in one of three places, <ab>viz.</ab> ‘earth’ or ‘atmosphere’ or ‘heaven’; <ab>accord.</ab> to some that of virtuous <ns>Brāhmans</ns> is called <s1>Prājāpatya</s1>; of <s1>Kṣatriya</s1>s, <s1>Aindra</s1>; of <s1>Vaiśya</s1>s, <s1>Māruta</s1>; of <s1>Śūdra</s1>s, <s1>Gāndharva</s1>), <ls>Nir.</ls>; <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255387]</L>
the main support or strength or chief constituent of a kingdom (said to be four, <ab>viz.</ab> ‘army’, ‘treasury’, ‘city’, ‘territory’), <ls>Mn. vii, 56</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255388]</L>
a stronghold, fortress, <ls>Pañcat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255389]</L>

the place or organ of utterance of any sound (said to be 8 in number, <ab>viz.</ab> कण्ठ, ‘throat’; तालु, ‘palate’; मूर्धन्, ‘top of palate’; दन्त, ‘teeth’; ओष्ठ, ‘lips’; कण्ठ-तालु, ‘throat and palate’; कण्ठ्ऽ-ओष्ठ, ‘throat and lips’; दन्त्ऽ-ओष्ठ, ‘teeth and lips’; to which are added नासिका, ‘nose’, said to be the place of utterance of true <s1>Anusvāra</s1>, and उरस्, ‘chest’, of <s1>Visarga</s1>), <ls>Pāṇ. i, 1, 9</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>; <ls>Prāt.</ls>; <ls>Sarvad.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255390]</L>
any organ of sense (<ab>e.g.</ab> the eye), <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255391]</L>

the pitch or key of the voice, note, tone (of which <ab>accord.</ab> to <ls>RPrāt.</ls>, there are three [see मन्द्र], or <ab>accord.</ab> to <ls>TPrāt.</ls>, seven; वीना च्युता स्थानात्, ‘a lute out of tune’), <ls>ŚrS.</ls>; <ls>Prāt.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255392]</L>
shape, form, appearance (as of the moon), <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255393]</L>
the part or character of an actor, <ls>MW.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255394]</L>
case, occurrence (ने<स्र्स्>दं स्थानं विद्यते, ‘this case does not occur’), <ls>Yājñ.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls>; <ls>Vajracch.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255395]</L>

occasion, opportunity for (<ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>; °ने <lex type="phw">ind.</lex> ‘occasionally’), <ls>ŚrS.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info phwchild="255404.1"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255396]</L>

cause or object of (<ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> शुल्क-स्थान, ‘an object of toll’; पूजा- or मान्य-स्थ्°, ‘an object of honour’; also applied to persons; °ने <lex type="phw">ind.</lex> ‘because of’, ‘on account of’), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls><info phwchild="255404.2"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255397]</L>
a section or division (<ab>e.g.</ab> of medicine), <ls>Car.</ls>; <ls>Suśr.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255398]</L>
an <ab>astrol.</ab> mansion or its subdivision, <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255399]</L>
= कार्यो<स्र्स्>त्सर्ग, <ls>Śīl.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255400]</L>
an open place in a town, plain, square, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255401]</L>
a holy place, <ls>MW.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255402]</L>
an altar, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255403]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a <s1>Gandharva</s1> king, <ls>R.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255404]</L>
स्थान , स्थानिन्, स्थापक, °पन &c. See <ab>p.</ab> 1263.<info hui="b"/><L>[ID=255888]</L>
AkASam: आ-काश <lex>m.</lex> (<lang>Ved.</lang>) or (later) <lex type="hw">n.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>) a free or open space, vacuity, <ls>AitBr.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=22103]</L>
the ether, sky or atmosphere, <ls>Naigh.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=22104]</L>

आ-काश <lex>n.</lex> (in <ab>philos.</ab>) the subtle and ethereal fluid (supposed to fill and pervade the universe and to be the peculiar vehicle of life and of sound), <ls>Vedāntas.</ls> &c.<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=22105]</L>
sva: <hom>1.</hom> स्व <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> own, one's own, my own, thy own, his own, her own, our own, their own &c. (referring to all three persons <ab>accord.</ab> to context, often <ab>ibc.</ab>, but generally declinable like the pronominal सर्व, <ab>e.g.</ab> स्वस्मै <ab>dat.</ab> स्वस्मात् <ab>abl.</ab> [optionally in <ab>abl.</ab> <ab>loc.</ab> <ab>sing.</ab> <ab>nom.</ab> <ab>pl.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> तं स्वाद् आस्याद् असृजत्, ‘he created him from his own mouth’, <ls>Mn. i, 94</ls>]; and always like शिव when used substantively [see below]; sometimes used loosely for ‘my’, ‘thy’, ‘his’, ‘our’ [<ab>e.g.</ab> राजा भ्रातरं स्व-गृहम् प्रे<स्र्स्>षयाम्-आस, ‘the king sent his brother to his (<ab>i.e.</ab> the brother's) house’]; in the oblique cases it is used as a reflexive pronoun = आत्मन्, <ab>e.g.</ab> स्वं दूषयति, ‘he defiles himself’; स्वं निन्दन्ति, ‘they blame themselves’), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lexcat="LEXID=pron,STEM=sva"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=257773]</L>
स्व <lex>m.</lex> one's self, the Ego, the human soul, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=257774]</L>
a man of one's own people or tribe, a kinsman, relative, relation, friend (स्वाः, ‘one's own relations’, ‘one's own people’), <ls>AV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=257776]</L>
स्व <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>) one's self, the Ego (<ab>e.g.</ab> स्वं च ब्रह्म च, ‘the Ego and <s1>Brahman</s1>’)<info lex="f#A:n"/><L>[ID=257778]</L>
one's own goods, property, wealth, riches (in this sense said to be also <ab>m.</ab>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=257779]</L>
(in alg.) plus or the affirmative quantity, W. (N.B. in the following comp. o° own stands for one's own.) [ID=257781]

<hom>2.</hom> स्व <ab>Nom.</ab> <ab>P.</ab> स्वति (<ab>pf.</ab> स्वाम्-आस) = स्व इवा<स्र्स्>चरति, he acts like himself or his kindred, <ls>Vop. xxi, 7.</ls><info verb="nom" cp="P"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=258471]</L>
rAsa: <ab>N.</ab> of a <ab>partic.</ab> rustic dance practised by cowherds, (<ab>esp.</ab>) the dance practised by <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1> and the <s1>Gopī</s1>s, <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>Pur.</ls>; <ls>Gīt.</ls> &c. (<ab>cf.</ab> रासक)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=177846]</L>
Ayin: आ<स्र्स्>यिन् <lex>mfn.</lex> coming or hastening near, <ls>TS. ii, 4, 7, 1.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=25715]</L>
rAma: राम <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (<ab>prob.</ab> ‘causing rest’, and in most meanings <ab>fr.</ab> √ रम्) dark, dark-coloured, black (<ab>cf.</ab> रात्रि), <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>TĀr.</ls> (रामः शकुनिः. a black bird, crow, <ls>KāṭhGṛ.</ls>; <ls>Viṣṇ.</ls>)<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=177264]</L>
pleasing, pleasant, charming, lovely, beautiful, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=177266]</L>
राम <lex>m.</lex> a kind of deer, <ls>Car.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=177267]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of various mythical personages (in <s1>Veda</s1> two <s1>Rāma</s1>s are mentioned with the <ab>patr.</ab> <s1>Mārgaveya</s1> and <s1>Aupatasvini</s1>; another <s1 n="Rāma">R°</s1>s with the <ab>patr.</ab> <s1>Jāmadagnya</s1> [<ab>cf.</ab> below] is the supposed author of <ls>RV. x, 110</ls>; in later times three <s1 n="Rāma">R°</s1>s are celebrated, <ab>viz.</ab> 1. <s1>Paraśu-rāma</s1> [<ab>q.v.</ab>], who forms the 6th <s1>Avatāra</s1> of <s1>Viṣṇu</s1> and is sometimes called <s1>Jāmadagnya</s1>, as son of the sage <s1>Jamad-agni</s1> by <s1>Reṇukā</s1>, and sometimes <s1>Bhārgava</s1>, as descended from <s1>Bhṛgu</s1>; 2. <s1>Rāma-candra</s1> [see below]; 3. <s1>Bala-rāma</s1> [<ab>q.v.</ab>], ‘the strong <s1>Rāma</s1>’, also called <s1>Halāyudha</s1> and regarded as elder brother of <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1> [<ls>RTL. 112</ls>] <ab>accord.</ab> to <s1>Jaina</s1>s a <s1>Rāma</s1> is enumerated among the 9 white <s1>Bala</s1>s; and in <ls>VP.</ls> a <s1 n="Rāma">R°</s1>s is mentioned among the 7 <s1>Ṛṣi</s1>s of the 8th <s1>Manv-antara</s1>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. <ab>N.</ab> of a king of <s1>Malla-pura</s1>, <ls>Cat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=177272]</L>
of a king of <s1>Śṛṅga-vera</s1> and patron of <s1>Nāgeśa</s1>, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=177273]</L>

of various authors and teachers (also with आचार्य, उपा<स्र्स्>ध्याय, कवि, चक्र-वर्तिन्, ज्योतिर्-विद्, ज्यौतिषक, तर्क-वाग्-ईश, दीक्षित, दैव-ज्ञ, पण्डित, भट्ट, भट्टा<स्र्स्>चार्य, वाजपेयिन्, शर्मन्, शास्त्रिन्, संयमिन्, सूरि &c.), <ls>Cat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=177274]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of the number ‘three’ (on account of the 3 <s1>Rāma</s1>s), <ls>Hcat.</ls> (रामस्य इषुः, a kind of cane = रामकण्ड, <ls>L.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=177275]</L>
tAras: तार <lex>mfn.</lex> (√ तॄ) carrying across, a saviour, protector (<s1>Rudra</s1>), <ls>VS. xvi, 40</ls>; <ls>ŚiraUp.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=84228]</L>

high (a note), loud, shrill (<lex type="hwinfo">mn.</lex>) a high tone, loud or shrill note, <ls>TāṇḍyaBr. vii, 1, 7</ls> (<ab>compar.</ab> -तर and <ab>superl.</ab> -तम), <ls>TPrāt.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=84230]</L>

of one of <s1>Rāma</s1>'s monkey generals (son of <s1>Bṛhas-pati</s1>, husband of <s1>Tārā</s1>), <ls>MBh. iii, 16372</ls>; <ls>R. i</ls>, <ls n="R.">iv</ls>, <ls n="R.">vi</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=84240]</L>

तार <lex>m.</lex> [<lex>n.</lex> & (आ), <lex>f.</lex>, <ls>L.</ls>] the clearness or transparency of a pearl, clear pearl, <ls>Suśr. v, 3, 19</ls>; <ls>Gīt. xi, 25</ls><info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=84242]</L>
the pupil of the eye, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=84245]</L>

asra: अस्र (अम्), <lex>n.</lex> a tear, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls> &c. (often spelt अश्र). <info lex="n"/><L>[ID=21532]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> अस्र <lex>n.</lex> blood, <ls>Ragh. xvi, 15</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> असृज्.)<info lex="n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=21533]</L>
<hom>3.</hom> अस्र <lex>m.</lex> hair of the head, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=21551]</L>
amAya: अ-माय <lex>mfn.</lex> not cunning, not sagacious, <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>AitBr.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=14062]</L>

Quietism or Tranquillity (personified as a son of <s1>Dharma</s1> and husband of <s1>Prāpti</s1>), <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=212914]</L>

absence of sexual passion or excitement, impotence, <ls>TāṇḍBr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=212916]</L>
alleviation or cure of disease, convalescence, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=212917]</L>
final happiness, emancipation from all the illusions of existence, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=212918]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a king of the <s1>Nandi-vega</s1>s, <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=212922]</L>
शम <lex>mfn.</lex> tame, domestic, <ls>RV. i, 32, 15</ls>; <ls n="RV. i,">33, 15.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=212926]</L>
nada: नद <lex>m.</lex> a roarer, bellower, thunderer, crier, neigher &c. (as a cloud, horse, bull, <ab>met.</ab> a man, <ls n="RV.">i, 179, 4</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="m"/><listinfo n="sup"/><L>[ID=103309]</L>
a river (if thought of as male <ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">ind (-नदम्). </lex>; <ab>cf.</ab> नदी), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="ind#nadam"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=103311]</L>
vARI: <hom>1.</hom> वाणी <lex>f.</lex> sound, voice, music (<ab>pl.</ab> a choir of musicians or singers), <ls>RV.</ls> (the सप्त वाणीस् are referred by the <ab>Comms.</ab> to the seven metres or to the seven notes of the gamut &c.)<info lex="f"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=190566]</L>
speech, language, words, diction, (<ab>esp.</ab>) eloquent speech or fine diction, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190567]</L>
a literary production or composition, <ls>Uttarar.</ls>; <ls>Bhām.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190568]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a metre consisting only of long syllables, <ls>Kāvyād.</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190571]</L>
of a river (<ab>accord.</ab> to some the <s1>Sarasvatī</s1>), <ls>VP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190572]</L>
<ab>du.</ab> the two bars of a car or carriage, <ls>ib.</ls> <ls n="RV.">i, 119, 5.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190604]</L>

amA: <hom>1.</hom> अमा <lex>ind.</lex> (<lang>Ved.</lang> <ab>instr.</ab> <ab>fr.</ab> <hom>2.</hom> अम, <ab>q.v.</ab>) (chiefly <lang>Ved.</lang>) at home, in the house, in the house of (<ab>gen.</ab>), with, <ls>RV.</ls> &c.<info lex="ind"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=14011]</L>
अमा (आ) <lex>f.</lex> = अमा-वास्या, <ab>q.v.</ab> <ab>Comm.</ab> on <ls>Ragh. xiv, 80</ls> (in a verse quoted from <s1>Vyāsa</s1>) <ab>Comm.</ab> on <ls>Sūryas.</ls><info lex="f"/>

able to, capable of (<ab>inf.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>Kālid.</ls>; <ls>Śiś.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=239973]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> सह <lex>ind.</lex> (<ab>prob.</ab> <ab>fr.</ab> <hom>7.</hom> स + धा, which in <s1>Veda</s1> may become ध; <ab>cf.</ab> <hom>1.</hom> सध) together with, along with, with (with √ ग्रह् and आ-√ दा, ‘to take with one’; with √ दा, ‘to give to take away with one’; with कृत्वा and <ab>acc.</ab>, ‘taking with one’, ‘in the company of’; often as a <ab>prepos.</ab> governing <ab>instr.</ab> case, but generally placed after the governed word, <ab>e.g.</ab> तेन सह, ‘along with him’ <pb n="1193,3"/>; exceptionally with <ab>abl.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> ऐश्वर्यात् सह, ‘with sovereignty’, <ls>Cāṇ. 104</ls>)<info lex="ind"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=240102]</L>

in common, in company, jointly, conjointly, in concert (often used as a prefix in <ab>comp.</ab>, expressing ‘community of action’, <ab>e.g.</ab> सहा<स्र्स्>ध्ययन, <ab>q.v.</ab>; or forming adjectives expressing ‘the companion of an action’, <ab>e.g.</ab> सह-चर, <ab>q.v.</ab>)<info lex="inh"/>

at the same time or simultaneously with (prefixed to adverbs of time, <ab>e.g.</ab> सह-पूर्वा<स्र्स्>ह्णम्, <ab>q.v.</ab>; rarely <ab>ifc.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> वैनतेय-स्°, ‘with <s1>Vainateya</s1>’, <ls>Hariv.</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="inh"/>

asattva: <hom>2.</hom> अ-सत्त्व <lex>mfn.</lex> strengthless, without energy, <ls>R.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=20566]</L>
vaha: वह <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab>) carrying, bearing, conveying, bringing, causing, producing, effecting (<ab>cf.</ab> गन्ध-, दारु-, पुण्य-व्° &c.)<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=189254]</L>
flowing through or into or towards (<ab>cf.</ab> पर-लोक-व्°, सर्व-लोक-व्° &c.)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=189255]</L>

vara: <hom>1.</hom> वर <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> वृ), ‘environing’, ‘enclosing’, circumference, space, room, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>TS.</ls> (वर आ पृथिव्याः, on the wide earth)<info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=186562]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of a <ab>partic.</ab> caste (sons of degraded <s1>Kṣatriya</s1>s, <ls>Mn. x, 22</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=103178]</L>

maintaining, supporting (mostly <ab>ifc.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> ऋतम्-, कुलम्-, देहम्-, वाजम्-भ्° and <ab>c.</ab>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=148667]</L>

a burden, load, weight (also a <ab>partic.</ab> measure of weight = भार, <ab>q.v.</ab>, <ls>L.</ls>), <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c. (<ab>acc.</ab> with √ कृ, to place one's weight, support one's self, <ls>Hit.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=148671]</L>

sAdam: साद <lex>m.</lex> sitting (on horseback), riding, <ls>RV. i, 162, 17</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=230639]</L>
sama: <hom>1.</hom> सम <lex>mfn.</lex> (connected with <hom>7.</hom> स and with <hom>2.</hom> सम and समान; <ab>cf.</ab> समह, used as <ab>pron.</ab>: declined like सर्व, <ab>e.g.</ab> समस्मै, <ls>RV. vi, 51, 6</ls>) any, every, <ls>RV.</ls> <info lexcat="LEXID=pron,STEM=sama"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=232988]</L>
सम [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang>Gk.</lang> <gk>ἁμός</gk>, <gk>ἀμός</gk>; <lang>Goth.</lang> <etym>suma</etym>; <lang>Angl.Sax.</lang> <etym>sum</etym>; <lang>Eng.</lang> <etym>some</etym>.]

<hom>2.</hom> सम <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (<ab>prob.</ab> originally identical with <ab>prec.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> समान) even, smooth, flat, plain, level, parallel (कर्ण-स्°, ‘on a level with the ear’; भूमि- or भूमेः समं-√ कृ, ‘to make level with the earth’), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=232989]</L>

same, equal, similar, like, equivalent, like to or identical or homogeneous with (<ab>instr.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> मया सम, ‘like to me’; or <ab>gen.</ab>, rarely <ab>abl.</ab>), like in or with regard to anything (<ab>instr.</ab> <ab>gen.</ab> <ab>loc.</ab>, or -तस्, or <ab>comp.</ab>; समं-√ कृ, ‘to make equal, balance’), <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=232990]</L>
always the same, constant, unchanged, fair, impartial towards (<ab>loc.</ab> or <ab>gen.</ab>), <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=232991]</L>
even (not ‘odd’), a pair, <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=232992]</L>
having the right measure, regular, normal, right, straight (समं-√ कृ, ‘to put right or in order’), <ls>AitBr.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=232993]</L>
equable, neutral, indifferent, <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=232994]</L>
equally distant from extremes, ordinary, common, middling, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=232995]</L>
just, upright, good, straight, honest, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=232996]</L>
easy, convenient, <ls>Pañcat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=232997]</L>
full, complete, whole, entire, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=232998]</L>
सम <lex>m.</lex> peace (perhaps <ab>w.r.</ab> for शम), <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Kām.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=232999]</L>
the point of intersection of the horizon and the meridian line, <ls>Gol.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233000]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of <ab>partic.</ab> zodiacal signs (<ab>esp.</ab> <s1>Vṛṣa</s1>, <s1>Karkaṭa</s1>, <s1>Kanyā</s1>, <s1>Vṛścika</s1>, <s1>Makara</s1>, and <s1>Mīna</s1>), <ls>MW.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233001]</L>
a kind of straight line placed over a numerical figure to mark the process of extracting the square root, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233002]</L>
(in music) a kind of time, <ls>Saṃgīt.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233003]</L>
a grass-conflagration, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233004]</L>
a <s1>Jina</s1>, <ls>Gal.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233005]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a son of <s1>Dharma</s1>, <ls>VP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233006]</L>
of a son of <s1>Dhṛtarāṣṭra</s1>, <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233007]</L>
of a king of the <s1>Nandi-vega</s1>s (<ab>v.l.</ab> शम), <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233008]</L>
सम (अम्), <lex>n.</lex> level ground, a plain (समे भूम्याः, ‘on level ground’), <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=233010]</L>
equability, equanimity, imperturbability, <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233011]</L>
likeness, similarity, equality (एन, ‘equally, in the same manner’), <ls>Kāś.</ls> on <ls>Pāṇ. ii, 3, 18</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233012]</L>
right measure or proportion (एन, ‘exactly, precisely’), <ls>ŚBr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233013]</L>
settlement, compensation, <ls>Mn. viii, 177</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233014]</L>
good circumstances, <ls>Mṛcch.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233015]</L>
(in <ab>rhet.</ab>) a <ab>partic.</ab> figure, sameness of objects compared to one another, <ls>Pratāp.</ls>; <ls>Kuval.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233016]</L>

(in <ab>geom.</ab>) a mean proportional segment (described as a fourth proportional to the two perpendiculars and the link or segment, and used for solving problems in a trapezium), <ls>Col.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233017]</L>
= समा <lex type="nhw">f.</lex> a year (see पाप-स्°, पुण्य-स्°, and सु-षम)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=233018]</L>

सम [<ab>cf.</ab> <lang>Gk.</lang> <gk>ἅμα</gk>, <gk>ὁμός</gk>, <gk>ὁμαλός</gk>; <lang>Lat.</lang> <etym>similis</etym>; <lang>Germ.</lang> <etym>same</etym>, <etym>-sam</etym>; <lang>Eng.</lang> <etym>same</etym>.]
<hom>3.</hom> स-म <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> <hom>7.</hom> स + मा) ‘together with <s1>Lakṣmi</s1>’, happy, prosperous, <ls>Nalod.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=233330]</L>
amam: <hom>1.</hom> अम <lex>m.</lex> impetuosity, violence, strength, power, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=13749]</L>
depriving of sensation, fright, terror, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=13750]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> अम <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>pron.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> अमु) this, <ls>AV. xiv, 2, 71</ls> (quoted in <ls>ŚBr. xiv</ls> & <ls>ĀśvGṛ.</ls>) [The word is also explained by प्रा<स्र्स्>ण, ‘soul’, <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Comm.</ab> on <ls>ChUp. v, 2, 6.</ls>]<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=13768]</L>
mAKaM: माख (<ab>prob.</ab>) <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> मभ) any relationship based upon an oblation offered in common, <ls>Hariv.</ls> (<ab>v.l.</ab> मौख). <info lex="n"/><L>[ID=161941]</L>
jawam: जट <lex>mfn.</lex> wearing twisted locks of hair <ab>g.</ab> अर्श-आदि<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=76519]</L>
amatram: अमत्र <lex>mfn.</lex> violent, strong, firm, <ls>RV. i, 61, 9</ls> and <ls n="RV.">iv, 23, 6</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=13760]</L>
अमत्र <lex>n.</lex> a large drinking vessel, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>Pāṇ. iv, 2, 14</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=13761]</L>
aSmam: <hom>1.</hom> अश्म <ab>ifc.</ab> for <hom>2.</hom> अश्मन्, a stone, <ls>Pāṇ. v, 4, 94.</ls><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=19708]</L>
sahaM: bearing, enduring, withstanding, defying, equal to, a match for (<ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=239971]</L>
able to, capable of (<ab>inf.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>Kālid.</ls>; <ls>Śiś.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=239973]</L>
of a son of <s1>Prāṇa</s1> and <s1>Ūrjasvatī</s1>, <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=239978]</L>
of a son of <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1> and <s1>Mādrī</s1>, <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=239980]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> सह <lex>ind.</lex> (<ab>prob.</ab> <ab>fr.</ab> <hom>7.</hom> स + धा, which in <s1>Veda</s1> may become ध; <ab>cf.</ab> <hom>1.</hom> सध) together with, along with, with (with √ ग्रह् and आ-√ दा, ‘to take with one’; with √ दा, ‘to give to take away with one’; with कृत्वा and <ab>acc.</ab>, ‘taking with one’, ‘in the company of’; often as a <ab>prepos.</ab> governing <ab>instr.</ab> case, but generally placed after the governed word, <ab>e.g.</ab> तेन सह, ‘along with him’ <pb n="1193,3"/>; exceptionally with <ab>abl.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> ऐश्वर्यात् सह, ‘with sovereignty’, <ls>Cāṇ. 104</ls>)<info lex="ind"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=240102]</L>

in common, in company, jointly, conjointly, in concert (often used as a prefix in <ab>comp.</ab>, expressing ‘community of action’, <ab>e.g.</ab> सहा<स्र्स्>ध्ययन, <ab>q.v.</ab>; or forming adjectives expressing ‘the companion of an action’, <ab>e.g.</ab> सह-चर, <ab>q.v.</ab>)<info lex="inh"/>

at the same time or simultaneously with (prefixed to adverbs of time, <ab>e.g.</ab> सह-पूर्वा<स्र्स्>ह्णम्, <ab>q.v.</ab>; rarely <ab>ifc.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> वैनतेय-स्°, ‘with <s1>Vainateya</s1>’, <ls>Hariv.</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="inh"/>
mokzam: मोक्ष <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>) emancipation, liberation, release from (<ab>abl.</ab>, rarely <ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f#A"/><L>[ID=168320]</L>
release from worldly existence or transmigration, final or eternal emancipation, <ls>Up.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c. (<ls>IW. 39</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=168321]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of <ab>partic.</ab> sacred hymns conducive to final <ab n="emancipation">eman°</ab>, <ls>Yājñ.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=168323]</L>

(in <ab>astron.</ab>) the liberation of an eclipsed or occulted planet, the last contact or separation of the eclipsed and eclipsing bodies, end of an eclipse, <ls>Sūryas.</ls>; <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=168324]</L>
falling off or down, <ls>Kum.</ls>; <ls>VarBṛS.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> गर्भ-)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=168325]</L>
setting free, deliverance (of a prisoner), <ls>Gaut.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=168327]</L>
acquittance of an obligation, discharge of a debt (<ab>cf.</ab> रिण-)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=168330]</L>
shedding or causing to flow (tears, blood &c.), <ls>MārkP.</ls>; <ls>Suśr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=168331]</L>
sAma: <hom>1.</hom> साम <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> <hom>1.</hom> सम, of which it is also the <s1>Vṛddhi</s1> form in <ab>comp.</ab>) likeness, similarity, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=242188]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> सा<स्र्स्>म <lex>mfn.</lex> undigested, crude, not sufficiently prepared or matured (a morbid state of the humours), <ls>Car.</ls>; <ls>Bhpr.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=242199]</L>
mAra: the passion of love, god of love, <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=163219]</L>

(with <ns>Buddhists</ns>) the Destroyer, Evil One (who tempts men to indulge their passions and is the great enemy of the <s1>Buddha</s1> and his religion; four <s1>Māra</s1>s are enumerated in <ls>Dharmas. 80</ls>, <ab>viz.</ab> स्कन्ध-, क्लेश-, देवपुत्र-, and मृत्यु-म्°; but the later <ns>Buddhist</ns> theory of races of gods led to the figment of millions of <s1>Māra</s1>s ruled over by a chief <s1>Māra</s1>), <ls>MWB. 208</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=163220]</L>
madam: मद <lex>m.</lex> hilarity, rapture, excitement, inspiration, intoxication, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=155332]</L>

(<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="nhw">f.</lex> आ) sexual desire or enjoyment, wantonness, lust, ruttishness, rut (<ab>esp.</ab> of an elephant), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155335]</L>
pride, arrogance, presumption, conceit of or about (<ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155336]</L>
any exhilarating or intoxicating drink, spirituous liquor, wine, <s1>Soma</s1>, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.,<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155337]</L>
the fluid or juice that exudes from a rutting elephant's temples, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155339]</L>
Intoxication or Insanity personified (as a monster created by <s1>Cyavana</s1>), <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155345]</L>
SaraRa: <hom>1.</hom> शरण <lex>m.</lex> (for <hom>2.</hom> See <pcol>p. 1057, col. 1</pcol>) one of the arrows of <s1>Kāma-deva</s1>, <ls>Cat.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=213589]</L>
शरण <lex>n.</lex> falling asunder, bursting, falling in <ls>Vop.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=213590]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> शरण <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ शृ for श्रि; for <hom>1.</hom> See <ab>p.</ab> 1056) protecting, guarding, defending, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=213663]</L>
शरण <lex>f(आ and ई). </lex> <ab>N.</ab> of various plants &c. (<ab>prob.</ab> <ab>w.r.</ab> for सरणा, °णी, <ab>q.v.</ab>)<info lex="f#A:f#I"/><L>[ID=213667]</L>

शरण <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>), shelter, place of shelter or refuge or rest, hut, house, habitation, abode, lair (of an animal), home, asylum, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="f#A:n"/><L>[ID=213668]</L>

शरण <lex>n.</lex> refuge, protection, refuge with (शरणं √ गम् or या or इ &c., ‘to go to any one for protection, seek refuge with’ [<ab>acc.</ab> or <ab>gen.</ab>]; often <ab>ifc.</ab>), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=213669]</L>
aYjas: अञ्जस् <lex>n.</lex> ointment, a mixture, <ls>RV. i, 132, 2</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=2299]</L>
vARa: <hom>1.</hom> वाण <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ वण्; often written बाण, <ab>q.v.</ab>) sounding, a sound, <ls>Kir. xv, 10</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=190551]</L>
an arrow (see बाण, <ab>p.</ab> 727 for <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>RV. ix, 50, 1</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190552]</L>
music (<ab>esp.</ab> of flutes, harps &c.), <ls>RV. i, 85, 10</ls> &c.; <ls>AV. x, 2, 17</ls> (here written बाण)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190553]</L>
वाण <lex>n.</lex> the sound of a <ab>partic.</ab> little hand-drum, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=190556]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> वाण <ab>w.r.</ab> for वान in वानदण्ड and वानप्रस्थ (see <hom>3.</hom> and <hom>6.</hom> वान).<info hui="2"/><L>[ID=190582]</L>
anekasya: अन्-एक <lex>mfn.</lex> not one, many, much<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=7809]</L>
tattva: तत्—त्व <lex>n.</lex> true or real state, truth, reality, <ls>ŚvetUp.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Bhag.</ls> &c.<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=81839]</L>

(in <ab>phil.</ab>) a true principle (in <s1>Sāṃkhya</s1> <ab>phil.</ab> 25 in number, <ab>viz.</ab> अ-व्यक्त, बुद्धि, अहं-कार, the 5 <s1>Tan-mātra</s1>s, the 5 <s1>Mahā-bhūta</s1>s, the 11 organs including मनस्, and, lastly, पुरुष, <ab>qq.vv.</ab>), <ls>MBh. xii, 11840</ls>; <ls n="MBh.">xiv, 984</ls>; <ls>R. iii, 53, 42</ls>; <ls>Tattvas.</ls>; 24 in number, <ls>MBh. xii, 11242</ls>; <ls>Hariv. 14840</ls> (<ab>m.</ab>); 23 in number, <ls>BhP. iii, 6, 2 ff.</ls>; for other numbers <ab>cf.</ab> <ls n="BhP.">xi, 22, 1 ff.</ls>; <ls>RāmatUp.</ls>; with <s1>Māheśvara</s1>s and <s1>Lokāyatika</s1>s only 5 [<ab>viz.</ab> the 5 elements] are admitted, <ls>Prab. ii, 18/19</ls>; with, <ls>Buddh.</ls> 4, with <s1>Jaina</s1>s 2 or 5 or 7 or 9 <ls>Sarvad. ii f.</ls>; in <s1>Vedānta</s1> <ab>phil.</ab> तत्त्व is regarded as made up of तद् and त्वम्, ‘that [art] thou’, and called महा-वाक्य, the great word by which the identity of the whole world with the one eternal <s1>Brahma</s1> [तद्] is expressed)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=81840]</L>
an element or elementary property, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=81844]</L>
the essence or substance of anything, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=81845]</L>
Sakra: शक्र <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> strong, powerful, mighty (applied to various gods, but <ab>esp.</ab> to <s1>Indra</s1>), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>TBr.</ls>; <ls>Lāṭy.</ls><info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=211048]</L>
SAsam: <hom>2.</hom> शास <lex>m.</lex> (for <hom>1.</hom> See <pcol>p. 1068, col. 3</pcol>) a butcher's knife, <ls>Br.</ls>; <ls>ŚrS.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=216470]</L>
DAraRa: धारण <lex>mf(ई)n.</lex> holding, bearing, keeping (in remembrance), retention, preserving, protecting, maintaining, possessing, having (<ab>ifc.</ab> or with <ab>gen.</ab>), <ls>TĀr.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Suśr.</ls> : <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="m:f#I:n"/><L>[ID=100954]</L>
assuming the shape of (<ab>gen.</ab>), resembling, <ls>MBh. xiii, 739</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=100955]</L>
of a prince of the <s1>Candravatsa</s1>s, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=100958]</L>
धारण <lex>n.</lex> the act of holding, bearing &c., <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=100960]</L>

keeping in remembrance, memory, <ls>TĀr.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls> : immovable concentration of the mind upon (<ab>loc.</ab>), <ls>Vedāntas.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=100963]</L>
धारण <lex>f(आ and ई). </lex> See धारणा and °णी.<info lex="f#A:f#I"/><L>[ID=100966]</L>
aja: <hom>1.</hom> अज <lex>m.</lex> a drove, troop (of <s1>Marut</s1>s), <ls>AV.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=1928]</L>
a driver, mover, instigator, leader<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=1929]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of <s1>Indra</s1>, of <s1>Rudra</s1>, of one of the <s1>Marut</s1>s [अज एक-पा, <ls>RV.</ls>, and अज एक-पाद, <ls>AV.</ls>], of <s1>Agni</s1>, of the sun, of <s1>Brahmā</s1>, of <s1>Viṣṇu</s1>, of <s1>Śiva</s1>, of <s1>Kāma</s1> (<ab>cf.</ab> <hom>2.</hom> अ-ज)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=1930]</L>
the leader of a flock<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=1931]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a descendant of <s1>Viśvāmitra</s1>, and of <s1>Daśaratha</s1>'s or <s1>Dīrghabāhu</s1>'s father<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=1936]</L>
of a kind of rice<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=1938]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> अ-ज <lex>mfn.</lex> not born, existing from all eternity<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=2034]</L>
अ-ज <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of the first uncreated being, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=2035]</L>
maraRa: मरण <lex>n.</lex> the act of dying, death, (<ab>ifc.</ab> dying by; °णं √ <hom>1.</hom> कृ <ab>Ā.</ab> कुरुते, to die), <ls>ŚrS.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=158120]</L>
passing away, cessation (as of lightning or rain), <ls>AitBr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=158121]</L>
a kind of poison, <ls>L.</ls> (<ab>prob.</ab> <ab>w.r.</ab> for मारण)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=158123]</L>
a refuge, asylum, <ls>BhP.</ls> (<ab>prob.</ab> <ab>w.r.</ab> for शरण). <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=158124]</L>
jAnam: <hom>1.</hom> जान <lex>n.</lex> birth, origin, birth place, <ls>RV. i, 37, 9</ls> and <ls n="RV. i,">95, 3</ls>; <ls n="RV.">v</ls>, <ls n="RV.">x</ls>; <ls>AV. vii, 76, 5</ls>; <ls>ŚBr. iii, 2, 1, 40.</ls><info lex="n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=78782]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> जान <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> जन) <ab>patr.</ab> of <s1>Vṛśa</s1> (= वैजान, ‘son of <s1>Vijānā</s1>’ <ab>Sch.</ab>), <ls>TāṇḍyaBr. xiii, 3</ls>; <ls>ĀrṣBr.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=78783]</L>
dAna[m]: <hom>1.</hom> दान <lex>n.</lex> the act of giving, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=91241]</L>
giving up (<ab>cf.</ab> प्राण-, आत्म-, शरीर-, <ls>Pañc. ii</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=91243]</L>

donation, gift [<lang>Lat.</lang> <etym>donum</etym>], <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c. (°नंदा, to offer a <ab n="gift">g°</ab>, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls>; <ls>Hit.</ls> &c.; °नम् प्रयम्, to bestow a <ab n="gift">g°</ab>, <ls>Mn. iv, 234</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=91247]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> दान <lex>n.</lex> cutting off, splitting, dividing, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=91367]</L>
rut-fluid (which flows from an elephant's temples), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=91369]</L>
दान <lex>m.</lex> (only in <ls>RV.</ls>, but <ab>cf.</ab> वसु-) distribution of food or of a sacrificial meal<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=91370]</L>
navana: नवन <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>) the act of praising, laudation, <ls>Nalod.</ls><info lex="f#A:n"/><L>[ID=104615]</L>
ajara: अ-जर <lex>mfn.</lex> (√ जॄ), not subject to old age, undecaying, ever young<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=2085]</L>
sadAnva: सदा—न्व <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ नु) always crying out, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>Nir.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=230769]</L>
adana: अदन <lex>n.</lex> act of eating<info lex="n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=3585]</L>
damanam: दमन <lex>mf(ई)n.</lex> <ab>ifc.</ab> taming, subduing, overpowering, <ls>MBh. viii</ls>; <ls>Bhartṛ.</ls><info lex="m:f#I:n"/><L>[ID=90271]</L>
दमन <lex>m.</lex> a tamer of horses, charioteer, <ls>BhP. iv, 26, 2</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=90272]</L>
of a son of <s1>Vasu-deva</s1> by <s1>Rohiṇī</s1>, <ls>Hariv. 1951</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=90276]</L>
of a son of <s1>Bharadvāja</s1>, <ls>KāśīKh. lxxiv</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=90278]</L>
of an old king, <ls>MBh. i, 224</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=90279]</L>
amasya: <hom>1.</hom> अम <lex>m.</lex> impetuosity, violence, strength, power, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=13749]</L>
depriving of sensation, fright, terror, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=13750]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> अम <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>pron.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> अमु) this, <ls>AV. xiv, 2, 71</ls> (quoted in <ls>ŚBr. xiv</ls> & <ls>ĀśvGṛ.</ls>) [The word is also explained by प्रा<स्र्स्>ण, ‘soul’, <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Comm.</ab> on <ls>ChUp. v, 2, 6.</ls>]<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=13768]</L>
asI: असी <lex>f.</lex> (= असि <lex type="nhw">f.</lex> <ab>q.v.</ab>) <ab>N.</ab> of a river (near Benares), <ls>MBh. vi, 338.</ls><info lex="f"/><L>[ID=21020]</L>
kaMsam: कंस अस्, अम्, <lex>m.</lex> <lex>n.</lex> (√ कम्, <ls>Uṇ. iii, 62</ls>), a vessel made of metal, drinking vessel, cup, goblet, <ls>AV. x, 10, 5</ls>; <ls>AitBr.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=41370]</L>
(a noun ending in अस् followed by कंस in a compound does not change its final, <ab>cf.</ab> अयस्-कंस, &c., <ls>Pāṇ. viii, 3, 46</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=41371]</L>
a particular measure (= two <s1>Āḍhaka</s1>s, <ls>Car.</ls>; = one <s1>Āḍhaka</s1>, <ls>L.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=41372]</L>
a metal, tutanag or white copper, brass, bell-metal<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=41373]</L>

कंस (अस्), <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of a king of <s1>Mathurā</s1> (son of <s1>Ugra-sena</s1> and cousin of the <s1>Devakī</s1> who was mother of <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1> [<s1>Ugra-sena</s1> being brother of <s1>Devaka</s1>, who was father of <s1>Devakī</s1>]; he is usually called the uncle, but was really a cousin of <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1>, and became his implacable enemy because it had been prophesied to <s1>Kaṃsa</s1> that he would be killed by a child of <s1>Devakī</s1>; as the foe of the deity he is identified with the <s1>Asura</s1> <s1>Kālanemi</s1>; and, as he was ultimately slain by <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1>, the latter receives epithets like कंस-जित्, conqueror of <s1>Kaṃsa</s1>, &c.), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>VP.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=41374]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a place <ab>g.</ab> तक्षशिला<स्र्स्>दि, <ls>Pāṇ. iv, 3, 93</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=41375]</L>
asa: अ-स (<ls>Pāṇ. vi, 1, 132</ls>) not he, <ls>Śiś. i, 69</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> अ-तद्.)<L>[ID=20359]</L>
hata: हत <lex>mfn.</lex> struck, beaten (also said of a drum), smitten, killed, slain, destroyed, ended, gone, lost (often <ab>ibc.</ab> = ‘destitute of’, ‘bereft of’, ‘-less’), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=260299]</L>
injured, marred, hurt, wounded (<ab>lit.</ab> and <ab>fig.</ab>), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=260300]</L>
visited or afflicted or tormented by, struggling with, suffering from (<ab>instr.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>ChUp.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=260305]</L>
violated (sexually, as a woman), <ls>MBh. viii, 2037</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=260307]</L>
ruined, undone, hopeless, miserable, wretched (of persons and things; <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=260308]</L>
deprived of, lapsed from (-तस् or <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=260312]</L>
Aya[m]: आ-√ यम् <ab>P.</ab> -यच्छति and (<lang>Ved.</lang>) -यमति, to stretch, lengthen out, extend, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>Lāṭy.</ls>; <ls>Suśr.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to stretch (a bow); <div n="to"/>to put on (an arrow &c.); <div n="to"/>to draw near, bring hither; <div n="to"/>to fetch, procure, <ls>RV.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to keep, stop, hold in, draw back, restrain, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to produce, <ls>Bhaṭṭ.</ls> : <div n="to"/><ab>Ā.</ab> -यच्छते (<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. i, 3, 28</ls> and <ls n="Pāṇ. i, 3">75</ls>) to stretch one's self or be stretched or strained; <div n="to"/>to grow long, <ls>L.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to grasp, possess, <ls>L.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> -यामयति, to bring near, draw near; <div n="to"/>to carry, fetch, <ls>RV.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to lengthen, extend, <ls>Suśr.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to produce or make visible; <div n="to"/>to show, <ls>MBh.</ls><info verb="pre" cp="PĀ" parse="A+yam"/><L>[ID=25764]</L>
vaSam: <hom>1.</hom> वश <lex>m.</lex> will, wish, desire, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (also <ab>pl.</ab> वशान् अनु or अनु वश, ‘according to wish or will, at pleasure’)<info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=188395]</L>

authority, power, control, dominion (in <ls>AV.</ls> personified), <ls>ib.</ls> (<ab>acc.</ab> with verbs of going, <ab>e.g.</ab> with √ इ, अनु-√ इ, √ गम्, आ-√ गम्, √ य, आ-√ पद्, आ-√ स्था &c., ‘to fall into a person's [<ab>gen.</ab>] power, become subject or give way to’; <ab>acc.</ab> with √ नी, आ-√ नी and प्र-√ युज्, or <ab>loc.</ab> with √ कृ, √ लभ् or <ab>Caus.</ab> of √ स्था or सं-√ स्था, ‘to reduce to subjection, subdue’; <ab>loc.</ab> with √ भू, √ वृत्, √ स्था and सं-√ स्था, ‘to be in a person's [<ab>gen.</ab>] power’; वशेन, °शात्, and °श-तः, with <ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>ifc.</ab>, ‘by command of, by force of, on account of, by means of, according to’)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=188396]</L>
the son of a <s1>Vaiśya</s1> and a <s1>Karaṇī</s1>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=188400]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a <s1>Ṛṣi</s1> preserved by the <s1>Aśvin</s1>s, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=188401]</L>
(with अश्व्य) of the supposed author of <ls>RV. viii, 46</ls> (in <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c. also of this hymn itself)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=188402]</L>
वश <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> willing, submissive, obedient, subject to or dependent on (<ab>gen.</ab>), <ls>Kathās.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls><info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=188406]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> वश <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>cf.</ab> वसा) liquid fat, grease, <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>AitBr.</ls>; <ls>Kāṭh.</ls><info lex="n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=188521]</L>
dahra: <hom>1.</hom> दह्र <lex>mfn.</lex> small, fine, thin, <ls>NārUp.</ls>; <ls>Āp. i, 9, 23</ls> (°रे पर-रात्रे, ‘in the shorter half of the night’)<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=91206]</L>
दह्र <lex>n.</lex> the cavity of the heart, <ls>BhP. iii</ls>; <ls n="BhP.">vi, 9.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=91208]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> दह्र <lex>m.</lex> a wood on fire, <ls>Uṇvṛ.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=91210]</L>
mandra: मन्द्र <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> pleasant, agreeable, charming, (<ab>esp.</ab>) sounding or speaking pleasantly &c., <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>ŚāṅkhGṛ.</ls><info lex="m:f#A:n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=157663]</L>
low, deep (of sound), hollow, rumbling (अम् <lex type="phw">ind.</lex>), <ls>Br.</ls> &c. &c.<info phwchild="157667.1"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=157664]</L>
मन्द्र <lex>m.</lex> a low tone, the low or base tone (स्थान) of the voice (as <ab>opp.</ab> to the middle or मध्यम and the high or उत्तम), <ls>RPrāt.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=157665]</L>
mAsam: मास <lex>m.</lex> (or <lex type="hwalt">n.</lex>, <ls>Siddh.</ls>) the moon (see पूर्ण-म्°)<info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=163896]</L>

a month or the 12th part of the <ns>Hindū</ns> year (there are 4 kinds of months, <ab>viz.</ab> the solar, सौर; the natural, सावन; the stellar, नाक्षत्र, and the lunar, चा<स्र्स्>न्द्र; the latter, which is the most usual and consists of 30 <s1>Tithi</s1>s, being itself of two kinds as reckoned from the new or full moon, <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>IW. 179</ls>; for the names of the months see <ls>ib.</ls> <ls n="IW.">173 n. 3</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (मासम्, for a month; मासम् एकम्, for one month; मासेन, in the course of a month; मासे, in a <ab n="month">m°</ab> = after the lapse of a <ab n="month">m°</ab>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=163897]</L>
a symbolical <ab>N.</ab> for the number ‘twelve’, <ls>Sūryas.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=163898]</L>
vana: <hom>1.</hom> वन <lex>n.</lex> (once <lex type="hwalt">m.</lex>, <ls>R. v, 50, 2</ls>; for <hom>2.</hom> See <pcol>p. 919, col. 1</pcol>) a forest, wood, grove, thicket, quantity of lotuses or other plants growing in a thick cluster (but in older language also applied to a single tree), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m:n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=185717]</L>
a foreign or distant land, <ls>RV. vii, 1, 19</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> अरण्य)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=185719]</L>
a wooden vessel or barrel (for the <s1>Soma</s1> juice), <ls>RV.</ls> (?)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=185721]</L>
a cloud (as the vessel in the sky), <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=185722]</L>
(<ab>prob.</ab>) the body of a carriage, <ls>RV. viii, 34, 18</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=185723]</L>
= रश्मि, a ray of light, <ls>Naigh. i, 4</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=185728]</L>
वन <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of a son of <s1>Uśīnara</s1>, <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=185730]</L>

of one of the 10 orders of mendicants founded by <s1>Śaṃkarācārya</s1> (the members of which affix वन to their names, <ab>cf.</ab> रार्मे<स्र्स्>न्द्र-व्°), <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=185731]</L>
araRa: <hom>1.</hom> अरण <lex>mf(ई)n.</lex> (√ ऋ), foreign, distant, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls><info lex="m:f#I:n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=15049]</L>
अरण <lex>n.</lex> (only for the <ab>etym.</ab> of अरणि) the being fitted (as a piece of wood), <ls>Nir.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=15050]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> अ-रण <lex>mfn.</lex> without fighting (as death <ab>i.e.</ab> natural death), <ls>Bhaṭṭ.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=15059]</L>
saBAm: सभा <lex>f.</lex> (of unknown derivation, but probably to be connected with <hom>7.</hom> स; <ab>ifc.</ab> also सभ, <lex type="hwifc">n.</lex>; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. ii, 4, 23</ls> &c., and एक-सभ) an assembly, congregation, meeting, council, public audience, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="f:n#saBa"/><L>[ID=232903]</L>
social party, society, good society (see <ab>comp.</ab>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=232904]</L>
Society (personified as a daughter of <s1>Prajāpati</s1>), <ls>AV.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=232905]</L>
a place for public meetings, large assembly-room or hall, palace, court of a king or of justice, council-chamber, gambling-house &c., <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=232906]</L>
a house for lodging and accommodating travellers, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; &c.; an eating-house (see महा-स्°). <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=232907]</L>
hara[m]: हर <lex>mf(आ, rarely ई)n.</lex> (only <ab>ifc.</ab>; <ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> हृ) bearing, wearing, taking, conveying, bringing (see कवच-, वार्त्ता-ह्°), taking away, carrying off, removing, destroying (see बल-, शक्ति-ह्°)<info lex="m:f#A:f#I:n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=260675]</L>
the denominator of a fraction, division, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=260683]</L>
akzaya: अ-क्षय <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> exempt from decay, undecaying<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=557]</L>
अ-क्षय <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of the twentieth year in the cycle of Jupiter<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=558]</L>
daSA: दशा (आस्) <lex>f. <ab>pl.</ab></lex> ‘Decads’, <ab>N.</ab> of 10 <ns>Jain</ns> texts (उपा<स्र्स्>सक-. &c.) consisting of 10 <ab>chs.</ab> each.<info lex="f"/><info hui="a"/>

दशा <lex>f.</lex> (√ दंश्?) the fringe of a garment, loose ends of any piece of cloth, skirt or hem, <ls>KātyŚr. iv, 1, 17</ls> (ऊर्णा), <ls>Lāṭy. viii, 6, 22</ls>; <ls>Kauś.</ls>; <ls>ŚāṅkhGṛ. ii, 12, 5</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls> &c.<info lex="f"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=91094]</L>
a wick, <ls>Gobh. iv, 2, 32</ls> (क्षौम-), <ls>Kum. iv, 30</ls>; <ls>Bhartṛ. iii</ls>, <ls n="Bhartṛ.">i</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=91095]</L>
state or condition of life, period of life (youth, manhood, &c.), condition, circumstances, <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls>; <ls>Megh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=91096]</L>
the fate of men as depending on the position of the planets, aspect or position of the planets (at birth &c.), <ls>VarBṛS.</ls>; <ls>VarBṛ.</ls>; <ls>Laghuj.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=91097]</L>
arRasa: अर्णस <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> अर्णस्) agitated, foaming, <ls>RV. v, 54, 6</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=15825]</L>
(<ab>fr.</ab> अर्ण) full of waves, (<ab>g.</ab> तृणा<स्र्स्>दि, <ab>q.v.</ab>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=15826]</L>
ASAM: <hom>1.</hom> आ-शा <lex>f.</lex> wish, desire, hope, expectation, prospect, <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>ChUp.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls> &c.<info lex="f"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=27384]</L>
Hope personified as the wife of a <s1>Vasu</s1>, <ls>Hariv.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=27385]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> आशा <lex>f.</lex> (√ <hom>1.</hom> अश्; for <hom>1.</hom> आशा See आ-√ शंस्), space, region, quarter of the heavens, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>TS.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Ragh.</ls> &c.<info lex="f"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=27436]</L>
paRava[m]: पणव <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>prob.</ab> <ab>fr.</ab> प्र-णव) a small drum or a kind of cymbal (used to accompany singing), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> (also <lex type="hwalt">f(आ). </lex>, <ls>L.</ls>)<info lex="m:f#A"/><L>[ID=114646]</L>
a kind of metre, <ls>Col.</ls> (<ab>v.l.</ab> पन्°)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=114647]</L>
rarARa: रराण <lex>mfn.</lex> (√ रा) distributing, bestowing, bountiful, liberal, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=175295]</L>
varya: वर्य <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>2.</hom> वृ) to be chosen, eligible, to be asked or obtained in marriage, <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 1, 101</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab><info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=187828]</L>
excellent, eminent, chief, principal, best of (<ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=187829]</L>
वर्य <lex>m.</lex> the god of love, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=187830]</L>
dAsI: दासी (ई), <lex>f.</lex> a female servant or slave, <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="f"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=91928]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a plant (= निला or पीता झिन्ती, काक-जङ्घा, नीला<स्र्स्>म्लाण &c.), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=91930]</L>

<ab>cf.</ab> अल्प-, उत्तर-, उरश्-, घन-, तनु-, दन्त-, दशन-, वदन-<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=75461]</L>
छद <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>) a wing, <ls>Nal. ix, 12</ls><info lex="m:f#A"/><L>[ID=75462]</L>

upta: <hom>2.</hom> उप्त <lex>mfn.</lex> scattered, sown, planted, put in the ground, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=186293]</L>
bestrewed or covered with (<ab>instr.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=186294]</L>
mana[m]: <hom>1.</hom> मन <lex>m.</lex> Indian spikenard, <bot>Nardostachys Jatamansi</bot>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=156712]</L>

posterior, hinder, later, last, younger, <ls>RV.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=17855]</L>

dAni[n]: having or receiving gifts (<ab>cf.</ab> अग्रे-). <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=91318]</L>
Arava: आरब or आरव, <lex>m.</lex> an Arabian (<lex>f(ई)</lex>.), <ls>Jain.</ls><info n="sup"/><info lex="m:f#I"/>
आ-रव <lex>m.</lex> (<ls>Pāṇ. iii, 3, 50</ls>) cry, crying, howling<info lex="m"/><info hui="c"/><L>[ID=26217]</L>
dasma: दस्म <lex>mfn.</lex> (√ दंस्) accomplishing wonderful deeds, wonderful, extraordinary, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=91132]</L>
BAM: भा <lex>f.</lex> (आ) light or a beam of <ab n="light">l°</ab>, lustre, splendour, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>Var.</ls> &c. (<ab>cf.</ab> <hom>2.</hom> भा)<info lex="f"/><info hui="a"/>
the shadow of a gnomon, <ls>Sūryas.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
appearance, resemblance, likeness (<ab>ifc.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> अग्नि-भ, गुड-भा, तन्तु-भ)<info lex="inh"/>

<hom>1.</hom> भा <ab>cl.</ab> 2. <ab>P.</ab> (<ls>Dhātup. xxiv, 43</ls>) भाति (<ab>pr. p.</ab> भात् <lex type="part">f.</lex> भान्ती or भाती, <ls>Vop.</ls>; <ab>Pot.</ab> भायात्, <ls>TBr.</ls>; <ab>pl.</ab> बभौ, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.; <ab>aor.</ab> अभासीत् <ab>Gr.</ab> <ls>Bhaṭṭ.</ls>; <ab>fut.</ab> भास्यति, <ls>Br.</ls> &c.), <div n="to"/>to shine, be bright or luminous, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.; <div n="to"/>to shine forth, appear, show one's self, <ls>ib.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to be splendid or beautiful or eminent, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c. (with न, to cut a poor figure, <ls>Kathās.</ls>); <div n="to"/>to appear as, seem, look like, pass for (<ab>nom.</ab> with or without इव <ab>adv.</ab> in वत्), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to be, exist, <ls>W.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to show, exhibit, manifest, <ls>Bhaṭṭ.</ls> (<ab>v.l.</ab>) : <div n="vp"/><ab>Pass.</ab> भायते, <ab>impers.</ab> radiance is put forth by (<ab>instr.</ab>), <ls>Bhaṭṭ.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> भापयते; <div n="vp"/> <ab>aor.</ab> अबीभपत् <ab>Gr.</ab>: <div n="vp"/><ab>Desid.</ab> बिभासति, <ls>ib.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab> बाभायते, बाभेति, बाभाति, <ls>ib.</ls> <info westergaard="BA,24.43,02.0054"/><info whitneyroots="BA,110"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="2P"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=149418]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> भा <lex>f.</lex> (<ab>nom.</ab> <ab>prob.</ab> भास्) light, brightness, splendour &c. (<ab>cf.</ab> <lex type="nhw">f.</lex> of <hom>4.</hom> भ), <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls><info lex="f"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=149419]</L>
SastaM: <hom>1.</hom> शस्त <lex>mfn.</lex> (for <hom>2.</hom> See under √ शस्) recited repeated, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=210872]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> शस्त <lex>mfn.</lex> (for <hom>1.</hom> See <pcol>p. 1044, col. 1</pcol>) cut down, slaughtered, killed, <ls>MBh. iii, 1638.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=214537]</L>
jazaM: जष <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of an aquatic animal (<ab>cf.</ab> झष), <ls>AV. xi, 2, 25</ls>; <ls>TS. v, 5</ls>; <ls>GopBr. ii, 2, 5.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=78361]</L>
yava: <hom>1.</hom> यव <lex>m.</lex> the first half of a month (generally in <ab>pl.</ab>; <ab>accord.</ab> to <ab>Comm.</ab> = पूर्व-पक्षाः; also written याव), <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>Kāṭh.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=170644]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> यव <lex>mfn.</lex> (√ <hom>1.</hom> यु) warding off, averting, <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=170647]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> यव <lex>m.</lex> barley (in the earliest times, <ab>prob.</ab> any grain or corn yielding flour or meal; <ab>pl.</ab> barley-corns), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=170649]</L>

a barley-corn (either as a measure of length = 1/6 or 1/8 of an <s1>Aṅgula</s1>, <ls>VarBṛS.</ls>; or as a weight = 6 or 12 mustard seeds = 1/2 <s1>Guñjā</s1>, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170650]</L>
any grain of seed or seed corn, <ls>Bhpr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170651]</L>
(in palmistry) a figure or mark on the hand resembling a barley-corn (supposed to indicate good fortune), <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170652]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of a <ab>partic.</ab> <ab>astron.</ab> <s1>Yoga</s1> (when the favourable planets are situated in the 4th and 10th mansions and the unfavourable ones in the 1st and 7th), <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170653]</L>
speed, velocity, <ls>W.</ls> (<ab>prob.</ab> <ab>w.r.</ab> for जव); a double convex lens, <ls>ib.</ls> <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170654]</L>
caraRa: चरण <lex>m.</lex> <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>g.</ab> अर्धर्चा<स्र्स्>दि) a foot, <ls>Gobh.</ls>; <ls>Mn. ix, 277</ls>; <ls>Bādar.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c. (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>, <ls>Hariv. 3914</ls>; <ls>Mālav.</ls>)<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=72227]</L>
(<ab>ifc.</ab> <ab>pl.</ab>) ‘the feet of’, the venerable (<ab>N.</ab> <ab>N.</ab>), <ls>MBh. xii, 174, 24</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=72228]</L>
a <s1>Pāda</s1> or line of a stanza, <ls>Śrut.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=72231]</L>
a school or branch of the <s1>Veda</s1>, <ls>Nir. i, 17</ls>; <ls>Pāṇ.</ls>; <ls>MBh. xii</ls>, <ls n="MBh.">xiii</ls>; <ls>Pañcat. iv, 3</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=72235]</L>

चरण <lex>n.</lex> going round or about, motion, course, <ls>RV. iii, 5, 5</ls>; <ls n="RV.">ix, 113, 9</ls>; <ls n="RV.">x, 136, 6</ls> and <ls n="RV. x,">139, 6</ls>; <ls>ŚBr. ii</ls>, <ls n="ŚBr.">x</ls>; <ls>Sāh.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=72236]</L>

acting, dealing, managing, (liturgical) performance, observance, <ls>AV. vii, 106, 1</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>ŚāṅkhŚr.</ls>; <ls>KātyŚr.</ls>; <ls>VP. iii, 5, 13</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=72237]</L>
behaviour, conduct of life, <ls>KātyŚr.</ls>; <ls>ChUp. v, 10</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=72238]</L>
good or moral conduct, <ls>Kauś. 67</ls>; <ls>MBh. xiii, 3044</ls>; <ls>Lalit.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=72239]</L>
practising (generally <ab>ifc.</ab> <ab>cf.</ab> तपश्- [तपसश् च्°, <ls>Mn. vi, 75</ls>], भिक्षा-, भैक्ष-), <ls>Gobh. iii, 1, 12</ls>; <ls>Nal.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=72240]</L>
a particular high number, <ls>Buddh.</ls>; <ls>L.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> द्वि-, पुरश्-, रथ-). <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=72243]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> सन <lex>m.</lex> the flapping of an elephant's ears, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=231105]</L>
uzA: उषा <lex>f.</lex> morning light, dawn, morning, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV. xii, 2, 45</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls> &c.<info lex="f"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=37730]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a daughter of <s1>Bāṇa</s1> and wife of <s1>A-niruddha</s1>, <ls>AgP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=37733]</L>
araja: अ-रज <lex>mfn.</lex> (for अ-रजस् below), dustless, <ls>R. vi</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=15037]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> सात <lex>n.</lex> (for <hom>1.</hom> and <hom>2.</hom> See <pcol>p. 1196, col. 3</pcol>) pleasure, delight, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=241376]</L>

an: <hom>1.</hom> अन्-, occasionally अन-, (before a vowel) the substitute for <hom>3.</hom> अ, or अ privative.<info hui="1"/><L>[ID=4781]</L>

ava: <hom>2.</hom> अव <lex>ind.</lex> (as a prefix to verbs and verbal nouns expresses) off, away, down, <ls>RV.</ls> &c.<info lex="ind"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=16950]</L>
(exceptionally as a preposition with <ab>abl.</ab>) down from, <ls>AV. vii, 55, 1</ls><info lex="inh"/>
(for another use of this preposition See अव-कोकिल.)<info lex="inh"/>

<hom>3.</hom> अव (only <ab>gen.</ab> <ab>du.</ab> अवोर् with वाम्, ‘of you both’, corresponding to स त्वम्, ‘thou’, &c.), this, <ls>RV. vi, 67, 11</ls>; <ls n="RV.">vii, 67, 4</ls> and (वा for वाम्), <ls n="RV.">x, 132, 5</ls><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=16952]</L>
pAna: <hom>1.</hom> पान <lex>n.</lex> drinking (<ab>esp.</ab> <ab n="drinking">d°</ab> spirituous liquors), draught, <ls>RV.</ls> (only <ab>ifc.</ab>), <ls>AV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=120867]</L>
drinking the saliva <ab>i.e.</ab> kissing, <ls>Kāv.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> अधर-)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=120868]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> पान <lex>m.</lex> = अपा<स्र्स्>न, breathing out, expiration, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=122154]</L>
Apa: आप <lex>mfn.</lex> <ab>ifc.</ab> to be obtained (<ab>cf.</ab> दुर्°). <info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=24745]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> आप <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of one of the eight demigods called <s1>Vasu</s1>s, <ls>VP.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=24818]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> आप <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> <hom>2.</hom> अप्, <ls>Pāṇ. iv, 2, 37</ls>), a quantity of water, <s1>Mallinātha</s1> on <ls>Śiś. iii, 72.</ls><info lex="n"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=24820]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> त्व <lex>mfn.</lex> thy, your, <ls n="RV.">ii, 20, 2</ls>.<info lexcat="LEXID=pron,STEM=yuzmad"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=88928]</L>

AyA: आ-√ या <ab>P.</ab> -याति, to come near or towards; <div n="to"/>to arrive, approach, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to reach, attain, enter, <ls>BhP.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to get or fall into any state or condition; <div n="to"/>to be reduced to, become anything (with the <ab>acc.</ab> of an <ab>abstr.</ab> noun), <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls>; <ls>Ragh.</ls> &c.<info verb="pre" cp="P" parse="A+yA"/><L>[ID=25843]</L>
amaraRam: अ-मरण <lex>n.</lex> the not dying, immortality, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=13943]</L>
varaM: <hom>1.</hom> वर <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> वृ), ‘environing’, ‘enclosing’, circumference, space, room, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>TS.</ls> (वर आ पृथिव्याः, on the wide earth)<info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=186562]</L>

वर <lex>m.</lex> ‘chooser’, one who solicits a girl in marriage, suitor, lover, bridegroom, husband (rarely ‘son-in-law’), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m"/>
a dissolute man (= वित or षिड्ग), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/>

वर (वर), <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> ‘select’, choicest, valuable, precious, best, most excellent or eminent among (<ab>gen.</ab> <ab>loc.</ab> <ab>abl.</ab>, or <ab>comp.</ab>) or for (<ab>gen.</ab>), <ls>ŚrS.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f#A:n"/>
better, preferable, better than (<ab>abl.</ab>, rarely <ab>gen.</ab>) or among (<ab>abl.</ab>), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/>
वर <lex>m.</lex> (rarely <lex type="hwalt">n.</lex>; <ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>) ‘act or object of choosing’, election, wish, request<info lex="m:f#A:n"/>

वर <lex>m.</lex> boon, gift, reward, benefit, blessing, favour (वराय, वरम् आ, प्रति वरम् or वरं वरम्, ‘according to wish, to one's heart's content’; मद्-वरात्, ‘in consequence of the boon granted by me’; वरं-√ वृ, ‘to choose a boon’; वरं-√ याच् or आ-√ काङ्क्ष् or √ ब्रू or <ab>Caus.</ab> of प्र-√ अर्थ्, ‘to prefer a request’; वरं√ दा, ‘to grant a boon or blessing’; वरम् प्र-√ दा or प्र-√ यम् <ab>id.</ab>; वरं-√ लभ्, ‘to receive a boon or reward’), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m"/>
a kind of grain (= वरत), <ls>KātyŚr.</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab><info lex="inh"/>
वर <lex>n.</lex> saffron, <ls>BhP.</ls> (In <ab>comp.</ab> not always separable from <hom>1.</hom> वर.)<info lex="n"/>
taru: <hom>1.</hom> तरु <lex>mfn.</lex> ‘quick’ or <ab>subst.</ab> ‘speediness’, (<ab>pl.</ab>), <ls>RV. v, 44, 5</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> <ls n="RV.">ii, 39, 3</ls>). <info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=83176]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> तरु <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>g.</ab> व्याघ्रा<स्र्स्>दि [not in <ls>Kāś.</ls>] <ab>cf.</ab> नभस्-) a tree, <ls>Nal. xii, 75</ls>; <ls>R. vi, 82, 115</ls>; <ls>Suśr.</ls>; <ls>Ragh.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=83257]</L>
tad: तद् (<ab>nom.</ab> and <ab>acc.</ab> <ab>sg.</ab> <lex type="hwinfo">n.</lex> of and base in <ab>comp.</ab> for <hom>2.</hom> त from which latter all the cases of this <ab>pron.</ab> are formed except <ab>nom.</ab> <ab>sg.</ab> <lex type="hwinfo">m.</lex> सस् or स & <lex type="hwinfo">f.</lex> सा; <ab>instr.</ab> <ab>pl.</ab> तैस्, <ls>AV.</ls> &c.; <lang>Ved.</lang> तेभिस्, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls> &c.) <lex type="hwinfo">m.</lex> he <lex type="hwinfo">f.</lex> she <lex type="hwinfo">n.</lex> it, that, this (often correlative of य generally standing in the preceding clause, <ab>e.g.</ab> यस्य बुद्धिः स बलवान्, ‘of whom there is intellect he is strong’; sometimes, for the sake of emphasis, connected with the 1st and 2nd personal pronouns, with other demonstratives and with relatives, <ab>e.g.</ab> सो ऽहम्, ‘I that very person, I myself’ [तस्य = मम, <ls>Nal. xv, 10</ls>]; ताव् इमौ, ‘those very two’; तद् एतद् आख्यानम्, ‘that very tale’, <ls>AitBr. vii, 18</ls>; यत् तत् कारणम्, ‘that very reason which’, <ls>Mn. i, 11</ls>; या सा श्री, ‘that very fortune which’, <ls>MBh. vii, 427</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c.<info lexcat="LEXID=pron,STEM=tad"/><L>[ID=82046]</L>
तद् (तद्) <lex>n.</lex> this world (<ab>cf.</ab> इदम्), <ls>R. vi, 102, 25</ls><info lex="n"/>

तद् (तद्) <lex>ind.</lex> there, in that place, thither, to that spot (correlative of यत्र or यतस्), <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>AitBr. ii, 11</ls>; <ls>ŚBr. i</ls>, <ls n="ŚBr.">x</ls>, <ls n="ŚBr.">xiv</ls>; <ls>ChUp.</ls><info lex="ind"/>

तद् <lex>ind.</lex> then, at that time, in that case (correlative of यदा, यद्, <ls>AV.</ls>; of यत्र, <ls>ŚBr. xiv</ls>; of यदि, <ls>Nal.</ls>; <ls>Bhag.</ls> &c.; of चे<स्र्स्>द्, <ls>Śak.</ls> &c.), <ls>RV. iv, 28, 1</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls> &c.<info lex="ind"/>
thus, in this manner, with regard to that, <ls n="AV.">ix</ls>, <ls n="AV.">xiii</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>AitBr.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
(तद् एतौ श्लोकौ भवतः, ‘with reference to that there are these two verses’), <ls>PraśnUp.</ls><info lex="inh"/>

on that account, for that reason, therefore, consequently (sometimes correlative of यतस्, यद्, येन, ‘because’, <ls>Daś.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls> &c.), <ls>Mn. ix, 41</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/>
so also, equally, and <ls>AV. xi</ls>, <ls n="AV.">xv</ls><info lex="inh"/>

तद् तद् तद् this and that, various, different (<ab>e.g.</ab> तं तं देशं जगाम, ‘he went to this and that place’; तासु तासु योनिषु, ‘in different or various birth-places’, <ls>Mn. xii, 74</ls>)<L>[ID=82047]</L>
तद् तेनैव तेनैव पथा, on quite the same path, <ls>R. iii, 50, 28</ls>

तद् यद् तद् whosoever, whichsoever, any, every (also with वा, <ls>Mn. xii, 68</ls> [यद् वा तद् वा, ‘this or that, any’] <ls>Hariv. 5940</ls>; <ls>Dhūrtas.</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>; often both pronouns repeated or the interrogative <ab>pron.</ab> with चिद् added after the relative, <ab>e.g.</ab> यद्-यत् पर-वशं कर्म तत्-तद् वर्जयेत्, ‘whatever action depends on another, that he should avoid’, <ls>Mn. iv, 159</ls>; यत् किं-चिद्-तद्, ‘whatever-that’, <ls>Mn.</ls>)<L>[ID=82048]</L>
तद् तद् <lex type="hwinfo">ind.</lex> अपि ‘even then’, nevertheless, notwithstanding, <ls>Śak.</ls> (<ab>v.l.</ab>), <ls>Bhartṛ.</ls>; <ls>Prab.</ls>; <ls>Siṃhās.</ls><L>[ID=82051]</L>
तद् (ind.) यथा, ‘in such a manner as follows’, namely, viz. Buddh. (cf. Pāli seyyathā; स यथा-, ŚBr.); Jain. (in Prākṛt taṃ jahā; cf. sejjahā), Pat.; Śak.[ID=82052]
ABaM: (<lex type="hwifc">mfn.</lex>) <ab>ifc.</ab> like, resembling, appearing, <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Kāvyād.</ls>; <ls>Śiś.</ls> &c. (<ab>e.g.</ab> हेमा<स्र्स्>भ, shining like gold); <info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=25235]</L>
trARa: त्राण <lex>n.</lex> protecting, preserving, protection, defence, shelter, help (often <ab>ifc.</ab>), <ls>ChUp.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=87528]</L>
protection for the body, armour, helmet &c., <ls n="MBh.">iii, 12092</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=87529]</L>
mada: मद <lex>m.</lex> hilarity, rapture, excitement, inspiration, intoxication, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=155332]</L>

(<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="nhw">f.</lex> आ) sexual desire or enjoyment, wantonness, lust, ruttishness, rut (<ab>esp.</ab> of an elephant), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155335]</L>
pride, arrogance, presumption, conceit of or about (<ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155336]</L>
any exhilarating or intoxicating drink, spirituous liquor, wine, <s1>Soma</s1>, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.,<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155337]</L>
the fluid or juice that exudes from a rutting elephant's temples, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155339]</L>
Intoxication or Insanity personified (as a monster created by <s1>Cyavana</s1>), <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155345]</L>
kzaRa: <hom>1.</hom> क्षण <lex>m.</lex> any instantaneous point of time, instant, twinkling of an eye, moment, <ls>Nal.</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls>; <ls>Ragh.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=58739]</L>

a moment regarded as a measure of time (equal to thirty <s1>Kalā</s1>s or four minutes, <ls>L.</ls>; or (in <ab>astron.</ab>) to 48 minutes, <ls>VarBṛS.</ls> &c.; or 4/5 or 24/35 seconds, <ls>BhP. iii, 11, 7</ls> and <ls n="BhP. iii, 11,">8</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=58740]</L>
a leisure moment, vacant time, leisure (<ab>e.g.</ab> क्षणं-√ कृ, to have leisure for, wait patiently for, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> कृत-क्षण)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=58741]</L>
a fit or suitable moment, opportunity (क्षणं-√ कृ, to give an opportunity, <ls>MBh. iv, 666</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> दत्त-क्षण and लब्ध-क्ष्°)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=58742]</L>
a certain day of the fortnight (as the full moon, change of the moon, &c.), <ls>Sarvad.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=58744]</L>
क्षण <lex>n.</lex> in a moment, <ls>Ragh. xii, 36</ls>; <ls>Śāntiś.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> तत्-क्षणम्)<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=58749]</L>
क्षण <lex>n.</lex> ततः क्षणात् (= तत्-क्षणात्, <ab>q.v.</ab>), immediately upon that, <ls>Kathās.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=58752]</L>
क्षणात्-क्षणात्, in this moment — in that moment, <ls>Rājat. viii, 898</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=58753]</L>
क्षण <lex>n.</lex> क्षणे क्षणे, every instant, every moment, <ls>Rājat. v, 165</ls> and <ls n="Rājat. v,">337.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=58755]</L>
havam: <hom>1.</hom> हव <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ हु) an oblation, burnt offering, sacrifice, <ls>Śiś.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=261892]</L>
fire or the god of fire, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=261893]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> हव <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ ह्वे or हू; for <hom>1.</hom> See <pcol>p. 1293, col. 2</pcol>)<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=262033]</L>
dAham: दाह <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ दह्) burning, combustion, conflagration, heat, <ls>KātyŚr.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=92002]</L>
glowing, redness (of the sky, <ab>cf.</ab> दिग्-), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>VarBṛS.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=92004]</L>
cauterizing, cautery (of a wound), <ls>Suśr.</ls>; <ls>Mālav. iv, 4</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=92005]</L>
<ab>pl.</ab> <ab>N.</ab> of a people (<ab>v.l.</ab> for वैदेह), <ls>VāyuP. 1</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=92007]</L>
annam: अन्न (अन्नम्), <lex>n.</lex> food or victuals, especially boiled rice<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=8479]</L>
food in a mystical sense (or the lowest form in which the supreme soul is manifested, the coarsest envelope of the Supreme Spirit)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=8481]</L>
AYjana: आ<स्र्स्>ञ्जन <lex>n.</lex> ointment (especially for the eyes), <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>TS.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c.<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=23215]</L>
आ<स्र्स्>ञ्जन <lex>mfn.</lex> having the colour of the collyrium used for the eyes, <ls>MBh. v, 1708</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=23217]</L>
tu: <hom>1.</hom> तु <ab>cl.</ab> 2. (तौति, <ls>Dhātup.</ls>; <ab>fut.</ab> 2nd तोता or तविता, <ls>Vop.</ls>) to have authority, be strong, <ls>RV. i, 94, 2</ls> (<ab>pf.</ab> तूताव <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Naigh. iv, 1</ls>; <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 1, 7</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>); <div n="to"/>to go, <ls>Dhātup.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to injure, <ls>ib.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> (<ab>aor.</ab> तूतोत्, 2. <ab>sg.</ab> °तोस्) to make strong or efficient, <ls>RV. ii, 20, 5</ls>; <ls n="RV.">vi, 26, 4</ls>; <div n="vp"/> <ab>cf.</ab> उत्-, सं-; <div n="vp"/> तवस्, &c., तीव्र; <info whitneyroots="tu,63"/><info verb="root" cp="2"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=85705]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> तु <lex>ind.</lex> (never found at the beginning of a sentence or verse; metrically also तू, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 3, 133</ls>) pray! I beg, do, now, then, <lang>Lat.</lang><etym>dum</etym> used (<ab>esp.</ab> with the <ab>Imper.</ab>), <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="ind"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=85706]</L>
but (also with एव or वै following), <ls>AV. iv, 18, 6</ls>; <ls>TS.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c.
often incorrectly written for नु, <ls>MBh.</ls> (<ls n="MBh.">i, 6151</ls> <ab>B.</ab> and <ab>C.</ab>)
sometimes used as a mere expletive
च — न तु though — still not<L>[ID=85707]</L>
न च — अपि तु not — but<L>[ID=85709]</L>
कामं — न तु it is true — but not, ere — than<L>[ID=85714]</L>
भूयस् — न तु it is true — but not, ere — than<L>[ID=85715]</L>
वरम् — न तु it is true — but not, ere — than<L>[ID=85716]</L>
haWam: हठ <lex>m.</lex> violence, force (<ab>ibc.</ab>, एन, and आत्, ‘by force, forcibly’), <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Rājat.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=260242]</L>
obstinacy, pertinacity (<ab>ibc.</ab> and आत्, ‘obstinately, persistently’), <ls>Pañcat.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=260243]</L>

absolute or inevitable necessity (as the cause of all existence and activity; <ab>ibc.</ab>, आत्, and एन, ‘necessarily, inevitably, by all means’), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=260244]</L>
going in the rear of an enemy, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=260248]</L>
sma: स्म, स्मा, (or ष्म, ष्मा), <lex>ind.</lex> a particle perhaps originally equivalent to ‘ever’, ‘always’; <div n="P"/> and later to ‘indeed’, ‘certainly’, ‘verily’, ‘surely’ (it is often used pleonastically, and in earlier language generally follows a similar particle [<ab>esp.</ab> ह, न], or relative, or <ab>prep.</ab> or verb, while in later language it frequently follows इति, न and मा [<ab>cf.</ab> <hom>1.</hom> मा]; it is also joined with a <ab>pres.</ab> tense or <ab>pres.</ab> participle to give them a past sense [<ab>e.g.</ab> प्रविशन्ति स्म, ‘they entered’]; this use of स्म is also found in the <s1>Brāhmaṇa</s1>s and is extended to वेद and आह <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Vām. v, 2, 46</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls>; &c. &c.<info lex="ind"/><L>[ID=257061]</L>
saras: सरस् <lex>n.</lex> ‘anything flowing or fluid’, a lake, large sheet of water, pond, pool, tank, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. a trough, pail, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=237549]</L>
speech (a meaning given to account for सरस्-वती), <ls>ib.</ls> <ls n="Naigh.">i, 11.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=237551]</L>
avamatam: अव-मत <lex>mfn.</lex> despised, disregarded, contemned, <ls>Mn. vii, 150</ls>, &c.<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=17769]</L>
Atta[m]: आ-त्त <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ls>Pāṇ. vii, 4, 47</ls>) taken, obtained, <ls>ChUp.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=23764]</L>
taken away or off, withdrawn from, <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>AitBr.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=23765]</L>
SamaTa[m]: शमथ <lex>m.</lex> quiet, tranquillity, absence of passion, <ls>Lalit.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=212951]</L>
vAham: वाह <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab>) bearing, drawing, conveying, carrying, <ls>Kathās.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=192702]</L>
वाह <lex>m.</lex> the act of drawing &c., <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Hit.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=192705]</L>
a draught-animal, horse, bull, ass, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=192708]</L>

any vehicle, carriage, conveyance, car (<ab>ifc.</ab> = having anything as a vehicle, riding or driving on or in), <ls>ŚvetUp.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=192709]</L>
a bearer, porter, carrier of burdens &c., <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=192710]</L>
a measure of capacity (containing 10 <s1>Kumbha</s1>s or 2 <s1>Prastha</s1>s), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=192712]</L>
nAda: नाद <lex>m.</lex> (√ नद्) a loud sound, roaring, bellowing, crying, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=105475]</L>
any sound or tone, <ls>Prāt.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls> &c. (= शब्द, <ls>L.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=105476]</L>
(in the <s1>Yoga</s1>) the nasal sound represented by a semicircle and used as an abbreviation in mystical words, <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=105477]</L>
dava: दव <lex>m.</lex> (√ <hom>2.</hom> दु) a wood on fire, <ls>BhP. viii, 6, 13</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=90780]</L>
DA: <hom>1.</hom> धा <ab>cl.</ab> 3. <ab>P.</ab> <ab>Ā.</ab> दधाति, धत्ते, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (<ab>P.</ab> <ab>du.</ab> दध्वस्, धत्थस्, धत्तस् [<ls>Pāṇ. viii, 2, 38</ls>]; <ab>pl.</ab> दध्मसि or °मस्, धत्थ, दाधति; <ab>impf.</ab> अदधात् <ab>pl.</ab> °धुर्, 2. <ab>pl.</ab> अधत्त or अदधात, <ls>RV. vii, 33, 4</ls>; <ab>Subj.</ab> दधत् or °धात् [<ls>Pāṇ. vii, 3, 70</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>], °धस्, °धतस्, °धन्; <ab>Pot.</ab> दध्यात्; <ab>Impv.</ab> दाधातु <ab>pl.</ab> °धतु; 2. <ab>sg.</ab> धेहि [<ab>fr.</ab> धद्धि; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 4, 119</ls>] or धत्तात्, <ls>RV. iii, 8, 1</ls>; <ab>p.</ab> दधत्, °ति <lex type="part">m.</lex> <ab>pl.</ab> °तस्; <ab>Ā.</ab> 1. <ab>sg.</ab> दधे [at once 3. <ab>sg.</ab> = धत्ते, <ls>RV. i, 149, 5</ls> &c. and = <ab>pf.</ab> <ab>Ā.</ab>], 2. <ab>sg.</ab> धत्से, <ls n="RV.">viii, 85, 5</ls> or धत्से, <ls>AV. v, 7, 2</ls>; 2. 3. <ab>du.</ab> दधाथे, °धाते; 2. <ab>pl.</ab> °धिध्वे [<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>pf.</ab>]; 3. <ab>pl.</ab> दधते, <ls>RV. v, 41, 2</ls>; <ab>impf.</ab> अधत्त, °त्थास्; <ab>Subj.</ab> दधसे, <ls n="RV.">viii, 32, 6</ls> [<ls>Pāṇ. iii, 4, 96</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>]; <ab>Pot.</ab> दधीत, <ls>RV. i, 40, 2</ls> or दधीत, <ls n="RV.">v, 66, 1</ls>; <ab>Impv.</ab> 2. <ab>sg.</ab> धत्स्व, <ls n="RV.">x, 87, 2</ls> or दधिष्व, <ls n="RV.">iii, 40, 5</ls> &c.; 2. <ab>pl.</ab> धद्ध्वम् [<ls>Pāṇ. viii, 2, 38</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>] or दधिध्वम्, <ls>RV. vii, 34, 10</ls>, &c.;
