(with दण्डम्, to inflict punishment on [with <ab>loc.</ab> <ls>MBh. v, 1075</ls>, with <ab>gen.</ab> <ls>R. v, 28, 7</ls>]; with तत्-पदव्याम् पदम्, to put one's foot in another's footstep <ab>i.e.</ab> imitate, equal, <ls>Kāvyād. ii, 64</ls>); <div n="to"/>to take or bring or help to (<ab>loc.</ab> or <ab>dat.</ab>; with आरे, to remove), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <div n="to"/> (<ab>Ā.</ab>) to direct or fix the mind or attention (चिन्ताम्, मनस्, मतिम्, समाधिम् &c.) upon, think of (<ab>loc.</ab> or <ab>dat.</ab>), fix or resolve upon (<ab>loc.</ab> <ab>dat.</ab> <ab>acc.</ab> with प्रति or a sentence closed with इति), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to destine for, bestow on, present or impart to (<ab>loc.</ab> <ab>dat.</ab> or <ab>gen.</ab>), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>Br.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c. (<ab>Pass.</ab> to be given or granted, fall to one's [<ab>dat.</ab>] lot or share, <ls>RV. i, 81, 3</ls>); <div n="to"/>to appoint, establish, constitute, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to render (with double <ab>acc.</ab>), <ls>RV. vii, 31, 12</ls>; <ls>Bhartṛ. iii, 82</ls>; <div n="to"/>to make, produce, generate, create, cause, effect, perform, execute, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>TBr.</ls>; <ls>ŚvetUp.</ls> &c. (<ab>aor.</ab> with पूरयाम्, मन्त्रयाम्, वरयाम् &c. = पूरयाम् &c. चकार); <div n="to"/>to seize, take hold of, hold, bear, support, wear, put on (clothes), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/> (<ab>Ā.</ab>) to accept, obtain, conceive (<ab>esp.</ab> in the womb), get, take (with ओकस् or चनस्, to take pleasure or delight in [<ab>loc.</ab> or <ab>dat.</ab>]), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>Br.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to assume, have, possess, show, exhibit, incur, undergo, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>Hit.</ls> <ab>etc.</ab> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> -धापयति, <ls>Pāṇ. vii, 3, 36</ls> (see अन्तर्-धा, श्रद्-धा &c.) : <div n="vp"/><ab>Desid.</ab> धित्सति, °ते (<ls>Pāṇ. vii, 4, 54</ls>), to wish to put in or lay on (<ab>loc.</ab>), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AitBr.</ls> (<lang>Class.</lang> <ab>Pass.</ab> धित्स्यते; धित्स्य See <ab>s.v.</ab>); <div n="to"/> दिधिषति, °ते, to wish to give or present, <ls>RV.</ls>; <div n="to"/> (<ab>Ā.</ab>) to wish to gain, strive after (<ab>p.</ab> दिधिषाण, <ls n="RV.">x, 114, 1</ls>), <ls>ib.</ls> : with अवद्यम्, to bid defiance, <ls>ib.</ls> <ls n="RV.">iv, 18, 7</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> दिधिषाय्य, दिधिषु) : <div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab> देधीयते, <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 4, 66.</ls> <info whitneyroots="DA1,82"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="3P,3Ā,1P,1Ā,2P,4Ā,4P"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=100607]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> शक <lex>m. <ab>pl.</ab></lex> <ab>N.</ab> of a <ab>partic.</ab> white-skinned tribe or race of people (in the legends which relate the contests between <s1>Vasiṣṭha</s1> and <s1>Viśvāmitra</s1> the <s1>Śaka</s1>s are fabled to have been produced by the Cow of <s1>Vasiṣṭha</s1>, from her sweat, for the destruction of <s1>Viśvāmitra</s1>'s army; in <ls>Mn. x, 44</ls>, they are mentioned together with the <s1>Pauṇḍraka</s1>s, <s1>Oḍra</s1>s, <s1>Draviḍa</s1>s, <s1>Kāmboja</s1>s, <s1>Javana</s1>s or <s1>Yavana</s1>s, <s1>Pārada</s1>s, <s1>Pahlava</s1>s, <s1>Cīna</s1>s, <s1>Kirāta</s1>s, <s1>Darada</s1>s, and <s1>Khaśa</s1>s, described by, <ls>Kull.</ls> as degraded tribes of <s1>Kṣatriya</s1>s called after the districts in which they reside: according to the <ls>VP. iv, 3</ls>, king <s1>Sagara</s1> attempted to rid his kingdom of these tribes, but did not succeed in destroying them all : they are sometimes regarded as the followers of <s1>Śaka</s1> or <s1>Śāli-vāhana</s1>, and are probably to be identified with the Tartars or Indo-Scythians [<lang>Lat.</lang> <etym>Sacæ</etym>] who overran India before the <ns>Āryans</ns>, and were conquered by the great <s1>Vikramāditya</s1> [<ab>q.v.</ab>]; they really seem to have been dominant in the north-west of India in the last century before and the first two centuries after the beginning of our era), <ls>AV.Pariś.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=211201]</L>
a king of the <s1>Śaka</s1>s <ab>g.</ab> कम्बोजा<स्र्स्>दि (on, <ls>Pāṇ. iv, 1, 175</ls>, <ab>Vārtt.</ab>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=211202]</L>

a house, dwelling (गृह <ab>w.r.</ab> for ग्लह?), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=114561]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> का = <hom>2.</hom> कद् and <hom>1.</hom> कु in <ab>comp.</ab> to express depreciation, <ab>e.g.</ab> का<स्र्स्>क्ष, का-पथ, कापुरुष, को<स्र्स्>ष्ण, <ab>qq.vv.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 3, 104</ls>; <ls>Vop. vi, 93.</ls><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=46908]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> का = √ कन् (<ab>perf.</ab> चके, चकान; see कायमान <ab>s.v.</ab>), <div n="to"/>to seek, desire, yearn, love (with <ab>acc.</ab> and <ab>dat.</ab>), <ls>RV.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to like, enjoy, be satisfied with (<ab>loc.</ab> <ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>inst.</ab>), <ls>RV.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab> (<ab>p.</ab> चाकत्) to please, be sought after, be wished for, satisfy, <ls>RV. x, 29, 1</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> अनु-, आ-, सं- √ <hom>3.</hom> का, काति.)<info whitneyroots="kan,17"/><info verb="root" cp="0"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=46909]</L>

<ls>R.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to bring into any state or condition (with <ab>acc.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> with वशम्, to bring into subjection, subdue [<ab>Ā.</ab> <ls>RV. x, 84, 3</ls>; <ls>AV. v, 19, 5</ls>; <ab>P.</ab> <ls>Ragh. viii, 19</ls>]; with शूद्र-ताम्, to reduce to a <s1>Śūdra</s1>, <ls>Mn. iii, 15</ls>; with साक्ष्यम् [<ab>Ā.</ab>], to admit as a witness, <ls n="Mn.">viii, 197</ls>; with व्याघ्र-ताम्, to change into a tiger, <ls>Hit.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to trace, track, find out, ascertain, settle, decide (with अन्यथा, ‘wrongly’), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/> (<ab>Ā.</ab>) to be foremost or chief, <ls>Pāṇ. i, 3, 36</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> नाययति, °ते, to cause to lead &c.; cana: चन <lex>ind.</lex> (च न, <ls>SV.</ls>) and not, also not, even not, not even (this particle is placed after the word to which it gives force; a preceding verb is accentuated [<ls>Pāṇ. viii, 1, 57</ls>]; in Vedic language it is generally, but not always, found without any other <ab>neg.</ab> particle, whereas in the later language another <ab>neg.</ab> is usually added, <ab>e.g.</ab> आपश् चनप्र मिनन्ति व्रतं वां, ‘not even the waters violate your ordinance’, <ls>RV. ii, 24, 12</ls>; ना<स्र्स्>ह विव्याच पृथिवी चनै<स्र्स्>नं, ‘the earth even does not contain him’, <ls n="RV.">iii, 36, 4</ls>; in <lang>class. Sanskṛt</lang> it is only used after the interrogatives क, कतर, कतम, कथम्, कद्, कदा, किम्, कुतस्, क्व, making them indefinite), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls> &c. also, <ls>RV. i, 139, 2</ls>; <ls n="RV.">vi, 26, 7</ls>; <ls n="RV.">viii, 78, 10.</ls><info lex="ind"/><L>[ID=71527]</L>

vAram: <hom>1.</hom> वार <lex>m.</lex> (earlier form of वाल, <ab>q.v.</ab>) the hair of any animal's tail (<ab>esp.</ab> of a horse's tail, = <gk>οὐρά</gk>), <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=191586]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> वार <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> वृ) keeping back, restraining (also <lex type="hwifc">mfn.</lex> <ab>ifc.</ab> = difficult to be restrained, <ls>TBr.</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> दुर्-व्°)<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=191590]</L>
anything which covers or surrounds or restrains, a cover, <ls>MW.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
anything which causes an obstruction, a gate, door-way, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
anything enclosed or circumscribed in space or time, <ab>esp.</ab> an appointed place (<ab>e.g.</ab> स्व-वारं समा-√ स्था, to occupy one's proper place), <ls>R.</ls><info lex="inh"/>

the time fixed or appointed for anything (<ab>accord.</ab> to some <ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>2.</hom> वृ, to choose), a person's turn, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c. (often, <ab>esp.</ab> with numerals, = times, <ab>e.g.</ab> वरांस् त्रीन् or वर-त्रयम्, three times; भूरिभिर् वारैः or भूरि-वारान् or बहु-वारम् or वारं वारम् or वारं वारेण, many times, often, repeatedly)<info lex="inh"/>

the turn of a day (under the regency of a planet), a day of the week (they are <s1>Āditya</s1>-, <s1>Soma</s1>-, <s1>Maṅgala</s1>-, <s1>Budha</s1>-, <s1>Guru</s1>-, <s1>Śukra</s1>-, and <s1>Śani</s1>-<s1>vāra</s1>; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>IW. 178 n. 1</ls>), <ls>Gaṇit.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c. (<ab>cf.</ab> दिन and दिवस-व्°)<info lex="inh"/>
वार <lex>n.</lex> a vessel for holding spirituous liquor, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/>
<hom>3.</hom> वार <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>2.</hom> वृ) choice (see वारे-वृत)<info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=191688]</L>
anything chosen or choice or exquisite, goods, treasure, <ls>RV.</ls> (often <ab>ifc.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> अशस्त-, ऋधद्-, दाति-व्° &c.)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=191689]</L>
yad: यद् (<ab>nom.</ab> and <ab>acc.</ab> <ab>sg.</ab> <lex type="hwinfo">n.</lex> and base in <ab>comp.</ab> of <hom>3.</hom> य), who, which, what, whichever, whatever, that, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (with correlatives तद्, त्यद्, एतद्, इदम्, अदस्, तद् एतद्, एतद् त्यद्, इदं तद्, तद् इदम्, तादृश, ईदृश, ईदृश्, एतावद्, by which it is oftener followed than preceded; or the <ab>correl.</ab> is dropped, <ab>e.g.</ab> यस् तु ना<स्र्स्>रभते कर्म क्षिप्रम् भवति निर्द्रव्यः, ‘[he] indeed who does not begin work soon becomes poor’, <ls>R.</ls>; or the <ab>rel.</ab> is dropped, <ab>e.g.</ab> अन्धकम् भर्तारं न त्यजेत् सा महा-सती, ‘she who does not desert a blind husband is a very faithful wife’, <ls>Vet.</ls> यद् is often repeated to express ‘whoever’, ‘whatever’, ‘whichever’, <ab>e.g.</ab> यो यः, ‘whatever man’; या या, ‘whatever woman’; यो यज् जयति तस्य तत्, ‘whatever he wins [in war] belongs to him’, <ls>Mn. vii, 96</ls>; यद् यद् वदति तद् तद् भवति, ‘whatever he says is true’, or the two relatives may be separated by हि, and are followed by the doubled or single <ab>correl.</ab> तद्, <ab>e.g.</ab> उप्यते यद् धि यद् बीजम् तत् तद् एव प्ररोहति, ‘whatever seed is sown, that even comes forth’, <ls>Mn. ix, 40</ls>; similar indefinite meanings are expressed by the relative joined with तद्, <ab>e.g.</ab> यस्मै तस्मै, ‘to any one whatever’, <ab>esp.</ab> in यद्वा तद्वा, ‘anything whatever’; or by यः with कश्च, कश्चन, कश्चित्, or [in later language, not in <s1>Manu</s1>] कोऽपि, <ab>e.g.</ab> यः कश्चित्, ‘whosoever’; यानि कानि च मित्राणि, ‘any friends whatsoever’; येन केना<स्र्स्>प्य् उपा<स्र्स्>येन, ‘by any means whatsoever’. यद् is joined with त्वद् to express generalization, <ab>e.g.</ab> शूद्रांस् त्वद् यांस् त्वद्, ‘either the <s1>Śūdra</s1>s or anybody else’, <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; or immediately followed by a <ab>pers.</ab> <ab>pron.</ab> on which it lays emphasis, <ab>e.g.</ab> यो ऽहम्, ‘I that very person who’; यस् त्वं कथं वेत्थ, ‘how do you know?’, <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; it is also used in the sense of ‘si quis’, <ab>e.g.</ab> स्त्रियं स्पृशेद् यः, ‘should any one touch a woman’. यद् is also used without the copula, <ab>e.g.</ab> अन्धो जडः पीठ-सर्पी सप्तत्या स्थविरश्च यः, ‘a blind man, an idiot, a cripple, and a man seventy years old’, <ls>Mn. viii, 394</ls>; sometimes there is a change of construction in such cases, <ab>e.g.</ab> ये च मानुषाः for मानुषांश्-च, <ls>Mn. x, 86</ls>; the <ab>nom.</ab> <ab>sg.</ab> <lex type="hwinfo">n.</lex> यद् is then often used without regard to gender or number and may be translated by ‘as regards’, ‘as for’, <ab>e.g.</ab> क्षत्रं वा एतद् वनस्पतीनां यन् न्यग्-रोधः, ‘as for the <s1>Nyag-rodha</s1>, it is certainly the prince among trees’, <ls>AitBr.</ls>; or by ‘that is to say’, ‘to wit’ <ab>e.g.</ab> ततो देवा एतं वज्रं ददृशुर् यद् अपः, ‘the gods then saw this thunderbolt, to wit, the water’, <ls>ŚBr.</ls> यद् as an <ab>adv.</ab> conjunction generally = ‘that’, <ab>esp.</ab> after verbs of saying, thinking &c., often introducing an oratio directa with or without इति; इति यद्, at the end of a sentence = ‘thinking that’, ‘under the impression that’ <ab>e.g.</ab> <ls>Ratnāv. ii, 2/8.</ls> यद् also = ‘so that’, ‘in order that’, ‘wherefore’, ‘whence’, ‘as’, ‘in as much as’, ‘since’, ‘because’ [the correlative being तद्, ‘therefore’], ‘when’, ‘if’, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.; अध यद्, ‘even if’, ‘although’, <ls>RV.</ls> यद् अपि <ab>id.</ab>, <ls>Megh.</ls> यद् उ — एवम्, ‘as — so’, <ls>ŚvetUp.</ls>; यद् उत, ‘that’, <ls>Bālar.</ls>; ‘that is to say’, ‘scilicet’, <ls>Kāraṇḍ.</ls>; <ls>Divyāv.</ls>; यत् किल, ‘that’, <ls>Prasannar.</ls>; यच् च, ‘if’, ‘that is to say’, <ls>Car.</ls>; यच् च-यच् च, ‘both - and’, <ls>Divyāv.</ls>; ‘that’ [<ab>accord.</ab> to <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 3, 148</ls> after expressions of ‘impossibility’, ‘disbelief’, ‘hope’, ‘disregard’, ‘reproach’ and ‘wonder’]; यद् वा, ‘or else’, ‘whether’, <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>Rājat.</ls>; [यद् वा, ‘or else’, is very often in commentators]; ‘however’, <ls>Bālar.</ls>; यद् वा — यदि वा, ‘if — or if’, <ls>Bhag.</ls>; यद् भूयसा, ‘for the most part’, <ls>Divyāv.</ls>; यत् सत्यम्, ‘certainly’, ‘indeed’, ‘of course’, <ls>Mṛcch.</ls>; <ls>Ratnāv.</ls>; यन् नु, with 1st <ab>pers.</ab>, ‘what if I’, ‘let me’, <ls>Divyāv.</ls>)<info lexcat="LEXID=pron,STEM=yad"/><L>[ID=170148]</L>

real, actual, as any one or anything ought to be, true, good, right (तन् न सत्, ‘that is not right’), beautiful, wise, venerable, honest (often in <ab>comp.</ab> See below), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=229495]</L>

ram: रम् <ab>cl.</ab> 1. <ab>Ā.</ab> (<ls>Dhātup. xx, 23</ls>) रमते (<lang>Ved.</lang> also <ab>P.</ab> रमति or रम्णाति <ab>pf.</ab> रराम, <ls>MBh.</ls>; रेमे, <ls>Br.</ls> &c.; <ab>aor.</ab> 3. <ab>pl.</ab> रन्त, <ls>RV.</ls>; अरंसीत्, <ls>Kāv.</ls>; अरंस्त, <ls>RV.</ls>; रंसिषम्, <ls>SV.</ls>; <ab>fut.</ab> रन्ता <ab>Gr.</ab>; रंस्यति, <ls>Br.</ls>; °ते, <ls>ib.</ls> &c.; <ab>inf.</ab> रमितुम्, <ls>MBh.</ls>; रन्तुम्, <ls>ib.</ls> &c.; रन्तोस्, <ls>Br.</ls>; <ab>ind.p.</ab> रत्वा, <ls>ib.</ls>; रन्त्वा, <ls>Kāv.</ls>; -रम्य or -रत्य, <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 4, 38</ls>), <div n="to"/>to stop, stay, make fast, calm, set at rest (<ab>P.</ab>; <ab>esp.</ab> <ab>pres.</ab> रम्णाति), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <div n="vp"/> (<ab>P.</ab> <ab>Ā.</ab>) to delight, make happy, enjoy carnally, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>Śukas.</ls>; <div n="to"/> (<ab>Ā.</ab>) to stand still, rest, abide, like to stay with (<ab>loc.</ab> or <ab>dat.</ab>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.; <div n="to"/>(<ab>Ā.</ab>; <ab>P.</ab> only <ab>mc.</ab>) to be glad or pleased, rejoice at, delight in, be fond of (<ab>loc.</ab> <ab>instr.</ab> or <ab>inf.</ab>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.; <div n="to"/>to play or sport, dally, have sexual intercourse with (<ab>instr.</ab> with or without समम्, सह, साकम् or सा<स्र्स्>र्धम्), <ls>ChUp.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to couple (said of deer), <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 1, 26</ls>, <ab>Vārtt.</ab> 8, <ls>Pat.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Caus.</ab>); <div n="to"/>to play with <ab>i.e.</ab> put to stake (<ab>instr.</ab>), <ls>Bhaṭṭ.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> रमयति or रामयति (<ab>aor.</ab> अरीरमत्), to cause to stay, stop, set at rest, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>TS.</ls>; <ls>PañcavBr.</ls>; <ls>KātyŚr.</ls>; <div n="to"/> (रमयति, <ab>mc.</ab> also °ते) to gladden, delight, please, caress, enjoy carnally, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c. (3. <ab>sg.</ab> रमयति-तराम्, <ls>Ratnāv. iii, 9</ls>); <div n="to"/>to enjoy one's self, be pleased or delighted, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <div n="vp"/> मृगान् रमयति, he tells that the deer are coupling, <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 1, 26</ls>, <ab>Vārtt.</ab> 8, <ls>Pat.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Desid.</ab> in रिरंसा, °सु, <ab>q.v.</ab>: <div n="vp"/><ab>Desid.</ab> of <ab>Caus.</ab> in रिरमयिषु, <ab>q.v.</ab>: <ab>Intens.</ab> रंरम्यते or रंरमीति, <ls>Pāṇ. vii, 4, 85.</ls> <info westergaard="ramu,20.23,01.0581"/><info whitneyroots="ram,137"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="1Ā,1P"/><L>[ID=174928]</L>
nanu: न-नु <lex>ind.</lex> (<hom>2.</hom> न + नु) not, not at all, never, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; (<ab>interr.</ab>) not? is it not? = nonne, <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c. &c. (hence often =) certainly, surely, indeed, no doubt (<ab>esp.</ab> in questions amounting to an affirmation, <ab>e.g.</ab> नन्व् अहं ते प्रियः, am I not your friend <ab>i.e.</ab> certainly I am your <ab n="friend">fr°</ab>, <ls>Daś.</ls> [so also न च, there can be no doubt, <ls>Pāṇ. ii, 3, 11</ls>; <ls n="Pāṇ. ii, 3,">29</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>], or to a request, <ab>e.g.</ab> ननु गच्छामि भोः, surely I may go, <ls>Pāṇ. viii, 1, 43</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>, and even as a responsive particle, <ab>e.g.</ab> अकार्षीः कटम्ननु करोमि भोः, indeed I have made it, <ls>ib.</ls>; with another <ab>interr.</ab> or an <ab>Impv.</ab> = pray, please, <ab>e.g.</ab> ननु को भवान्, pray who are you? <ls>Mṛcch. x, 48/49</ls>; ननू<स्र्स्>च्यताम्, please tell, <ls>ib.</ls> <ls n="Mṛcch. x,">52/53</ls>; in argument often as an inceptive particle implying doubt or objection, ‘now it may be said, well, but then’ &c., <ab>esp.</ab> in नन्व् अस्तु, or ननु मा भूत्-तथा<स्र्स्>पि, well, be it so or not so-nevertheless)<info lex="ind"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=103414]</L>
a <ab>vocat.</ab> particle implying kindness or reproach or perplexity &c., <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/>

one of the chiefs of the <s1>Nāga</s1>s, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=20098]</L>

ऊम <lex>n.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of a town or place <ab>Comm.</ab> on <ls>Uṇ.</ls>; <ls>Siddh.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=37957]</L>
sAra: <hom>1.</hom> सार <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ सृ) course, motion (see पूर्व-स्°)<info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=242770]</L>
सार <lex>mfn.</lex> driving away, destroying, <ls>Bālar. ii, 60/61</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/>

<hom>2.</hom> सार <lex>m.</lex> <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>; perhaps to be connected with <hom>1.</hom> सार above; <ab>prob.</ab> <ab>fr.</ab> a lost root meaning ‘to be strong’) the core or pith or solid interior of anything, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=242807]</L>

the substance or essence or marrow or cream or heart or essential part of anything, best part, quintessence (<ab>ifc.</ab> = ‘chiefly consisting of or depending on &c.’ [<ab>cf.</ab> पर] <ab>e.g.</ab> धर्म-सारं जगत्, ‘the world chiefly depends on justice’; तूष्णीं-सार <lex type="phw">mfn.</lex> ‘chiefly silent’; सारत् सारम्, ‘the very best’), <ls>AitBr.</ls> &c. &c.<info phwchild="86516.1"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=242809]</L>
the real meaning, main point, <ls>MW.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=242810]</L>
a compendium, summary, epitome (often <ab>ifc.</ab> in titles of books)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=242811]</L>

a chief-ingredient or constituent part of the body (causing the peculiarities of temperament; reckoned to be 7, <ab>viz.</ab> सत्त्व, शुक्र, मज्जन्, अस्थि, मेदस्, मांस, रक्त), <ls>Suśr.</ls>; <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=242812]</L>
worth, value (एण, ‘in consideration of’, ‘according to’), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=242816]</L>
(in <ab>rhet.</ab>) a kind of climax (उत्तरो<स्र्स्>त्तरम् उत्कर्षः), <ls>Sāh.</ls>; <ls>Kpr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=242818]</L>
resin used as a perfume, <ls>Suśr.</ls>; <ls>ŚārṅgS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=242819]</L>
the matter formed in a boil or ulcer, pus, <ls>MW.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=242822]</L>
(= <hom>1.</hom> शार) a piece at chess or backgammon &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=242825]</L>
सार <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> hard, firm solid strong, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=242829]</L>
sound (as an argument, thoroughly proved), <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=242832]</L>
upa: उप <lex>ind.</lex> (a preposition or prefix to verbs and nouns, expressing) towards, near to (opposed to अप, away), by the side of, with, together with, under, down (<ab>e.g.</ab> उप-√ गम्, to go near, undergo; उप-गमन, approaching; in the <s1>Veda</s1> the verb has sometimes to be supplied from the context, and sometimes उप is placed after the verb to which it belongs, <ab>e.g.</ab> आययुर् उप = उपा<स्र्स्>ययुः, they approached). (As unconnected with verbs and prefixed to nouns उप expresses) direction towards, nearness, contiguity in space, time, number, degree, resemblance, and relationship, but with the idea of subordination and inferiority (<ab>e.g.</ab> उप-कनिष्ठिका, the finger next to the little finger; उप-पुराणम्, a secondary or subordinate <s1>Purāṇa</s1>; उप-दश, nearly ten)<info lex="ind"/><L>[ID=34067]</L>

sometimes forming with the nouns to which it is prefixed compound adverbs (<ab>e.g.</ab> उप-मूलम्, at the root; उप-पूर्व-रात्रम्, towards the beginning of night; उप-कूपे, near a well) which lose their adverbial terminations if they are again compounded with nouns (<ab>e.g.</ab> उपकूप-जला<स्र्स्>शय, a reservoir in the neighbourhood of a well)<info lex="inh"/>

prefixed to proper names उप may express in classical literature ‘a younger brother’ (<ab>e.g.</ab> उपे<स्र्स्>न्द्र, ‘the younger brother of <s1>Indra</s1>’), and in <ns>Buddhist</ns> literature ‘a son’. (As a separable adverb उप rarely expresses) thereto, further, moreover (<ab>e.g.</ab> तत्रो<स्र्स्>प ब्रह्म यो वेद, who further knows the <s1>Brahman</s1>), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>PārGṛ.</ls> (As a separable preposition) near to, towards, in the direction of, under, below (with <ab>acc.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> उप आशाः, towards the regions)<info lex="inh"/>
near to, at, on, upon<info lex="inh"/>
at the time of, upon, up to, in, above (with <ab>loc.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> उप सानुषु, on the tops of the mountains) <pb n="195,1"/><info lex="inh"/>

with, together with, at the same time with, according to (with <ab>inst.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> उप धर्मभिः, according to the rules of duty), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls> उप, besides the meanings given above, is said by native authorities to imply disease, extinction; ornament; command; reproof; undertaking; giving; killing; diffusing; wish; power; effort; resemblance, &c.; <info lex="inh"/>
SARa: <hom>1.</hom> शाण <lex>m.</lex> (or <lex type="hwalt">f(आ). </lex>; <ab>fr.</ab> √ शो <ab>cf.</ab> शान) a whetstone, grindstone, touchstone, <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>Rājat.</ls><info lex="m:f#A"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=215108]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> शाण <lex>m.</lex> (or <lex type="hwalt">f(आ). </lex>) a weight of four <s1>Māṣa</s1>s, <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>Bhpr.</ls><info lex="m:f#A"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=215117]</L>
<hom>3.</hom> शाण <lex>mf(ई)n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> शण) made of hemp or Bengal flax, hempen, flaxen, <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m:f#I:n"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=215122]</L>

dam: <hom>1.</hom> दम् <ab>cl.</ab> 4. दाम्यति (<ls>Pāṇ. vii, 3, 74</ls>; <ab>ind.p.</ab> दान्त्वा and दमित्वा, <ls n="Pāṇ. vii,">2, 56</ls>; <ab>aor.</ab> <ab>Pass.</ab> अदमि, <ls n="Pāṇ. vii,">3, 34</ls>, <ls>Kāś.</ls>; <ab>P.</ab> °मित्, <ls>Bhaṭṭ. xv, 37</ls>) <div n="to"/>to be tamed or tranquillised, <ls>ŚBr. xiv, 8, 2, 2</ls> (<ab>Impv.</ab> दाम्यत); <div n="to"/>to tame, subdue, conquer, <ls>MBh. vii, 2379</ls> and <ls>BhP. iii, 3, 4</ls> (<ab>ind.p.</ab> दमित्वा), <ls>Bhaṭṭ.</ls> : <ab>cl.</ab> 9. <ab>irreg.</ab> (? <ab>Subj.</ab> 2. <ab>sg.</ab> दनस्) <ab>id.</ab>, <ls>RV. i, 174, 2</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> दमयति (<ab>p.</ab> °मयत्; <ab>Ā.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. i, 3, 89</ls>) <div n="to"/>to subdue, overpower, <ls>RV. vii, 6</ls>; <ls n="RV.">x, 74, 5</ls>; <ls>AV. v, 20, 1</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Rājat.</ls>; <div n="vp"/> <ab>Desid.</ab> See √ दान्; <div n="vp"/> <info whitneyroots="dam,70"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="4P,9Ā"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=90246]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> दम् <lex>m.</lex> a house, <ls>RV. x, 46, 7</ls> (<ab>gen.</ab> <ab>pl.</ab> दमाम्)<info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=90247]</L>

the darkness of hell, hell or a particular division of hell, <ls>Mn. iv</ls>, <ls n="Mn.">viii f.</ls>; <ls>VP. ii, 6, 4</ls>; <ls>MārkP. xii, 10</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=82895]</L>

the obscuration of the sun or moon in eclipses, attributed to <s1>Rāhu</s1> (also <lex type="hwalt">m.</lex>, <ls>L.</ls>), <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>VarBṛS. v, 44</ls>; <ls>VarBṛ. ii</ls>; <ls>VarYogay.</ls>; <ls>Sūryas.</ls><info lex="m"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=82896]</L>

mental darkness, ignorance, illusion, error (in <s1>Sāṃkhya</s1> <ab>phil.</ab> one of the 5 forms of अ-विद्या, <ls>MBh. xiv, 1019</ls>; <ls>Sāṃkhyak.</ls> &c.; one of the 3 qualities or constituents of everything in creation [the cause of heaviness, ignorance, illusion, lust, anger, pride, sorrow, dulness, and stolidity; sin, <ls>L.</ls>; sorrow, <ls>Kir. iii</ls>; see गुण & <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>RTL. p. 45</ls>] <ls>Mn. xii, 24 f.</ls> and <ls n="Mn. xii,">38</ls>; <ls>Sāṃkhyak.</ls> &c.), <ls>RV. v, 31, 9</ls>; <ls>R. ii</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls>; <ls>Rājat. v, 144</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=82897]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of a son (of <s1>Śravas</s1>, <ls>MBh. xiii, 2002</ls>; of <s1>Dakṣa</s1>, <ls n="MBh.">i</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>; of <s1>Pṛthu-śravas</s1>, <ls>VP. iv, 12, 2</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=82898]</L>

नार <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>pl.</ab>) water (also <ab>sg.</ab> <lex type="hwalt">n.</lex> and <lex type="hwalt">f(आ). </lex>, <ls>L.</ls>), <ls>Mn. i, 10</ls> (<ab>prob.</ab> invented to explain नारायण)<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=105888]</L>

of a <ab n="son">s°</ab> of <s1>Samara</s1> and <ab n="father">f°</ab> of <s1>Pṛthu</s1>, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=122396]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of the god <s1>Śiva</s1> (often in the later language; <ab>esp.</ab> in the form <s1>Kṣitimūrti</s1>; <ab>du.</ab> <s1>Śarva</s1> and <s1>Śarvāṇī</s1> <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Vām. v, 2, 21</ls>), <ls>AV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=213640]</L>

the primeval Man or eternal Spirit pervading the universe (always associated with <s1>Nārāyaṇa</s1>, ‘son of the <ab n="primeval">pr°</ab> man’ <pb n="529,1"/>; both are considered either as gods or sages and accordingly called देवौ, ऋषी, तापसौ &c.; in <lang>ep.</lang> poetry they are the sons of <s1>Dharma</s1> by <s1>Mūrti</s1> or <s1>A-hiṃsā</s1> and emanations of <s1>Viṣṇu</s1>, <s1>Arjuna</s1> being identified with <s1>Nara</s1>, and <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1> with <s1>Nārāyaṇa</s1>), <ls>Mn.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> -सूनु), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>Pur.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104032]</L>

of a <ab n="son">s°</ab> of <s1>Bhavan-manyu</s1> (<s1>Manyu</s1>) and <ab n="father">f°</ab> of <s1>Saṃkṛti</s1>, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104038]</L>
of <s1>Bhāradvāja</s1> (author of <ls>RV. vi, 35</ls> and <ls n="RV. vi,">36</ls>), <ls>Anukr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104039]</L>
of one of the 10 horses of the Moon, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104041]</L>
नर <lex>n.</lex> a kind of fragrant grass.<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=104043]</L>

(<ab>voc.</ab> [like तात] also term of affection addressed to a son, <ls>AitBr. v, 14, 3</ls>; <ls n="AitBr.">vii, 14, 8</ls>). <info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=81781]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> तत <lex>mfn.</lex>, <ls n="Pāṇ.">vi, 4, 37</ls> extended, stretched, spread, diffused, expanded, <ls>RV.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=82230]</L>
covered over by (<ab>instr.</ab> or in <ab>comp.</ab>), <ls>Laghuj. ii, 16</ls>; <ls>Kir. v, 11</ls>; <ls>Śiś. ix, 23</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=82232]</L>
sAya: <hom>1.</hom> साय <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>prob.</ab> <ab>fr.</ab> √ सो See अवसाय, अवसान; but <ab>cf.</ab> <hom>2.</hom> साय, <ab>col.</ab> 3) the close of day, evening (सायं-√ कृ, ‘to spend the evening, make a stay’), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=242681]</L>
Evening personified (as a son of <s1>Puṣpārṇa</s1> and <s1>Doṣā</s1> or as a son of <s1>Dhātṛ</s1> and <s1>Kuhū</s1>), <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=242682]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> साय <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>2.</hom> सि; for <hom>1.</hom> See <ab>col.</ab> 2) a missile, arrow (= सायक), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=242730]</L>
साय <lex>n.</lex> unloosing, unyoking, turning in <ls>RV.</ls> &c.<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=242731]</L>

joy, gladness, pleasure, <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>TBr.</ls> (°अस् <lex type="phw">ind.</lex> gladly, briskly, swiftly, <ls>RV.</ls>)<info phwchild="159286.1"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=159280]</L>

a half (<ab>cf.</ab> अधर-, अहर्-, द्यु-), <ls>VarBṛS.</ls>; <ls>Suśr. i, 7</ls>; <ls>Sūryas.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=90703]</L>
‘unfolding itself’, a small shoot, blade, petal, leaf (often <ab>ifc.</ab> in names of plants), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=90705]</L>
दल <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of a prince, <ls>MBh. iii, 13178</ls>; <ls>VP. iv, 4, 47</ls>,<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=90712]</L>
saMDf: सं-√ धृ <ab>P.</ab> <ab>Ā.</ab> -धारयति; <div n="vp"/> °ते (<ab>impf.</ab> <lang>ep.</lang> सम्-अधारम् = -अधारयम्; <ab>pr.</ab> <ab>p.</ab> <ab>P.</ab> संधारयत्; <ab>Ā.</ab> -धारयमाण, or -धारयाण; <ab>pf.</ab> सं-दधार), <div n="to"/>to hold together, bear, carry, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to hold up, support, preserve, observe, maintain, <ls>ib.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to keep in remembrance, <ls>Pañcat.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to hold back, restrain, withstand, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to suffer, endure, <ls>ib.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to hold or fix the mind on (<ab>loc.</ab>), <ls>BhP.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to promise, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to hold out, live, exist, <ls>MārkP.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to be ready to serve any one (<ab>gen.</ab>) with (<ab>instr.</ab>), <ls>Kāraṇḍ.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Pass.</ab> -ध्रियते, to resolve or fix upon (<ab>loc.</ab>), <ls>TS.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to be kept or observed, <ls>R.</ls>; <div n="to"/> -धार्यते, to be held together or borne or kept or maintained, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls> &c.<info verb="pre" cp="PĀ" parse="sam+Df"/><L>[ID=231868]</L>

yA: या (आ), <lex>f.</lex> going; a car<info lex="f"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=168992]</L>

1. या (collateral form of √ 5. इ) cl. 2. P. (Dhātup. xxiv, 41) याति (1. pl. यामहे, MBh.; impf. 3. pl. अयुः, Br.; अयान्, Pāṇ. iii, 4, 111, Sch.; pf. ययौ, ययाथ, यय, ययुः, RV. &c. &c.; यये, Kāv.; aor. अयासम् or अयासिषम्; Subj. यासत्, येषम्, यासिषत्, RV.; Br.; Prec. यासिषीष्ठास्, Br.; fut. याता, MBh. &c.; यास्यति, AV.; °ते, MBh.; inf. यातुम्, MBh. &c.; Ved. inf. यै, यातवे or °वै; ind.p. यात्वा, Br. &c.; -याय, -यायम्, ib.),
to go, proceed, move, walk, set out, march, advance, travel, journey (often with instr. or acc. of the way, esp. with गतिम्, मार्गम्, अध्वानम्, पन्थानम्, पदवीम्, यात्राम्), RV. &c. &c.;
to go away, withdraw, retire, MBh.; Kāv. &c.;
(also with पला<स्र्स्>य्य) to flee, escape, R.; Kathās. (with क्षेमेण or स्वस्ति, to escape unscathed, Pañcat.; BhP.);
to go towards or against, go or come to, enter, approach, arrive at, reach, RV. &c. &c. (with acc. often followed by प्रति, e.g. with गृहम्, to enter a house; with रिपुम् प्रति, to march against the enemy; with मृगयाम्, to go out hunting; with शिरसामहीम्, to bow down to the ground with the head; with प्रकृतिम्, to return to one's natural state; with कर्णौ, to come to the ears, be heard; with उत्सवाद् उत्सवम्, to go from one festival to another; with हस्तम् ifc., to fall into the hands of; with पथम् or गोचरम् ifc., to come within range of; esp. with the acc. of an abstract noun = to go to any state or condition, become, be, e.g. विनाशं याति, he goes to destruction i.e. he is destroyed; काठिन्यं याति, it becomes hard; द्वेष्यतां याति, he becomes hated; similarly निधनं-√ या, to die; निद्रां-√ या, to fall asleep; उदयं-√ या, to rise, said of stars &c.; sometimes also with loc., e.g. याहि राज्ञः सकाशे, go into the presence of the king, R.; or even with dat., e.g. ययतुः स्व-निवेशाय, both went home, Kathās. ; न चा<स्र्स्>त्मने कृपणस्य धनं याति, nor does the wealth of the miser go to [i.e. benefit] himself, Hit.; फलेभ्यो याति, he goes to [fetch] fruits, Pāṇ. ii, 3, 14, Sch.);
to go to for any request, implore, solicit (with two acc.), RV.;
(with स्त्रियम्) to go to a woman for sexual intercourse, MBh.;
to go to for any purpose (inf.), Bhaṭṭ.; Vop.;
often with adverbs, e.g. with बहिर्, to go out, Kathās.;
with अधो, to go down, sink, BhP.;
with खण्डशो or दलशो, to fall to pieces, Kathās.;
with शत-धा, to fall into a hundred pieces, ib.;
to extend to (acc.), VarBṛS.;
to last for (acc.), Hit.;
to pass away, elapse (said of time), MBh.; Kāv. &c.;
to vanish, disappear (as wealth), Mṛcch.;
to come to pass, prosper, succeed, BhP.;
to proceed, behave, act, MBh.;
to find out, discover, MBh.;
to receive or learn (a science) from (abl.), BhP.;
to undertake, undergo (acc.), RV.;
Impv. यातु, be it as it may, Hit. :
Pass. यायते, to be gone or moved, MBh. :
Caus. यापयति (aor. अयीयपत्), to cause to depart, cause to go or march, dismiss, Kāv.; BhP.;
to cause to go towards (acc.), Pāṇ. i, 4, 32, Sch. (cf. यापित);
to direct (the gaze) towards (loc.), Bhartṛ. (v.l. पातयति);
to drive away remove, cure (a disease), Suśr.;
to cause to pass or elapse, pass or spend (time), MBh.; Kāv. &c.;
to live (Pāli yāpeti), Divyāv.;
to cause to subsist, support, maintain, Divyāv.;
to induce, MW. :
Desid. यियासति, to intend or be about to go, desire to proceed, MBh.; Kāv. &c.:
Intens. ईयायते (?), to move, PraśnUp.;
याययते, यायेति, यायाति Gr.[ID=171018]
<hom>2.</hom> या (<ab>ifc.</ab>) going, moving (see ऋण-, एव-, तुर-, देव-या).<info hui="2"/><L>[ID=171019]</L>
rA: रा (आ), <lex>f.</lex> (only <ls>L.</ls>) amorous play (= विभ्रम)<info lex="f"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=173021]</L>

<hom>1.</hom> रा or रास् <ab>cl.</ab> 2. <ab>P.</ab> (<ls>Dhātup. xxiv, 49</ls>) राति (<lang>Ved.</lang> also <ab>Ā.</ab> राते; <ab>Impv.</ab> रिरीहि, ररास्व, ररीध्वम्; <ab>p.</ab> रराण; 3. <ab>sg.</ab> ररते and रासते; <ab>pf.</ab> ररिम, ररे; <ab>aor.</ab> अरास्म <ab>Subj.</ab> रासत् &c. <ab>Pot.</ab> रासीय; <lang>Class.</lang> forms are only <ab>pr.</ab> राति; <ab>fut.</ab> राता, <ls>BhP.</ls>; रास्यति, <ls>Vop.</ls>, and <ab>inf.</ab> रा<स्र्स्>तवे, <ls>BhP.</ls>), to grant, give, bestow, impart, yield, surrender, <ls>RV.</ls>; &c.<info westergaard="rA,24.49,02.0060"/><info whitneyroots="rA1,138"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="2P,2Ā"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=176008]</L>

arara: अरर <lex>n.</lex> a covering, a sheath, <ls>L.</ls>,<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=15188]</L>

a part of a sacrifice, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=15191]</L>

(with <ns>Buddhists</ns>) the Destroyer, Evil One (who tempts men to indulge their passions and is the great enemy of the <s1>Buddha</s1> and his religion; four <s1>Māra</s1>s are enumerated in <ls>Dharmas. 80</ls>, <ab>viz.</ab> स्कन्ध-, क्लेश-, देवपुत्र-, and मृत्यु-म्°; but the later <ns>Buddhist</ns> theory of races of gods led to the figment of millions of <s1>Māra</s1>s ruled over by a chief <s1>Māra</s1>), <ls>MWB. 208</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=163220]</L>
vAma: <hom>1.</hom> वाम <lex>m.</lex> (for <hom>2.</hom> and <hom>3.</hom> See <ab>col.</ab> 2) the act of vomiting <ab>g.</ab> ज्वला<स्र्स्>दि<info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=190924]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> वाम <lex>mf(ई or आ)n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> वन्; for <hom>1.</hom> See <ab>col.</ab> 1) lovely, dear, pleasant, agreeable, fair, beautiful, splendid, noble, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m:f#A:f#I:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=190969]</L>
(<ab>ifc.</ab>) striving after, eager for, intent upon, fond of <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls>; <ls>Rājat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190970]</L>

the god of love, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190972]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of <s1>Śiva</s1>, <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190973]</L>
of a <s1>Rudra</s1>, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190974]</L>
of <s1>Varuṇa</s1>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190975]</L>

of a son of <s1>Bhaṭṭa-nārāyaṇa</s1>, <ls>Kṣitīś.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> -देव)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190980]</L>
of one of the Moon's horses, <ls>VP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190981]</L>
वाम <lex>m.</lex> or <lex type="hw">n.</lex> a kind of pot-herb, <bot>Chenopodium Album</bot>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=190982]</L>
वाम <lex>n.</lex> a lovely thing, any dear or desirable good (as gold, horses &c.), wealth, fortune, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>Br.</ls>; <ls>ChUp.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=190996]</L>
वाम <lex>mfn.</lex> relating to a mare, <ls>Pat.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> under ई <lex type="nhw">f.</lex> above). <info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=190997]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> वाम <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (perhaps originally identical with <hom>2.</hom> above) left, not right, being or situated on the left side, <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c. &c. (the quivering of the left eye or arm is supposed to be a good omen in women and of the left arm a bad omen in men)<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=191034]</L>
reverse, adverse, contrary, opposite, unfavourable, <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=191035]</L>
crooked, oblique (अम् <lex type="phw">ind.</lex> sideways), <ls>BhP.</ls><info phwchild="191046.1"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=191036]</L>
refractory, coy (in love), <ls>Sāh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=191037]</L>
acting in the opposite way or differently, <ls>Śak. iv, 18</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=191038]</L>
hard, cruel, <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>Pur.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=191039]</L>
vile, wicked, base, low, bad, <ls>Kir.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=191040]</L>

वाम <lex>m.</lex> the left hand, <ls>RāmatUp.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=191042]</L>

an animal, sentient being, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=191044]</L>

the left-hand practices of the followers of the <s1>Tantra</s1>s (= वामा<स्र्स्>चार, <ab>q.v.</ab>), <ls>Cat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=191046]</L>
maKa: <hom>1.</hom> मख <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>prob.</ab> connected with √ <hom>1.</hom> मह् or √ मंह्) jocund, cheerful, sprightly, vigorous, active, restless (said of the <s1>Marut</s1>s and other gods), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>Br.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=154032]</L>

(<ab>prob.</ab>) <ab>N.</ab> of a mythical being (<ab>esp.</ab> in मखस्य शिरः, ‘<s1>Makha</s1>'s head’), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> also <ab>comp.</ab>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=154035]</L>

वात <lex>m.</lex> wind or the wind-god (<ab>pl.</ab> also ‘the <s1>Marut</s1>s’, <ab>cf.</ab> वायु), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=189438]</L>
wind emitted from the body, <ls>MBh. iv, 117</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=189440]</L>
wind or air as one of the humours of the body (also called वायु, मारुत, पवन, अनिल, समीरण), <ls>Kathās.</ls>; <ls>Suśr.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=189441]</L>
morbid affection of the windy humour, flatulence, gout, rheumatism &c., <ls>VarBṛS.</ls>; <ls>Śṛṅgār.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=189442]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a people (see वात-पति and वाता<स्र्स्>धिप)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=189443]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> वात <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ वन्) = वनित, solicited, wished for, desired (<ab>cf.</ab> विवस्वद्-व्°)<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=190609]</L>
attacked, assailed, injured, hurt (<ab>cf.</ab> <hom>3.</hom> अ-व्° and निवात). <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190610]</L>
<hom>3.</hom> वात <lex>mfn.</lex> (for <hom>1.</hom> and <hom>2.</hom> See <ab>pp.</ab> 934, 939) dried up (see <hom>1.</hom> अ-वात). <info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=206545]</L>

the act of checking or curbing, suppression, restraint (with वाचाम्, restraint of words, silence), <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170384]</L>

self-control forbearance, any great moral rule or duty (as <ab>opp.</ab> to नियम, a minor observance; in <ls>Yājñ. iii, 313</ls> ten <s1>Yama</s1>s are mentioned, sometimes only five), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170385]</L>
(in <s1>Yoga</s1>) self-restraint (as the first of the eight <s1>Aṅga</s1>s or means of attaining mental concentration), <ls>IW. 93</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170386]</L>
यम <lex>mf(आ or ई)n.</lex> twin-born, twin, forming a pair, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m:f#A:f#I:n"/><L>[ID=170388]</L>

यम <lex>m.</lex> a twin, one of a pair or couple, a fellow (<ab>du.</ab> ‘the twins’, <ab>N.</ab> of the <s1>Aśvin</s1>s and of their twin children by <s1>Mādrī</s1>, called <s1>Nakula</s1> and <s1>Saha-deva</s1>; यमौ मिथुनौ, twins of different sex), <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=170389]</L>
a symbolical <ab>N.</ab> for the number ‘two’, <ls>Hcat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170390]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of the god who presides over the <s1>Pitṛ</s1>s (<ab>q.v.</ab>) and rules the spirits of the dead, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c., <ls>IW. 18</ls>; <ls n="IW.">197</ls>, <ls n="IW.">198</ls> &c.; <ls>RTL. 10</ls>; <ls n="RTL.">16</ls>; <ls n="RTL.">289</ls> &c. (he is regarded as the first of men and born from <s1>Vivasvat</s1>, ‘the Sun’, and his wife <s1>Saraṇyū</s1>; while his brother, the seventh <s1>Manu</s1>, another form of the first man, is the son of <s1>Vivasvat</s1> and <s1>Saṃjñā</s1>, the image of <s1>Saraṇyū</s1>; his twin-sister is <s1>Yamī</s1>, with whom he resists sexual alliance, but by whom he is mourned after his death, so that the gods, to make her forget her sorrow, create night; in the <s1>Veda</s1> he is called a king or संगमनो जनानाम्, ‘the gatherer of men’, and rules over the departed fathers in heaven, the road to which is guarded by two broad-nosed, four-eyed, spotted dogs, the children of <s1>Śaramā</s1> <ab>q.v.</ab>; in Post-vedic mythology he is the appointed Judge and ‘Restrainer’ or ‘Punisher’ of the dead, in which capacity he is also called धर्मराज or धर्म and corresponds to the Greek Pluto and to Minos; his abode is in some region of the lower world called <s1>Yama-pura</s1>; thither a soul when it leaves the body, is said to repair, and there, after the recorder, <s1>Citra-gupta</s1>, has read an account of its actions kept in a book called <s1>Agra-saṃdhānā</s1>, it receives a just sentence; in <ls>MBh.</ls> <s1>Yama</s1> is described as dressed in blood-red garments, with a glittering form, a crown on his head, glowing eyes and like <s1>Varuṇa</s1>, holding a noose, with which he binds the spirit after drawing it from the body, in size about the measure of a man's thumb; he is otherwise represented as grim in aspect, green in colour, clothed in red, riding on a buffalo, and holding a club in one hand and noose in the other; in the later mythology he is always represented as a terrible deity inflicting tortures, called यातना, on departed spirits <pb n="846,2"/>; he is also one of the 8 guardians of the world as regent of the South quarter; he is the regent of the <s1>Nakṣatra</s1> <s1>Apa-bharaṇī</s1> or <s1>Bharaṇī</s1>, the supposed author of <ls>RV. x, 10</ls>; <ls n="RV. x,">14</ls>, of a hymn to <s1>Viṣṇu</s1> and of a law-book; यमस्या<स्र्स्>र्कः <ab>N.</ab> of a <s1>Sāman</s1>, <ls>ĀrṣBr.</ls>) <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170391]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of the planet Saturn (regarded as the son of <s1>Vivasvat</s1> and <s1>Chāyā</s1>), <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170392]</L>
of one of <s1>Skanda</s1>'s attendants (mentioned together with <s1>Ati-yama</s1>), <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170393]</L>
a bad horse (whose limbs are either too small or too large), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170395]</L>
यम <lex>n.</lex> a pair, brace, couple, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=170397]</L>

(in <ab>gram.</ab>) a twin-letter (the consonant interposed and generally understood, but not written in practice, between a nasal immediately preceded by one of the four other consonants in each class), <ls>Prāt.</ls>; <ls>Pat.</ls> on <ls>Pāṇ. i, 1, 8</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170398]</L>
pitch of the voice, tone of utterance, key, <ls>Prāt.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170399]</L>
aMSaM: अंश <lex>m.</lex> (probably <ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> अश्, <ab>perf.</ab> आन्-अंश, and not from the above √ अंश् fictitiously formed to serve as root), a share, portion, part, party<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=10]</L>
the denominator of a fraction<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=16]</L>
a degree of latitude or longitude<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=17]</L>
man: मन् in <ab>comp.</ab> for <hom>1.</hom> मद्.<info lexcat="LEXID=pron,STEM=asmad"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=155285]</L>

मन् <ab>cl.</ab> 8. 4. <ab>Ā.</ab> (<ls>Dhātup. xxx, 9</ls>; <ls n="Dhātup.">xxv, 67</ls>) मनुते, मन्यते (<lang>ep.</lang> also °ति; 3. <ab>pl.</ab> मन्वते, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ab>pf.</ab> मेने, <ls>Br.</ls> &c.; मम्नाथे, °नात्स्, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ab>aor.</ab> अमत, अमन्महि <ab>Subj.</ab> मनामहे, मनन्त, <ab>p.</ab> मनान, <ab>q.v.</ab>, <ls>RV.</ls>; मंसि, अमंस्त <ab>Subj.</ab> मंसते <ab>Prec.</ab> मंसीष्ट, 1. <ab>pers.</ab> <ab>mc.</ab> मसीय, <ls>ib.</ls>; मांस्त, <ls>AV.</ls>, °स्ताद्म्, <ls>TĀr.</ls>; मन्ध्वम्, <ls>Br.</ls>; अमनिष्ट <ab>Gr.</ab>; <ab>fut.</ab> मंस्यते, <ls>Br.</ls>, °ति, <ls>MBh.</ls>; मन्त, मनिता <ab>Gr.</ab>; मनिष्यते, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ab>inf.</ab> मन्तुम्, <ls>MBh.</ls> &c., मन्तवे, °तवै, <ls>RV.</ls>, मन्तोस्, <ls>Br.</ls>; <ab>ind.p.</ab> मत्वा, <ls>Up.</ls> &c.; मनित्वा <ab>Gr.</ab>; -मत्य, <ls>Br.</ls> &c.; -मन्य, <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.), <div n="to"/>to think, believe, imagine, suppose, conjecture, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (मन्ये, I think, methinks, is in later language often inserted in a sentence without affecting the construction; <ab>cf.</ab> <ab>g.</ab> चा<स्र्स्>दि and <ls>Pāṇ. iv, 1, 106</ls>); <div n="to"/>to regard or consider any one or anything (<ab>acc.</ab>) as (<ab>acc.</ab> with or without इव, or <ab>adv.</ab>, often in -वत्; in later language also <ab>dat.</ab>, to express contempt [<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. ii, 3, 17</ls>], <ab>e.g.</ab> <ab>g.</ab> राज्यं तृणाय मन्ये, ‘I value empire at a straw’ <ab>i.e.</ab> I make light of it = लघु √ मन्, and <ab>opp.</ab> to बहु, or साधु √ मन्, to think much or well of, praise, approve), <ls>ib.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to think one's self or be thought to be, appear as, pass for (<ab>nom.</ab>; also with इव), <ls>ib.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to be of opinion, think fit or right, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to agree or be of the same opinion with (<ab>acc.</ab>), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to set the heart or mind on, honour, esteem (with न, disdain), hope or wish for (<ab>acc.</ab> or <ab>gen.</ab>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.; <div n="to"/>to offer, present, <ls>MBh.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> (<ls>Dhātup. xxxiv, 36</ls>) मानयति (<lang>ep.</lang> also °ते; <ab>aor.</ab> अमीमनत्; <ab>Pass.</ab> मान्यते), <div n="to"/>to honour, esteem, value highly (also with उरु, बहु and साधु), <ls>AV.</ls> &c. &c.; मीमांस्यते, <ls>AV.</ls>; मिमंसते, मिमनिषते <ab>Gr.</ab>), <div n="to"/>to reflect upon, consider, examine, investigate, <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>Br.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to call in question, doubt (‘with regard to’ <ab>loc.</ab>), <ls>ib.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Desid.</ab> of <ab>Desid.</ab> मिमामिषते <ab>Gr.</ab>: <div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab> मन्मन्यते, मन्मन्ति, <ls>ib.</ls> <info westergaard="mAna,34.36,10.0234;mana,33.35,10.0153;mAna,23.3,01.0690;manu,30.9,08.0010"/><info whitneyroots="man,118"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="8,4Ā"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=156626]</L>

(either high or low), accent (of which there are three kinds, उदात्त, अनुदात्त <ab>qq.vv.</ab>, and स्वरित, <ab>col.</ab> 3), a note of the musical scale (of which seven [rarely six or eight] are enumerated, 1. निषाद; 2. ऋषभ; 3. गान्धार; 4. षड्ज; 5. मध्यम; 6. धैवत; 7. पञ्चम [described as resembling respectively the notes of an elephant, bull, goat, peacock, curlew or heron, horse, and <bio>Koil</bio> <pb n="1285,2"/>; and designated by their initial letters or syllables thus, नि; ऋ; ग; ष; म; ध; प], but the order is sometimes changed, षद्ज being placed first, and निषाद last), <ls>Prāt.</ls>; <ls>ŚrS.</ls>; <ls>Saṃgīt.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=259871]</L>

air breathed through the nostrils, <ls>ChUp.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=259877]</L>
स्वर (अम्), <lex>n.</lex> a musical note, <ls>Sāy.</ls> on <ls>RV. x, 146, 2</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=259880]</L>

a <ab>partic.</ab> form of constellation in which all the planets or stars are grouped in double mansions, <ls>Var.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104382]</L>
the 50th year of the cycle of Jupiter which lasts 60 years, <ls>Cat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104383]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a divine being mentioned with <s1>Yama</s1>, <ls>Karmapr.</ls> (= पितृ-देव, or -दैव, <ls>L.</ls>; a deified progenitor, <ls>W.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104384]</L>

place or room, stead (स्थाने with <ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>ifc.</ab> ‘in place of’, ‘instead of’, ‘in lieu of’; रिपु-स्थाने-√ वृत्, ‘to act in the place of an enemy’; विलोचन-स्थान-गत, ‘acting the part of eyes’; also स्थान <ab>ifc.</ab> = ‘taking the place of’, ‘acting as’, ‘representing’ or ‘represented by’ <ab>e.g.</ab> पितृ-स्थ्°, ‘acting as a father’ or ‘represented by a <ab n="father">f°</ab>’; इयङ्-उवङ्-स्थान, ‘<ab n="represented">repr°</ab> by इय् or उव्’ [as ई and ऊ, <ls>Pāṇ. i, 4, 4</ls>]; in <s1>Pāṇini</s1>'s grammar the <ab>gen.</ab> case is often used alone, when the word स्थाने has to be supplied, <ab>e.g.</ab> हन्तेर् जः, ‘ज is to be substituted in place of हन्’, <ls n="Pāṇ.">i, 1, 49</ls>), <ls>AitBr.</ls>; <ls>GṛŚrS.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255384]</L>

province, region, domain, sphere (of gods or virtuous men; said to be in one of three places, <ab>viz.</ab> ‘earth’ or ‘atmosphere’ or ‘heaven’; <ab>accord.</ab> to some that of virtuous <ns>Brāhmans</ns> is called <s1>Prājāpatya</s1>; of <s1>Kṣatriya</s1>s, <s1>Aindra</s1>; of <s1>Vaiśya</s1>s, <s1>Māruta</s1>; of <s1>Śūdra</s1>s, <s1>Gāndharva</s1>), <ls>Nir.</ls>; <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255387]</L>

the place or organ of utterance of any sound (said to be 8 in number, <ab>viz.</ab> कण्ठ, ‘throat’; तालु, ‘palate’; मूर्धन्, ‘top of palate’; दन्त, ‘teeth’; ओष्ठ, ‘lips’; कण्ठ-तालु, ‘throat and palate’; कण्ठ्ऽ-ओष्ठ, ‘throat and lips’; दन्त्ऽ-ओष्ठ, ‘teeth and lips’; to which are added नासिका, ‘nose’, said to be the place of utterance of true <s1>Anusvāra</s1>, and उरस्, ‘chest’, of <s1>Visarga</s1>), <ls>Pāṇ. i, 1, 9</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>; <ls>Prāt.</ls>; <ls>Sarvad.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255390]</L>

shape, form, appearance (as of the moon), <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255393]</L>
the part or character of an actor, <ls>MW.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255394]</L>
case, occurrence (ने<स्र्स्>दं स्थानं विद्यते, ‘this case does not occur’), <ls>Yājñ.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls>; <ls>Vajracch.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255395]</L>

occasion, opportunity for (<ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>; °ने <lex type="phw">ind.</lex> ‘occasionally’), <ls>ŚrS.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info phwchild="255404.1"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255396]</L>

cause or object of (<ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>comp.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> शुल्क-स्थान, ‘an object of toll’; पूजा- or मान्य-स्थ्°, ‘an object of honour’; also applied to persons; °ने <lex type="phw">ind.</lex> ‘because of’, ‘on account of’), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls><info phwchild="255404.2"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255397]</L>

an altar, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=255403]</L>

of a man, <ls>VP.</ls> (<ls>L.</ls> also, ‘a <ab>partic.</ab> disease of the eyes’; ‘a <ab>partic.</ab> <s1>Śrāddha</s1>’; ‘a deity presiding over <s1>Śrāddha</s1>s’; ‘the 14th of the <ab>astron.</ab> <s1>Yogas</s1>’.)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=261730]</L>

the act of delighting, delight, joy, happiness, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=261733]</L>

canAya: <hom>1.</hom> चन् <ab>cl.</ab> 1. °नति, to sound, utter a sound, <ls>L.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to hurt, injure, <ls>Dhātup. xix, 41.</ls><info westergaard="cana,19.41,01.0527"/><info verb="root" cp="1"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=71514]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> चन् (<ab>cf.</ab> √ कन्), only <ab>aor.</ab> <ab>Subj.</ab> 2. <ab>du.</ab> चनिष्टम् ‘to delight in, be satisfied with (<ab>loc.</ab>)’, <ls>RV. vii, 70, 4</ls>; <div n="vp"/> and 3. <ab>sg.</ab> चनिष्ठत् [जन्°, <ls>SV.</ls>], ‘to satisfy, please’, <ls>RV. viii, 74, 11.</ls><info whitneyroots="can,44"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp=""/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=71515]</L>

kala: कल <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (<ab>etym.</ab> doubtful) indistinct, dumb, <ls>BṛĀrUp.</ls>; <ls>ChUp.</ls><info lex="m:f#A:n"/><listinfo n="sup"/><L>[ID=45601]</L>
(<ab>ifc.</ab>, बाष्प, or अश्रु preceding) indistinct or inarticulate (on account of tears), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=45602]</L>
low, soft (as a tone), emitting a soft tone, melodious (as a voice or throat), <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls>; <ls>Vikr.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=45603]</L>
a kind of faulty pronunciation of vowels, <ls>Pat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=45604]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> सात <lex>mfn.</lex> (for <hom>3.</hom> See <pcol>p. 1200, col. 1</pcol>) ended, destroyed, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=240863]</L>

hAna[m]: <hom>1.</hom> हान <lex>mfn.</lex> gone or departed &c. (in संहान, ‘risen’), <ls>VS.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=262504]</L>

asat: अ-सत् <lex>mf(अ-सती)n.</lex> [in <ls>RV.</ls> seven times असत् and five times आसत् with lengthening of the accentuated vowel] not being, not existing, unreal, <ls>RV. vii, 134, 8</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>Up.</ls>; <ls>Kum. iv, 12</ls><info lex="m:f#asatI:n"/><L>[ID=20529]</L>

janam: जन <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>g.</ab> वृषा<स्र्स्>दि) creature, living being, man, person, race (पञ्च जनास्, ‘the five races’ = प्° कृष्टयस्, <ls>RV. iii</ls>, <ls n="RV.">viii ff.</ls>; <ls>MBh. iii, 14160</ls>), people, subjects (the <ab>sg.</ab> used collectively, <ab>e.g.</ab> दैव्य or दिव्या ज्°, ‘divine race’, the gods collectively, <ls>RV.</ls>; महत् ज्°, many people, <ls>R. vi, 101, 2</ls>; often <ab>ifc.</ab> denoting one person or a number of persons collectively, <ab>e.g.</ab> प्रेष्य-, बन्धु-, सखी- &c., <ab>qq.vv.</ab> <pb n="410,2"/>; with names of peoples, <ls>VarBṛS. iv, 22</ls> and <ls n="VarBṛS.">v, 74</ls>; अयं जनः, ‘this person, these persons’, I, we, <ls>MBh. viii, 709</ls>; <ls>Hariv. 7110</ls>; <ls>R. ii, 41, 2</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls> &c.; एष ज्°, <ab>id.</ab>, <ls>Kāvyād. ii, 75</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=76737]</L>

the person nearest to the speaker (also with अयम् or असौ, ‘this my lover’, <ls>Kāvyād. ii, 271</ls>; <ls>Ratnāv. i, 24/25</ls>), <ls>Nal. x, 10</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls>; <ls>Mālav.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=76738]</L>
a common person, one of the people, <ls>Kir. ii, 42</ls> and <ls n="Kir. ii,">47</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=76739]</L>
the world beyond the <s1>Mahar-loka</s1>, <ls>BhP. iii, 11, 29</ls>; <ls>SkandaP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=76740]</L>

(a noun ending in अस् followed by कंस in a compound does not change its final, <ab>cf.</ab> अयस्-कंस, &c., <ls>Pāṇ. viii, 3, 46</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=41371]</L>
a particular measure (= two <s1>Āḍhaka</s1>s, <ls>Car.</ls>; = one <s1>Āḍhaka</s1>, <ls>L.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=41372]</L>
a metal, tutanag or white copper, brass, bell-metal<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=41373]</L>

कंस (अस्), <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of a king of <s1>Mathurā</s1> (son of <s1>Ugra-sena</s1> and cousin of the <s1>Devakī</s1> who was mother of <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1> [<s1>Ugra-sena</s1> being brother of <s1>Devaka</s1>, who was father of <s1>Devakī</s1>]; he is usually called the uncle, but was really a cousin of <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1>, and became his implacable enemy because it had been prophesied to <s1>Kaṃsa</s1> that he would be killed by a child of <s1>Devakī</s1>; as the foe of the deity he is identified with the <s1>Asura</s1> <s1>Kālanemi</s1>; and, as he was ultimately slain by <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1>, the latter receives epithets like कंस-जित्, conqueror of <s1>Kaṃsa</s1>, &c.), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>VP.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=41374]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a place <ab>g.</ab> तक्षशिला<स्र्स्>दि, <ls>Pāṇ. iv, 3, 93</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=41375]</L>
vanAm: वना <lex>f.</lex> the piece of wood used for kindling fire by attrition (= अरणि, <ab>q.v.</ab>; sometimes personified), <ls>RV. iii, 13</ls><info lex="f"/><L>[ID=185732]</L>

a bird of prey, vulture (<ls>L.</ls> = शकुन्त, कुक्कुट, गृध्र &c.), <ls>AdbhBr.</ls>; <ls>Āpast.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls> &c. (<ab>w.r.</ab> भाष)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=150603]</L>
of a dramatic poet (also called <s1>Bhāsaka</s1>), <ls>Mālav.</ls>; <ls>Hcar.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=150606]</L>
of a son of a minister of king <s1>Candra-prabha</s1>, <ls>Kathās.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=150607]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> वस्मन् <lex>n.</lex> (for <hom>1.</hom> See <pcol>p. 932, col. 2</pcol>) a nest, <ls>RV. ii, 31, 1.</ls><info lex="n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=189182]</L>
avamam: अवम <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> undermost, inferior, lowest base, <ls>RV.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=17761]</L>

maTum: मथु <lex>m.</lex> a proper <ab>N.</ab> (= मधु; <ab>cf.</ab> माथव). <info lex="m"/><L>[ID=155223]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> वार <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> वृ) keeping back, restraining (also <lex type="hwifc">mfn.</lex> <ab>ifc.</ab> = difficult to be restrained, <ls>TBr.</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> दुर्-व्°)<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=191590]</L>
anything which covers or surrounds or restrains, a cover, <ls>MW.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
anything which causes an obstruction, a gate, door-way, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
anything enclosed or circumscribed in space or time, <ab>esp.</ab> an appointed place (<ab>e.g.</ab> स्व-वारं समा-√ स्था, to occupy one's proper place), <ls>R.</ls><info lex="inh"/>

the time fixed or appointed for anything (<ab>accord.</ab> to some <ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>2.</hom> वृ, to choose), a person's turn, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c. (often, <ab>esp.</ab> with numerals, = times, <ab>e.g.</ab> वरांस् त्रीन् or वर-त्रयम्, three times; भूरिभिर् वारैः or भूरि-वारान् or बहु-वारम् or वारं वारम् or वारं वारेण, many times, often, repeatedly)<info lex="inh"/>

the turn of a day (under the regency of a planet), a day of the week (they are <s1>Āditya</s1>-, <s1>Soma</s1>-, <s1>Maṅgala</s1>-, <s1>Budha</s1>-, <s1>Guru</s1>-, <s1>Śukra</s1>-, and <s1>Śani</s1>-<s1>vāra</s1>; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>IW. 178 n. 1</ls>), <ls>Gaṇit.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c. (<ab>cf.</ab> दिन and दिवस-व्°)<info lex="inh"/>
वार <lex>n.</lex> a vessel for holding spirituous liquor, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/>

anything chosen or choice or exquisite, goods, treasure, <ls>RV.</ls> (often <ab>ifc.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> अशस्त-, ऋधद्-, दाति-व्° &c.)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=191689]</L>
jaram: जर <lex>mfn.</lex> (√ <hom>1.</hom> जॄ), ‘becoming old’, see अ-जर, अहर्-जरम्<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=77595]</L>
