हनन <lex>n.</lex> the act of striking or hitting, <ls>Nir. i, 1</ls>; <ls n="Nir. i,">7</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=260425]</L>
mazam: मषम् <lex>ind.</lex> (with <ab>Caus.</ab> of √ <hom>1.</hom> कृ) to grind to powder, pulverize, <ls>ŚāṅkhGṛ.</ls> (<ab>v.l.</ab> °षिम्). <info lex="ind"/><L>[ID=159031]</L>
Sala: शल <lex>mfn.</lex> (connection with above very doubtful) = द्रवण-समर्थ, <ls>Nir.</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=214063]</L>
a kind of animal, <ls>Pañcar.</ls> (<ab>accord.</ab> to <ls>L.</ls> ‘a camel’ or ‘an ass’)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=214066]</L>
शल <lex>m.</lex> or <lex type="hw">n.</lex> the quill of a porcupine, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=214076]</L>
शल <lex>m.</lex> a <ab>partic.</ab> measure of length (<ab>cf.</ab> त्रि-, पञ्चश्°. &c.)<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=214077]</L>
Dana[m]: धन <lex>n.</lex> the prize of a contest or the contest itself (<ab>lit.</ab> a running match, race, or the thing raced for; हितं धनम्, a proposed prize or contest; धनं-√ जि, to win the <ab n="prize">p°</ab> or the fight), <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=99258]</L>
booty, prey (धनम्-√ भृ <ab>Ā.</ab>, to carry off the prize or booty), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=99259]</L>
any valued object, (<ab>esp.</ab>) wealth, riches, (movable) property, money, treasure, gift, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=99260]</L>
capital (<ab>opp.</ab> to वृद्धि interest), <ls>Yājñ. ii, 58</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=99261]</L>
(<ab>arithm.</ab>) the affirmative quantity or plus (<ab>opp.</ab> to ऋण, क्षय, व्यय, हानि)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=99263]</L>
maYjana: मञ्जन <lex>m.</lex> the son of a <s1>Śūdra</s1> and a <s1>Vaṭi</s1>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=154427]</L>
Amana[m]: <hom>2.</hom> आ-मन <lex>n.</lex> friendly disposition, inclination, affection, <ls>TS. ii, 3, 9, 1</ls> and <ls n="TS. ii, 3, 9,">2</ls>; <ls>MaitrS.</ls><info lex="n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=25454]</L>
sfta: सृत <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>cf.</ab> सूर्त) going, running &c. (see भुजग-शिशु-सृत), <ls>Hariv.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=251843]</L>
(with बहिस्) one who has slipped or come out, <ls>Kathās.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=251845]</L>
KA: खा आ, <lex>f.</lex> a fountain, well, <ls>RV. ii, 28, 5</ls> (खाम् ऋतस्य, <ab>cf.</ab> <lang>Zend</lang> <etym>ashahe khāo</etym>) & <ls n="RV.">vi, 36, 4</ls><info lex="f"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=60690]</L>
खा <lex>mfn.</lex> digging (<ab>ifc.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> कूप-; बिस-खा), <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 2, 67.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=61298]</L>
prasara: प्र-सर प्र-सरण. See प्र-√ सृ.<info hui="a"/><L>[ID=137922]</L>

प्र-सर <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>) going forwards, advance, progress, free course, coming forth, rising, appearing, spreading, extension, diffusion, <ls>Kālid.</ls>; <ls>Kād.</ls>; <ls>Śaṃk.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f#A"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=138097]</L>
(in <ab>med.</ab>) morbid displacement of the humours of the body, <ls>Suśr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=138102]</L>
प्र-सर <lex>n.</lex> (in music) a kind of dance, <ls>Saṃgīt.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=138109]</L>
anarva: अन्-अर्व, <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> or अन्-अर्वन्, <lex>mfn.</lex> not to be limited, not to be obstructed, irresistible, <ls>RV.</ls><L>[ID=5239]</L>
aDi: अधि <lex>f.</lex> a woman in her courses (= अवि, <ab>q.v.</ab>), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="f"/>
<hom>2.</hom> अधि <lex>ind.</lex>, as a prefix to verbs and nouns, expresses above, over and above, besides. As a separable adverb or preposition<info lex="ind"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=4120]</L>
ASAm: <hom>1.</hom> आ-शा <lex>f.</lex> wish, desire, hope, expectation, prospect, <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>ChUp.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls> &c.<info lex="f"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=27384]</L>
Hope personified as the wife of a <s1>Vasu</s1>, <ls>Hariv.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=27385]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> आशा <lex>f.</lex> (√ <hom>1.</hom> अश्; for <hom>1.</hom> आशा See आ-√ शंस्), space, region, quarter of the heavens, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>TS.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Ragh.</ls> &c.<info lex="f"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=27436]</L>
vaca: वच <lex>n.</lex> the act of speaking, speech (see दुर्-व्°). <info lex="n"/>
dAsam: <ab>N.</ab> of certain evil beings conquered by <s1>Indra</s1> (<ab>e.g.</ab> <s1>Namuci</s1>, <s1>Pipru</s1>, <s1>Śambara</s1>, <s1>Varcin</s1> &c.), <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=91921]</L>
savage, barbarian, infidel (also दास, <ab>opp.</ab> to आर्य; <ab>cf.</ab> दस्यु)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=91922]</L>
one to whom gifts may be made, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=91925]</L>
दास <lex>mfn.</lex> <ab>ifc.</ab> of names, <ab>esp.</ab> of <s1>Śūdra</s1>s and <s1>Kāya-stha</s1>s (but <ab>cf.</ab> also कालि-)<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=91927]</L>
दास <lex>mf(ई)n.</lex> fiendish, demoniacal, barbarous, impious, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="m:f#I:n"/><L>[ID=91933]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> दास <lex>m.</lex> a knowing man, <ab>esp.</ab> a knower of the universal spirit, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=91996]</L>
BARa: भाण <lex>m.</lex> (√ भण्) recitation (<ab>esp.</ab> of the <ns>Buddhist</ns> law), <ls>MWB. 44</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=149782]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of a sort of dramatic entertainment (in which only one of the interlocutors appears on the scene, or a narrative of some intrigue told either by the hero or a third person), <ls>Daśar.</ls>; <ls>Sāh.</ls>; <ls>Pratāp.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>IW. 471</ls>). <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=149783]</L>
vajra[m]: वज्र <lex>m.</lex> <lex>n.</lex> ‘the hard or mighty one’, a thunderbolt (<ab>esp.</ab> that of <s1>Indra</s1>, said to have been formed out of the bones of the <s1>Ṛṣi</s1> <s1>Dadhīca</s1> or <s1>Dadhīci</s1> [<ab>q.v.</ab>], and shaped like a circular discus, or in later times regarded as having the form of two transverse bolts crossing each other thus x; sometimes also applied to similar weapons used by various gods or superhuman beings, or to any mythical weapon destructive of spells or charms, also to मन्यु, ‘wrath’, <ls>RV.</ls> or [with अपाम्] to a jet of water, <ls>AV.</ls> &c. &c.; also applied to a thunderbolt in general or to the lightning evolved from the centrifugal energy of the circular <ab n="thunderbolt">th°</ab> of <s1>Indra</s1> when launched at a foe; in Northern <ns>Buddhist</ns> countries it is shaped like a dumb-bell and called Dorje; see <ls>MWB. 201</ls>; <ls n="MWB.">322</ls> &c.), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. <info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=184795]</L>
a diamond (thought to be as hard as the <ab n="thunderbolt">th°</ab> or of the same substance with it), <ls>ṢaḍvBr.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184796]</L>
a kind of penance (feeding for a month on only barley prepared with cow's urine), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184798]</L>
वज्र <lex>m.</lex> a form of military array, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c. (<ab>cf.</ab> -व्यूह)<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=184800]</L>
a kind of column or pillar, <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184801]</L>
a <ab>partic.</ab> form of the moon, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184802]</L>
a kind of hard mortar or cement (कल्क), <ls>VarBṛS.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> -लेप)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184804]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of the 15th of the 27 <s1>Yoga</s1>s or astronomical divisions of time, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184805]</L>
वज्र <lex>n.</lex> denunciation in strong language (compared to thunder), <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Sāh.</ls>; <ls>Pratāp.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> वाक्य- and वाग्-व्°)<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=184823]</L>
a kind of hard iron or steel, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184824]</L>
a <ab>partic.</ab> posture in sitting, <ls>Cat.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> वज्रा<स्र्स्>सन)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184825]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of a <ab>partic.</ab> configurations of the planets and stars (in which favourable planets are situated in the 1st and 7th houses and unfavourable in the 4th and 10th), <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184826]</L>
the blossom of the <bot>sesamum</bot> or of any plant called <s1>Vajra</s1>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184828]</L>
shaped like a kind of cross (<ab>cf.</ab> above), forked, zigzag, <ls>ib.</ls> <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=184832]</L>
tAtam: तात <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>cf.</ab> <hom>1.</hom> तत) a father, <ls>MBh. i</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Vikr.</ls>; <ls>Śak. iv, 4/5</ls> (in <ab>comp.</ab>) &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=83763]</L>

(तात) <ab>voc.</ab> a term of affection addressed to a junior [<ls>ŚBr. xiv</ls>; <ls>AitBr. vii</ls>; <ls>ChUp.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.] or senior [<ls n="MBh.">i, 6796</ls>; <ls>Ragh.</ls> &c.], addressed to several persons, <ls>MBh. i, 6825</ls>; <pb n="442,1"/><ls n="MBh.">v, 5435</ls> (<ab>C</ab>); in the latter use also <ab>voc.</ab> <ab>pl.</ab> <ls>ib.</ls> (<ab>B</ab>); <ls n="MBh.">i, 6820 f.</ls>; <ls n="MBh.">iv, 133</ls>; <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=83764]</L>
rahasa: रहस See अनु-, अव-, and तप्त-र्°.<L>[ID=175946]</L>
talva: तल्व <lex>n.</lex> scent arising from the rubbing of fragrant substances, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=83603]</L>
lava: लव <lex>m.</lex> (√ <hom>1.</hom> लू) the act of cutting, reaping (of corn), mowing, plucking or gathering (of flowers &c.), <s1>Das</s1>, <ls>Nalod.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=181832]</L>
that which is cut or shorn off, a shorn fleece, wool, hair, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Ragh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=181833]</L>

anything cut off, a section, fragment, piece, particle, bit, little piece (अम् <lex type="phw">ind.</lex> a little; लवम् अपि, even a little), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c. (<ab>cf.</ab> पदाति-ल्°)<info phwchild="181847.1"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=181834]</L>

a minute division of time, the 60th of a twinkling, half a second, a moment (<ab>accord.</ab> to others 1/4000 or 1/5400 or 1/20250 of a <s1>Muhūrta</s1>), <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=181835]</L>
(in <ab>alg.</ab>) the numerator of a fraction, <ls>Col.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=181837]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of a son of <s1>Rāmacandra</s1> and <s1>Sītā</s1> (he and his twin-brother <s1>Kuśa</s1> were brought up by the sage <s1>Vālmīki</s1> and taught by him to repeat his <s1>Rāmāyaṇa</s1> at assemblies; <ab>cf.</ab> कुशी-लव), <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Ragh.</ls>; <ls>Uttarar.</ls>; <ls>Pur.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=181842]</L>
of a king of <s1>Kaśmīra</s1> (father of <s1>Kuśa</s1>), <ls>Rājat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=181843]</L>
daSAm: दशा (आस्) <lex>f. <ab>pl.</ab></lex> ‘Decads’, <ab>N.</ab> of 10 <ns>Jain</ns> texts (उपा<स्र्स्>सक-. &c.) consisting of 10 <ab>chs.</ab> each.<info lex="f"/><info hui="a"/>

दशा <lex>f.</lex> (√ दंश्?) the fringe of a garment, loose ends of any piece of cloth, skirt or hem, <ls>KātyŚr. iv, 1, 17</ls> (ऊर्णा), <ls>Lāṭy. viii, 6, 22</ls>; <ls>Kauś.</ls>; <ls>ŚāṅkhGṛ. ii, 12, 5</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls> &c.<info lex="f"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=91094]</L>
a wick, <ls>Gobh. iv, 2, 32</ls> (क्षौम-), <ls>Kum. iv, 30</ls>; <ls>Bhartṛ. iii</ls>, <ls n="Bhartṛ.">i</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=91095]</L>
state or condition of life, period of life (youth, manhood, &c.), condition, circumstances, <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls>; <ls>Megh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=91096]</L>
the fate of men as depending on the position of the planets, aspect or position of the planets (at birth &c.), <ls>VarBṛS.</ls>; <ls>VarBṛ.</ls>; <ls>Laghuj.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=91097]</L>
maya[m]: <hom>1.</hom> मय <lex>m.</lex> (√ <hom>3.</hom> मा) <ab>N.</ab> of an <s1>Asura</s1> (the artificer or architect of the <s1>Daitya</s1>s, also versed in magic, astronomy and military science), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=157985]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of various teachers and authors (<ab>esp.</ab> of an astronomer and a poet), <ls>Cat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=157986]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> मय <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>prob.</ab> <ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>2.</hom> मा) a horse, <ls>VS.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=158000]</L>
<hom>3.</hom> मय <lex>m.</lex> (√ <hom>1.</hom> मी) hurting, injuring, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=158004]</L>
ASasana: आ-शसन <lex>n.</lex> (√ शस्), cutting up (a killed animal), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=27435]</L>
mAnasI: मानसी (ई), <lex>f.</lex> (with पूज) mental or spiritual devotion (<ab>opp.</ab> to मूर्ति-प्°, adoration of images), <ls>RTL. 524</ls><info lex="f"/><L>[ID=162935]</L>
daDa: दध <lex>mfn.</lex>, <ls n="Pāṇ.">iii, 1, 139</ls> ‘giving’, see इडा-, इला-.<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=89900]</L>
pASa: पाश <lex>m.</lex> (once <lex type="hwalt">n.</lex> <ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>; <ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>3.</hom> पश्) a snare, trap, noose, tie, bond, cord, chain, fetter (<ab>lit.</ab> and <ab>fig.</ab>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><listinfo n="sup"/><L>[ID=123319]</L>
(<ab>esp.</ab>) the noose as attribute of <s1>Śiva</s1> or <s1>Yama</s1>, <ls>RTL. 81</ls>; <ls n="RTL.">290</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=123320]</L>
(with <s1>Jaina</s1>s) anything that binds or fetters the soul <ab>i.e.</ab> the outer world, nature, <ls>Sarvad.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> also, <ls>RTL. 89</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=123321]</L>
selvage, edge, border (of anything woven), <ls>ŚrGṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=123322]</L>

(<ab>ifc.</ab> it expresses either contempt, <ab>e.g.</ab> छत्त्र-प्°, ‘a shabby umbrella’, or admiration, <ab>e.g.</ab> कर्ण-प्°, ‘a beautiful ear’; after a word signifying, ‘hair’ abundance, quantity, <ab>e.g.</ab> केश-प्°, ‘a mass of hair’)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=123325]</L>
tajja: तज्—ज <lex>mfn.</lex> sprung from (that <ab>i.e.</ab> from) <lang>Sanskṛt</lang> (as <lang>Prākṛt</lang> or other words), <ls>Vāgbh. ii, 2</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=81968]</L>
paRam: पण <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>) play, gaming, playing for a stake, a bet or a wager (with <ab>gen.</ab>; <ab>loc.</ab> or <ab>ifc.</ab>; पणं-√ कृ, to make a bet; पणे नि-√ अस्, to stake at play), <ls>Yājñ.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f#A"/><L>[ID=114551]</L>
a compact, stipulation, agreement, treaty, <ls>Kathās.</ls>; <ls>Vet.</ls>; <ls>Hit.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=114552]</L>
the thing staked or the sum played for, wages, hire, reward, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Mṛcch.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=114553]</L>
a weight of copper used as a coin (= 20 <s1>Māṣa</s1>s = 4 <s1>Kākinī</s1>s), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=114554]</L>
a house, dwelling (गृह <ab>w.r.</ab> for ग्लह?), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=114561]</L>
vamam: वम <lex>mf(ई)n.</lex> vomiting, ejecting, giving out, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="m:f#I:n"/><L>[ID=186418]</L>
IriRam: ईरिण <lex>n.</lex> salt and barren soil (see इरिण), <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=29781]</L>
asya: <hom>1.</hom> अ the first letter of the alphabet<info hui="1"/><L>[ID=1]</L>
the first short vowel inherent in consonants.
<hom>2.</hom> अ (प्रगृह्य, <ab>q.v.</ab>), a vocative particle [अ अनन्त, O <s1>Viṣṇu</s1>], <ls>T.</ls><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=3]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> अ (before a vowel अन्, <ab>exc.</ab> अ-ऋणिन्), a prefix corresponding to <lang>Gk.</lang> <gk>ἀ</gk>, <gk>ἀν</gk>, <lang>Lat.</lang> <etym>in</etym>, <lang>Goth.</lang> and <lang>Germ.</lang> <etym>un</etym>, <lang>Eng.</lang> <etym>in</etym> or <etym>un</etym>, and having a negative or privative or contrary sense (अन्-एक not one; अन्-अन्त endless; अ-सत् not good; अ-पश्यत् not seeing)<info hui="3"/><L>[ID=4]</L>

rarely prefixed to <ab>Inf.</ab> (अ-स्वप्तुम् not to sleep, <ls>TāṇḍyaBr.</ls>) and even to forms of the finite verb (अ-स्पृहयन्ति they do not desire, <ls>BhP.</ls>; <ls>Śiś.</ls>) and to pronouns (अ-सः not he, <ls>Śiś.</ls>; अ-तद् not that, <ls>BhP.</ls>)

rarely an expletive (<ab>cf.</ab> अ-कुप्य, अ-पूप). According to <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 2, 161</ls>, the accent may be optionally either on the first or last syllable in certain compounds formed with अ (as अ-तीक्ष्ण or अ-तीक्ष्ण, अ-शुचि or अ-शुचि, अन्-अन्न or अन्-अन्न)
the same applies to stems ending in तृ accentuated on the first syllable before अ is prefixed
<ab>cf.</ab> also अ-तूर्त and अ-तूर्त, अ-भिन्न and अ-भिन्न, &c.
<hom>4.</hom> अ the base of some pronouns and <ab>pronom.</ab> forms, in अस्य, अत्र, &c.<info lexcat="LEXID=pron,STEM=idam"/><info hui="4"/><L>[ID=5]</L>

<hom>5.</hom> अ the augment prefixed to the root in the formation of the imperfect, aorist, and conditional tenses (in the <s1>Veda</s1> often wanting, as in Homer, the fact being that originally the augment was only prefixed in principal sentences where it was accentuated, whilst it was dropped in subordinate sentences where the root-vowel took the accent).<info hui="5"/><L>[ID=6]</L>
<hom>6.</hom> अ <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of <s1>Viṣṇu</s1>, <ls>L.</ls> (especially as the first of the three sounds in the sacred syllable ओम्). <info lex="m"/><info hui="6"/><L>[ID=7]</L>
aTA: अथ or अथा (or <lang>Ved.</lang> अथा), <lex>ind.</lex> (probably <ab>fr.</ab> <ab>pronom.</ab> base अ) an auspicious and inceptive particle (not easily expressed in <lang>English</lang>), <div n="P"/> now; then; moreover; rather; certainly; but; else; what? how else? &c. <info lex="ind"/>
manam: <hom>1.</hom> मन <lex>m.</lex> Indian spikenard, <bot>Nardostachys Jatamansi</bot>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=156712]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a son of <s1>Śambara</s1>, <ls>Hariv.</ls> (<ab>v.l.</ab> मत). <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=156713]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> मन <lex>m. <ab>du.</ab></lex> (for <hom>1.</hom> and <hom>2.</hom> See <pcol>p. 783, col. 2</pcol>) a <ab>partic.</ab> ornament, <ls>RV. viii, 78, 2.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=157519]</L>
rAm: रा (आ), <lex>f.</lex> (only <ls>L.</ls>) amorous play (= विभ्रम)<info lex="f"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=173021]</L>

<hom>1.</hom> रा or रास् <ab>cl.</ab> 2. <ab>P.</ab> (<ls>Dhātup. xxiv, 49</ls>) राति (<lang>Ved.</lang> also <ab>Ā.</ab> राते; <ab>Impv.</ab> रिरीहि, ररास्व, ररीध्वम्; <ab>p.</ab> रराण; 3. <ab>sg.</ab> ररते and रासते; <ab>pf.</ab> ररिम, ररे; <ab>aor.</ab> अरास्म <ab>Subj.</ab> रासत् &c. <ab>Pot.</ab> रासीय; <lang>Class.</lang> forms are only <ab>pr.</ab> राति; <ab>fut.</ab> राता, <ls>BhP.</ls>; रास्यति, <ls>Vop.</ls>, and <ab>inf.</ab> रा<स्र्स्>तवे, <ls>BhP.</ls>), to grant, give, bestow, impart, yield, surrender, <ls>RV.</ls>; &c.<info westergaard="rA,24.49,02.0060"/><info whitneyroots="rA1,138"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="2P,2Ā"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=176008]</L>
kaMsa: कंस अस्, अम्, <lex>m.</lex> <lex>n.</lex> (√ कम्, <ls>Uṇ. iii, 62</ls>), a vessel made of metal, drinking vessel, cup, goblet, <ls>AV. x, 10, 5</ls>; <ls>AitBr.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=41370]</L>
(a noun ending in अस् followed by कंस in a compound does not change its final, <ab>cf.</ab> अयस्-कंस, &c., <ls>Pāṇ. viii, 3, 46</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=41371]</L>
a particular measure (= two <s1>Āḍhaka</s1>s, <ls>Car.</ls>; = one <s1>Āḍhaka</s1>, <ls>L.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=41372]</L>
a metal, tutanag or white copper, brass, bell-metal<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=41373]</L>

कंस (अस्), <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of a king of <s1>Mathurā</s1> (son of <s1>Ugra-sena</s1> and cousin of the <s1>Devakī</s1> who was mother of <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1> [<s1>Ugra-sena</s1> being brother of <s1>Devaka</s1>, who was father of <s1>Devakī</s1>]; he is usually called the uncle, but was really a cousin of <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1>, and became his implacable enemy because it had been prophesied to <s1>Kaṃsa</s1> that he would be killed by a child of <s1>Devakī</s1>; as the foe of the deity he is identified with the <s1>Asura</s1> <s1>Kālanemi</s1>; and, as he was ultimately slain by <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1>, the latter receives epithets like कंस-जित्, conqueror of <s1>Kaṃsa</s1>, &c.), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>VP.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=41374]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a place <ab>g.</ab> तक्षशिला<स्र्स्>दि, <ls>Pāṇ. iv, 3, 93</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=41375]</L>
mAntra: मान्त्र <lex>mf(ई)n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> मन्त्र) proper or peculiar to Vedic or magical texts, <ls>MW.</ls><info lex="m:f#I:n"/><L>[ID=163009]</L>
mAsa: मास <lex>m.</lex> (or <lex type="hwalt">n.</lex>, <ls>Siddh.</ls>) the moon (see पूर्ण-म्°)<info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=163896]</L>

a month or the 12th part of the <ns>Hindū</ns> year (there are 4 kinds of months, <ab>viz.</ab> the solar, सौर; the natural, सावन; the stellar, नाक्षत्र, and the lunar, चा<स्र्स्>न्द्र; the latter, which is the most usual and consists of 30 <s1>Tithi</s1>s, being itself of two kinds as reckoned from the new or full moon, <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>IW. 179</ls>; for the names of the months see <ls>ib.</ls> <ls n="IW.">173 n. 3</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (मासम्, for a month; मासम् एकम्, for one month; मासेन, in the course of a month; मासे, in a <ab n="month">m°</ab> = after the lapse of a <ab n="month">m°</ab>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=163897]</L>
a symbolical <ab>N.</ab> for the number ‘twelve’, <ls>Sūryas.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=163898]</L>
laM: 1. ल the 3rd semivowel (corresponding to the vowels ऌ, ॡ, and having the sound of the English l) [ID=180308]

a technical term for all the tenses and moods of a finite verb or for the terminations of those tenses and moods (also applied to some forms with कृत् affixes construed like a finite verb, <ls>Pāṇ. ii, 3, 69</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls n="Pāṇ.">iii, 2, 124</ls>, and when accompanied by certain indicatory letters denoting each tense separately See लट्; लङ्; लिङ्; लोट्; लिट्; लुट्; ऌट्; लुङ्; ऌङ्; लेट्), <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 4, 69</ls>; <ls n="Pāṇ. iii, 4">77</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>
<hom>3.</hom> ल (in prosody) = लघु, a short syllable.<info hui="3"/><L>[ID=180315]</L>
sadasya: सदस्य^ <lex>m.</lex> ‘present in the sacrificial enclosure’, an assessor, spectator, member of an assembly (at a sacrifice), a superintending priest, the seventeenth priest (whose duties <ab>accord.</ab> to the <s1>Kuṣītakin</s1>s, are merely to look on and correct mistakes), <ls>TS.</ls>; <ls>Br.</ls>; <ls>GṛŚrS.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=230576]</L>
a person belonging to a learned court-circle, <ls>Jātakam.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=230577]</L>
Anata: आ-नत &c. See under आ-√ नम् next page.<info hui="a"/><L>[ID=24340]</L>
आ-नत <lex>mfn.</lex> bending, stooping, bowed, <ls>Ragh.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=24453]</L>
bent or curved inwards (as a bow), <ls>ŚBr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=24455]</L>
Daram: धर <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (√ धृ) bearing, supporting (<ab>scil.</ab> the world, said of <s1>Kṛṣṇa</s1> and <s1>Śiva</s1>), <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=99748]</L>

<ab>ifc.</ab> holding, bearing, carrying, wearing, possessing, having, keeping (also in memory), sustaining, preserving, observing (<ab>cf.</ab> अंशु-, अक्ष-, कुलं- &c.), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=99749]</L>
धर <lex>m.</lex> a mountain, <ls>Kir. xv, 12</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> क्षिति-, भू- &c.)<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=99750]</L>
a frivolous or dissolute man (= विट), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=99752]</L>
of a follower of the <s1>Pāṇḍava</s1>s, <ls>ib.</ls> of the king of the tortoises, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=99755]</L>
of the father of <s1>Padma-prabha</s1> (6th <s1>Arhat</s1> of <ab>pres.</ab> <s1>Ava-sarpiṇī</s1>), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=99756]</L>

rAta: रात <lex>mfn.</lex> given, presented, bestowed, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (often <ab>ifc.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> अस्मद्-, देव-, ब्रह्म-र्°. &c.)<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=176039]</L>
vARija: वाणिज <lex>m.</lex> (also written बाणिज; <ab>fr.</ab> वणिज्) a merchant, trader, <ls>TBr.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 2, 13</ls>) the submarine fire (supposed to be at the south-pole), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=190594]</L>

aSma[n]: <hom>1.</hom> अश्मन् <lex>m.</lex> an eater, <ls>AV. xviii, 4, 54.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=19705]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> अश्मन् <lex>m.</lex> (once अश्मन्, <ls>ŚBr. iii</ls>), a stone, rock, <ls>RV.</ls> &c.<info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=19713]</L>

stirring or whirling round, churning or producing by churning, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>Pur.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155196]</L>

Cinna: छिन्न <lex>mfn.</lex> cut off, cut, divided, torn, cut through, perforated, <ls>AV.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=75969]</L>
interrupted, not contiguous, <ls>Bhag. vi, 36</ls>; <ls>R. iii, 50, 12</ls>; <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=75971]</L>
disturbed (किं नश् छिन्नम्, ‘what is there in this to disturb us?’ there is nothing to care about, <ls>Amar.</ls>), <ls>Hariv. 16258</ls>; <ls>Mṛcch.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=75972]</L>
? (said of the belly of a leach), <ls>Suśr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=75973]</L>
taken away or out of <ls>R. ii, 56, 23</ls>; <ls>Ragh. xii, 80</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=75975]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of a class of deities associated with <s1>Aṅgiras</s1> and <s1>Ṛkvan</s1> [<ls>Gmn.</ls>; a class of manes], <ls>RV. x, 14, 3</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=46612]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of one of the seven sages of the fourth <s1>Manv-antara</s1>, <ls>Hariv.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=46613]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> कव्य <ab>Nom.</ab> <ab>P.</ab> कव्यति, to be wise, <ls>Pāṇ. vii, 4, 39.</ls><info verb="nom" cp="P"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=46625]</L>

<hom>1.</hom> रास् (<ab>cf.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> रस्) <ab>cl.</ab> 1. <ab>Ā.</ab> (<ls>Dhātup. xvi, 25</ls>) रासते (<ab>pf.</ab> ररासे, <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ab>fut.</ab> रासिता, रासिष्यते <ab>Gr.</ab>; <ab>aor.</ab> अरासिष्ट, <ls>ib.</ls>), <div n="to"/>to howl, cry, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls> &c.: <div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab> रारास्यते, to cry aloud, utter loud lamentations (only <ab>p.</ab> रारास्यमान; <ab>B.</ab> वावाश्यमान), <ls>MBh.</ls><info westergaard="rAsf,16.25,01.0404"/><info whitneyroots="rAs1,139"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="1Ā"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=177844]</L>

(in <ab>astron.</ab>, read, ‘the difference of time between the rising of a heavenly body at <s1>Laṅkā</s1> or Ceylon, over which the first meridian passes, and that of its rising at any <ab>partic.</ab> place’).<info n="sup"/><info lex="inh"/>

of perfect or correct flavour, palatable, dainty, <ls>ĀśvGṛ.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=236023]</L>

सम्-पन्न (अम्), <lex>n.</lex> dainty food, a delicacy, <ls>MBh. xiii, 4567</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=236027]</L>
fta: ऋत <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> met with, afflicted by (with <ab>instr.</ab>), <ls>TS. v</ls><info lex="m:f#A:n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=38412]</L>
proper, right, fit, apt, suitable, able, brave, honest, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>VS. xvii, 82</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=38413]</L>
of a son of <s1>Manu</s1> <s1>Cākṣuṣa</s1>, <ls>BhP. iv, 13, 16</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=38418]</L>
ऋत (अम्), <lex>n.</lex> fixed or settled order, law, rule (<ab>esp.</ab> in religion)<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=38420]</L>

sacred or pious action or custom, divine law, faith, divine truth (these meanings are given by, <ls>BRD.</ls> and are generally more to be accepted than those of native authorities and marked, <ls>L.</ls> below), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=38421]</L>
truth in general, righteousness, right, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Mn. viii, 61</ls>; <ls n="Mn. viii,">104</ls>; <ls>Pañcat.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=38422]</L>
figuratively said of gleaning (as the right means of a <ns>Brāhman</ns>'s obtaining a livelihood as opposed to agriculture, which is अनृत), <ls>Mn. iv, 4 ff.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=38423]</L>
truth personified (as an object of worship, and hence enumerated among the sacred objects in the <ls>Nir.</ls>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=38425]</L>
ऋत ऋति, ऋतु See <pcol>p. 223, col. 2</pcol> — <pcol>p. 224, col. 1</pcol>.<info hui="b"/><L>[ID=38920]</L>
vAnam: <hom>1.</hom> वान <lex>mfn.</lex> (for <hom>2.</hom> See <ab>p.</ab> 940) blown &c. (<ab>cf.</ab> निर्-वाण)<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=189744]</L>
the rolling of water or of the tide (<ab>esp.</ab> the high wave in Indian rivers, commonly called ‘the Bore’), <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=189749]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> वान <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ वै; for <hom>1.</hom> See <pcol>p. 935, col. 3</pcol>) dried &c.<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=190821]</L>
वान <lex>n.</lex> dry or dried fruit, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=190822]</L>
a kind of bamboo manna, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190823]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> वान <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ वे) the act of weaving or sewing, <ls>Nyāyam.</ls>; <ls>Sāy.</ls> (reckoned among the 64 <s1>Kalā</s1>s)<info lex="n"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=190824]</L>
<hom>4.</hom> वान <lex>m.</lex> or <lex type="hw">n.</lex> (?) a hole in the wall of a house, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m:n"/><info hui="4"/><L>[ID=190828]</L>
<hom>5.</hom> वान <lex>m.</lex> an intelligent man, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="5"/><L>[ID=190829]</L>

<hom>6.</hom> वान <lex>mf(ई)n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> <hom>1.</hom> वन, <ab>p.</ab> 917) relating to a wood or to a dwelling in a wood &c., <ls>W.</ls><info lex="m:f#I:n"/><info hui="6"/><L>[ID=190831]</L>
a multitude of woods or groves or thickets, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=190833]</L>
वान <lex>mfn.</lex> dried &c. (see <hom>2.</hom> वान, <pcol>p. 940, col. 2</pcol>). <info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=206546]</L>
jazam: जष <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of an aquatic animal (<ab>cf.</ab> झष), <ls>AV. xi, 2, 25</ls>; <ls>TS. v, 5</ls>; <ls>GopBr. ii, 2, 5.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=78361]</L>
mIra: मीर <lex>m.</lex> the sea, ocean, <ls>Uṇ. ii, 25</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab> (<ls>L.</ls> also ‘a <ab>partic.</ab> part of a mountain; a limit, boundary; a drink, beverage’). <info lex="m"/><L>[ID=164713]</L>
raTya: रथ्य <lex>mfn.</lex> (or रथ्य^) belonging or relating to a carriage or chariot, accustomed to it &c. (with आजि, ‘a chariot-race’), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=174773]</L>
(?) delighting in roads (see <lex type="hwinfo">f.</lex> and रथ्य-विरथ्य)<info lex="inh"/>
रथ्य <lex>m.</lex> a carriage or chariot-horse, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls><info lex="m"/>
रथ्य <lex>n.</lex> carriage equipments (trappings, a wheel &c.), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>Lāṭy.</ls><info lex="n"/>
matavacas: मत—वचस् <lex>mfn.</lex> heeding words or prayers (said of the <s1>Aśvin</s1>s), <ls>RV.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> मातवचस). <info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=156646]</L>
dAhana: दाहन <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> the <ab>Caus.</ab>) causing to burn or be burnt, reducing to ashes, <ls>MBh. i, 403</ls>; <ls>BhP. xii, 12, 40</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=92024]</L>
tAmra: ताम्र <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (√ तम्, <ls>Uṇ.</ls>) of a coppery red colour, <ls>VS. xvi</ls> (<ls>Naigh. iii, 7</ls>), <ls>MBh.</ls> &c. (ताम्रा त्वच्, the 4th of the 7 membranes with which an embryo is covered, <ls>Suśr. iii, 4, 2</ls>)<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><L>[ID=84058]</L>
ताम्र <lex>mf(ई)n.</lex> made of copper, <ls>R. iii, 21, 17</ls>; <ls>Suśr.</ls>; <ls>Mn. vi, 53/54</ls>; <ls>BhavP.</ls><info lex="m:f#I:n"/><L>[ID=84059]</L>
ताम्र <lex>m.</lex> a kind of leprosy with large red spots, <ls>Karmavip.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=84060]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a son of <s1>Naraka</s1> <s1>Bhauma</s1>, <ls>BhP. x, 59, 12</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=84061]</L>
sava: <hom>1.</hom> सव <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>3.</hom> सु) pressing out the juice of the <s1>Soma</s1> plant, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>ŚāṅkhŚr.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=239424]</L>
सव <lex>n.</lex> the juice or honey of flowers, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=239427]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> सव <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> सू) one who sets in motion or impels, an instigator, stimulator, commander, <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=239461]</L>

setting in motion, vivification, instigation, impulse, command, order (<ab>esp.</ab> applied to the activity of <s1>Savitṛ</s1>; <ab>dat.</ab> सवाय, ‘for setting in motion’), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>TBr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=239463]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of <ab>partic.</ab> initiatory rites, inauguration, consecration, <ls>Br.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=239464]</L>
<hom>3.</hom> सव <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>2.</hom> सू) offspring, progeny, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=239491]</L>
Aharam: <hom>2.</hom> आ-हर (2. <ab>sg.</ab> <ab>Impv.</ab> forming irregular <s1>Tatpuruṣa</s1> compounds with the following words) :<info hui="2"/><L>[ID=28384]</L>
ut: उत् <lex>ind.</lex> a particle of doubt or deliberation (= <hom>2.</hom> उत, <ab>q.v.</ab>), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="ind"/><L>[ID=30687]</L>
sAman: <hom>1.</hom> सामन् <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> सा = <hom>1.</hom> सन्) acquisition, possession, property, wealth, abundance, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls><info lex="n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=242214]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> सामन् <lex>n.</lex> (<lex type="hwalt">m.</lex> only in <ls>TBr.</ls>; <ab>prob.</ab> connected with √ सान्त्व्; <ab>accord.</ab> to some <ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> सा; <ab>cf.</ab> <hom>3.</hom> सामन्) calming, tranquillizing, (<ab>esp.</ab>) kind or gentle words for winning an adversary, conciliation, negotiation (one of the 4 <s1>Upāya</s1>s or means of success against an enemy, the other 3 being दान, भेद, and दण्ड, <ab>qq.vv.</ab>; <ab>ibc.</ab> or <ab>instr.</ab> <ab>sg.</ab> and <ab>pl.</ab>, ‘by friendly means or in a friendly way, willingly, voluntarily’), <ls>TBr.</ls>; &c.<info lex="m:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=242216]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> सामन् <lex>n.</lex> (of doubtful derivation; <ab>accord.</ab> to <ls>Uṇ. iv, 152</ls> <ab>fr.</ab> √ सो = <hom>2.</hom> सा, as ‘destroying sin’; in <ls>Nir. vii, 12</ls> apparently connected with सम्मित; by others derived <ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> सन्, सा, सान्त्व्, and perhaps not to be separated <ab>fr.</ab> <hom>1.</hom> and <hom>2.</hom> सामन्) a metrical hymn or song of praise, (<ab>esp.</ab>) a <ab>partic.</ab> kind of sacred text or verse called a <s1>Sāman</s1> (intended to be chanted, and forming, with ऋच्, यजुस्, छन्दस्, one of the 4 kinds of Vedic composition mentioned first in <ls>RV. x, 90, 9</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="n"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=242234]</L>
any song or tune (sacred or profane, also the hum of bees), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=242235]</L>
the faculty of uttering sounds (?), <ls>TBr.</ls> (<ab>Sch.</ab>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=242236]</L>
Aravam: आरब or आरव, <lex>m.</lex> an Arabian (<lex>f(ई)</lex>.), <ls>Jain.</ls><info n="sup"/><info lex="m:f#I"/>
आ-रव <lex>m.</lex> (<ls>Pāṇ. iii, 3, 50</ls>) cry, crying, howling<info lex="m"/><info hui="c"/><L>[ID=26217]</L>
carI: चरी (ई), <lex>f.</lex> a young woman (<ab>cf.</ab> चरटि), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="f"/><L>[ID=72190]</L>
also <ab>ifc.</ab> See अनु- and सहचरी.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=72192]</L>
SAsaM: <hom>2.</hom> शास <lex>m.</lex> (for <hom>1.</hom> See <pcol>p. 1068, col. 3</pcol>) a butcher's knife, <ls>Br.</ls>; <ls>ŚrS.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=216470]</L>
udDana: उद्-धन <lex>m.</lex> (√ हन्) a wooden swordlike instrument for stirring boiled rice, <ls>L.</ls><info n="sup"/><info lex="m"/>
raDra: रध्र <lex>mfn.</lex> willing, pliant, obedient, <ls>RV.</ls> (others ‘weary’ or ‘wealthy’ or ‘a miser’ or ‘officious’ or ‘active’ &c.)<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=174815]</L>
Cinna[m]: छिन्न <lex>mfn.</lex> cut off, cut, divided, torn, cut through, perforated, <ls>AV.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=75969]</L>
interrupted, not contiguous, <ls>Bhag. vi, 36</ls>; <ls>R. iii, 50, 12</ls>; <ls>VarBṛS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=75971]</L>
disturbed (किं नश् छिन्नम्, ‘what is there in this to disturb us?’ there is nothing to care about, <ls>Amar.</ls>), <ls>Hariv. 16258</ls>; <ls>Mṛcch.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=75972]</L>
? (said of the belly of a leach), <ls>Suśr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=75973]</L>
taken away or out of <ls>R. ii, 56, 23</ls>; <ls>Ragh. xii, 80</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=75975]</L>
sarva: सर्व <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (perhaps connected with सार, <ab>q.v.</ab>; inflected as a pronoun except <ab>nom.</ab> <ab>acc.</ab> <ab>sg.</ab> <lex type="hwinfo">n.</lex> सर्वम्, and serving as a model for a series of pronominals, <ab>cf.</ab> सर्व-नामन्) whole, entire, all, every (<lex type="hwinfo">m.</lex> <ab>sg.</ab> ‘every one’; <ab>pl.</ab> ‘all’; <lex type="hwinfo">n.</lex> <ab>sg.</ab> ‘everything’; sometimes strengthened by विश्व [which if alone in <ls>RV.</ls> appears in the meaning ‘all’, ‘every’, ‘every one’] and निखिल; सर्वेऽपि, ‘all together’; सर्वः कोऽपि, ‘every one so ever’; गवां सर्वम्, ‘all that comes from cows’; सर्व with a negation = ‘not any’, ‘no’, ‘none’ or ‘not every one’, ‘not everything’), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lexcat="LEXID=pron,STEM=sarva"/><L>[ID=238107]</L>
of all sorts, manifold, various, different, <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=238108]</L>
(with another adjective or in <ab>comp.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> below) altogether, wholly, completely, in all parts, everywhere, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>ChUp.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=238109]</L>
kaSa: कश <lex>m.</lex> a species of rodent animal, <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>TS.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> कशीका)<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=46632]</L>
avatAna: अव-तान <lex>m.</lex> ‘unbending of a bow’, <ab>N.</ab> of the verses, <ls>VS. xiv, 54</ls>-<ls n="VS. xiv,">63</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=17314]</L>
a cover (spread over climbing plants), <ls>MBh. ii, 355</ls>; <ls>R. v, 16, 28</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=17315]</L>
mAnana: मानन <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> <ab>Caus.</ab>) honouring, serving as a token of respect, <ls>Nir.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=162797]</L>
मानन <lex>n.</lex> and <lex type="hw">f(आ). </lex> paying honour, showing respect, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="f#A:n"/><L>[ID=162798]</L>
sarA(m): सरा (आ), <lex>f.</lex> moving or wandering about, <ls>Gal.</ls><info lex="f"/><L>[ID=237447]</L>
sampanna[m]: सम्-पन्न <lex>mfn.</lex> fallen or turned out well, accomplished, effected, perfect, excellent (<ab>ifc.</ab> or with <ab>loc.</ab> = ‘perfectly acquainted or conversant with’), <ls>AV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=236022]</L>
of perfect or correct flavour, palatable, dainty, <ls>ĀśvGṛ.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=236023]</L>

endowed or furnished with, possessed of (<ab>instr.</ab> <ab>adv.</ab> in -तस्, or <ab>comp.</ab> also with transposition of the members; <ab>cf.</ab> below), <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=236024]</L>
सम्-पन्न (अम्), <lex>n.</lex> dainty food, a delicacy, <ls>MBh. xiii, 4567</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=236027]</L>
Ahita[m]: आ-हित <lex>mfn.</lex> placed on, placed, deposited, put on <ls>Pāṇ. viii, 4, 8</ls>; <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="a"/><listinfo n="sup"/><L>[ID=24147]</L>
added (as fuel to the fire)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=24148]</L>
आ-हित <lex>n.</lex> a <ab>partic.</ab> mode of fighting (<ab>v.l.</ab> अ-ह्°), <ls>Hariv.</ls><info n="sup"/><info lex="n"/>
आ-हित and आ-हिति. See आ-√ धा.<L>[ID=28336]</L>
vawa: वट <lex>m.</lex> (perhaps <lang>Prākṛt</lang> for वृत, ‘surrounded, covered’; <ab>cf.</ab> न्यग्-रोध) the <bot>Banyan</bot> or Indian fig tree (<bot>Ficus Indica</bot>), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c., <ls>RTL. 337</ls> (also said to be <lex type="hwalt">n.</lex>)<info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=185176]</L>
a small shell, the <bot>Cypraea Moneta</bot> or cowry, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=185178]</L>
the son of a <s1>Vaiśya</s1> and a <ns>Venukī</ns>, <ls>L.</ls> (also <lex type="hwalt">n.</lex> and <lex type="hwalt">f(ई). </lex>)<info lex="f#I:n"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=185184]</L>
a string, rope, tie, <ls>L.</ls> (only वट <ab>ibc.</ab>, and पञ्च-व्°, <ab>q.v.</ab>)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=185185]</L>
a small lump, globule &c. = वटक, <ls>ŚārṅgS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=185186]</L>
SAmana: शामन <lex>mfn.</lex> extinguishing, destroying, <ls>Pañcat. iii, 31</ls> (<ab>v.l.</ab> for शमन)<info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=215562]</L>
end (°नं-√ या, to go to an end, be destroyed), <ls>MW.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=215568]</L>
veDana: वेधन <lex>n.</lex> piercing, hitting (with an arrow), <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=206201]</L>
yata: यत <lex>mfn.</lex> restrained, held in, held forth, kept down or limited, subdued, governed, controlled &c., <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>comp.</ab> below)<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=170259]</L>
the spurring or guiding of an elephant by means of the rider's feet, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170261]</L>
mAnasam: मानस <lex>mf(ई, once आ)n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> मनस्) belonging to the mind or spirit, mental, spiritual (<ab>opp.</ab> to शारीर, corporeal), <ls>VS.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m:f#A:f#I:n"/><L>[ID=162924]</L>
expressed only in the mind, performed in thought <ab>i.e.</ab> silent, tacit (as a hymn or prayer), <ls>ŚrS.</ls>; <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=162925]</L>
conceived or present in the mind, conceivable, imaginable, <ls>R.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=162926]</L>
relating to or dwelling on the lake <s1>Mānasa</s1> (see <lex type="hwinfo">n.</lex> below), <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=162927]</L>
मानस <lex>m. <ab>pl.</ab></lex> a <ab>partic.</ab> class of deceased ancestors (regarded as sons of <s1>Vasiṣṭha</s1>), <ls>Cat.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=162931]</L>
of the worlds of the <s1>Soma-pa</s1>, <ls>Hariv.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=162934]</L>

मानस <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>) the mental powers, mind, spirit, heart, soul (= मनस्, <ab>g.</ab> प्रज्ञा<स्र्स्>दि), <ls>KaṭhUp.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="f#A:n"/><L>[ID=162938]</L>
मानस <lex>n.</lex> (in law) tacit or implied consent, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=162939]</L>
the 25th mansion from that under which one is born, <ls>VarYogay.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=162941]</L>

(with or <ab>scil.</ab> सरस्, or तीर्थ) <ab>N.</ab> of a sacred lake and place of pilgrimage on mount <s1>Kailāsa</s1> (the native place of the wild geese, which migrate to it every year at the breeding season), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls>; <ls>Pur.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=162942]</L>
jani: जनि, °नी, <lex>f.</lex> a woman, wife (<ab>gen.</ab> °न्युर्, <ls>RV. x, 10, 3</ls>), <ls>RV.</ls> (<ab>pl.</ab> also <ab>fig.</ab> ‘the fingers’), <ls>VS.</ls><info lex="f"/><L>[ID=76922]</L>
a kind of fragrant plant, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=76924]</L>
ahi: the serpent of the sky, the demon <s1>Vṛtra</s1>, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=21801]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a <s1>Ṛṣi</s1> (with the <ab>patron.</ab> औशनस) and of another (with the <ab>patron.</ab> पैद्व). <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=21811]</L>
manman: मन्मन् <lex>n.</lex> thought, understanding, intellect, wisdom, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=157484]</L>

<hom>3.</hom> अनु <lex>ind.</lex> (as a prefix to verbs and nouns, expresses) after, along, alongside, lengthwise, near to, under, subordinate to, with. (When prefixed to nouns, especially in adverbial compounds), according to, severally, each by each, orderly, methodically, one after another, repeatedly. (As a separable preposition, with accusative) after, along, over, near to, through, to, towards, at, according to, in order, agreeably to, in regard to, inferior to, <ls>Pāṇ. i, 4, 86.</ls> (As a separable adverb) after, afterwards, thereupon, again, further, then, next.<info lex="ind"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=6056]</L>

any very large number (in <ab>comp.</ab> as शत-पत्त्र &c. below). <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=211814]</L>

Danva: धन्व <lex>n.</lex> = धन्वन् (<ls>Uṇ. iv, 95</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>; <ab>esp.</ab> at the beginning and at the end of <ab>comp.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> इषु-, तिसृ-, प्रिय-.; also <lex type="hwalt">f(आ). </lex> in धन्वाभिस्, <ls>Hariv. 7315</ls> <ab>v.l.</ab> °वीभिस्)<info lex="f#A:n"/><L>[ID=99641]</L>
धन्व <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of a man, <ls>Rājat. v, 51</ls>; <ls n="Rājat. v,">56.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=99642]</L>
nat: नत् <lex>mfn.</lex> (√ नम्) bowing, bowing one's self (<ab>ifc.</ab>), <ls>MW.</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><L>[ID=103263]</L>
sAva: साव <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>3.</hom> सु) a <s1>Soma</s1> libation (<ab>cf.</ab> प्रातः- and सहस्र-स्°), <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=243355]</L>
aka: <hom>2.</hom> अ-क <lex>n.</lex> unhappiness, pain, trouble, <ls>TS.</ls><info lex="n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=136]</L>
yajas: यजस् <lex>n.</lex> worship, sacrifice, <ls>RV. viii, 40, 4</ls> (= याग, <ls>Sāy.</ls>)<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=169159]</L>
rasaya: <hom>1.</hom> रस् (<ab>cf.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> रास्) <ab>cl.</ab> 1. <ab>P.</ab> (<ls>Dhātup. xvii, 63</ls>) रसति (rarely <ab>Ā.</ab> °ते; <ab>pf.</ab> ररास, रेसुः, <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.; <ab>aor.</ab> अरासीत् or अरसीत् <ab>Gr.</ab>; <ab>fut.</ab> रसिता, रसिष्यति, <ls>ib.</ls>; <ab>inf.</ab> रसितुम्, <ls>ib.</ls>), <div n="to"/>to roar, yell, cry, sound, reverberate, <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c. &c.; <div n="to"/>to praise, <ls>Naigh. iii, 14</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> रासयति (<ab>aor.</ab> अरीरसत्), <ab>Gr.</ab>: <div n="vp"/><ab>Desid.</ab> रिरसिषति, <ls>ib.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab> रारस्यते (or रारस्ति, <ab>Gr.</ab>), to cry out loudly, scream aloud, <ls>Bhaṭṭ.</ls><info westergaard="rasa,17.63,01.0457"/><info whitneyroots="ras,137"/><info verb="genuineroot" cp="1P,1Ā"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=175478]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> रस् (rather <ab>Nom.</ab> <ab>fr.</ab> रस below) <ab>cl.</ab> 10. <ab>P.</ab> (<ls>Dhātup. xxxv, 77</ls>) रसयति (rarely <ab>Ā.</ab> °ते <lang>ep.</lang> also रसति and रस्यति), to taste, relish, <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>Up.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to feel, perceive, be sensible of <ls>Sāh.</ls>; <div n="to"/>to love, <ls>Dhātup.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Desid.</ab> रिरसयिषति, to desire to taste, <ls>Śiś.</ls><info verb="genuineroot" cp="10P,10Ā"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=175485]</L>
yata[m]: यत <lex>mfn.</lex> restrained, held in, held forth, kept down or limited, subdued, governed, controlled &c., <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>comp.</ab> below)<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=170259]</L>
the spurring or guiding of an elephant by means of the rider's feet, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170261]</L>
dAda: दाद <lex>m.</lex> (√ दद्) gift, donation, <ls>MBh. ix, 2117</ls>; <ls n="MBh. ix,">2269</ls> (<ab>B.</ab> दाय), <ls>Śiś. xix, 114.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=91238]</L>
nava[m]: <hom>1.</hom> नव <lex>mf(आ)n.</lex> (<ab>prob.</ab> <ab>fr.</ab> <hom>1.</hom> नु) new, fresh, recent, young, modern (<ab>opp.</ab> to सन, पुराण), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (often in <ab>comp.</ab> with a <ab>subst.</ab>, <ab>e.g.</ab> नवा<स्र्स्>न्न <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. ii, 1, 49</ls>; or with a <ab>pp.</ab> in the sense of ‘newly, just, lately’ <ab>e.g.</ab> नवो<स्र्स्>दित, below)<info lex="m:f#A:n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=104477]</L>
नव <lex>m.</lex> a young monk, a novice, <ls>Buddh.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=104478]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a son of <s1>Uśīnara</s1> and <s1>Navā</s1>, <ls>Hariv.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=104481]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> नव <lex>m.</lex> (√ <hom>4.</hom> नु) praise, celebration, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=104614]</L>
ASI: <hom>3.</hom> आ-√ शी <ab>Ā.</ab> (<ab>irr.</ab> -शये [3. <ab>sg.</ab>] <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls> : <ab>Impv.</ab> 3. <ab>sg.</ab> आ-शयाम्, <ls>AV. v, 25, 9</ls>; 3. <ab>pl.</ab> -शेरते, <ls>Vikr.</ls>) <div n="to"/>to lie or rest on or round: <div n="to"/><ab>P.</ab> (<ab>impf.</ab> 3. <ab>pl.</ab> आ<स्र्स्>शयन्) to wish, <ls>BhP. ix, 1, 37</ls> [perhaps this form is rather a <ab>Nom.</ab> from <hom>1.</hom> आशा?] : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> (<ab>impf.</ab> आ<स्र्स्>शीशयत्) to lay or put upon, <ls>R.</ls><info verb="pre" cp="PĀ" parse="A+SI"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=27491]</L>
naBaM: नभ <lex>m.</lex> (rather <ab>fr.</ab> √ नभ् denoting ‘bursting forth’ or ‘expanding’ than <ab>fr.</ab> √ नह् ‘connecting’, <ab>scil.</ab> heaven and earth) the sky, atmosphere (= नभस्), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=103701]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a son of <s1>Manu</s1> <s1>Svārociṣa</s1> or of the 3rd <s1 n="Manu">M°</s1> (together with <s1>Nabhasya</s1>), <ls>Hariv.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=103703]</L>
of one of 7 sages of the 6th <s1>Manv-antara</s1>, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=103704]</L>
of a demon (son of <s1>Vipra-citti</s1> by <s1>Siṃhikā</s1>), <ls>ib.</ls>; <ls>VP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=103705]</L>
of a son of <s1>Nala</s1> (<s1>Niṣadha</s1>) and father of <s1>Puṇḍarīka</s1> (<ab>cf.</ab> नभस्), <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=103706]</L>
AraRa[m]: आरण <lex>n.</lex> (probably connected with अरण) depth, abyss, precipice, <ls>RV. i, 112, 6</ls> and <ls n="RV.">viii, 70, 8.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=26067]</L>
AnAya: आ-नाय <lex>m.</lex> a fisherman's net, <ls>Pāṇ.</ls><info lex="m"/><listinfo n="sup"/><L>[ID=24531]</L>
Canna: छन्न <lex>mfn.</lex> covered, covered over, <ls>MBh. iii, 800</ls>; <ls>R. i f.</ls>; <ls>Megh.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls> &c. (<ab>ifc.</ab> <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. vi, 2, 170</ls>)<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=75514]</L>
obscured (the moon), <ls>MBh. i, 2699</ls>; <ls>Sūryas. iv, 10</ls> and <ls n="Sūryas. iv,">22</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=75515]</L>

hidden, unnoticed by (<ab>dat.</ab>), secret, clandestine, disguised, <ls>MBh. iii f.</ls>; <ls>R. ii</ls>, <ls n="R.">v</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls>; <ls>Rājat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=75516]</L>
छन्न <lex>ind.</lex> (with √ गै, to sing) privately, in a low voice, <ls>Lāṭy. iii, 1, 12 ff.</ls><info lex="ind"/><L>[ID=75519]</L>
rARI: राणी <lex>f.</lex> (corruption of राज्ञी, <ab>q.v.</ab>) a queen.<info lex="f"/><L>[ID=177041]</L>
udaraM: उदर <lex>n.</lex> (√ दॄ, <ls>Uṇ. v, 19</ls>; √ ऋ, <ls>BRD.</ls> & <ls>T.</ls>), the belly, abdomen, stomach, bowels, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls>; <ls>Suśr.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls> &c.<info lex="n"/><L>[ID=32351]</L>
the interior or inside of anything (उदरे, inside, in the interior), <ls>Pañcat.</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls>; <ls>Ragh.</ls>; <ls>Mṛcch.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=32354]</L>
enlargement of the abdomen (from dropsy or flatulence), any morbid abdominal affection (as of the liver, spleen &c.; eight kinds are enumerated), <ls>Suśr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=32355]</L>
the thick part of anything (<ab>e.g.</ab> of the thumb), <ls>Suśr.</ls> <ab>Comm.</ab> on <ls>Yājñ.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=32356]</L>
avacara: अव-चर <lex>m.</lex> the dominion or sphere or department of (in <ab>comp.</ab> See कामा<स्र्स्>वचर, ध्याना<स्र्स्>व्°, &c.), <ls>Buddh.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> ताला<स्र्स्>वचर and यज्ञा<स्र्स्>वचर.)<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=17214]</L>
CAya: छाय <lex>n.</lex> (<ls>Pāṇ. ii, 4, 22</ls> and <ls n="Pāṇ. ii, 4">25</ls>; <ls n="Pāṇ.">vi, 2, 14</ls>) <ab>ifc.</ab> (especially after a word to be taken in the <ab>gen.</ab>) shadow, <ls>Mn. iii, 274</ls>; <ls>Ragh. iv, 20</ls>; <ls n="Ragh.">vii, 4</ls>; <ls n="Ragh.">xii, 50</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=75836]</L>
ni: <hom>1.</hom> नि <lex>ind.</lex> down, back, in, into, within (except, <ls>AV. x, 8, 7</ls> always prefixed either to verbs or to nouns; in the latter case it has also the meaning of negation or privation [<ab>cf.</ab> ‘down-hearted’ = heartless]; sometimes <ab>w.r.</ab> for निस्)<info lex="ind"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=106312]</L>
it may also express क्षेप, दान, उप-रम, आ-श्रय, मोक्ष &c., <ls>L.</ls> <info lex="inh"/>
<hom>2.</hom> नि (for नी) <lex>mfn.</lex> See ऋत-नि.<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=106313]</L>
<hom>3.</hom> नि (in music) the 7th note (for निषध).<info hui="3"/><L>[ID=106314]</L>
svaDA: स्व-धा <lex>f.</lex> (for स्वधा See <ab>p.</ab> 1280) self-position, self-power, inherent power (<ab>accord.</ab> to some, <ab>N.</ab> of Nature or the material Universe; स्व-धया ‘by self-power’), <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="f"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=258481]</L>
own state or condition or nature, habitual state, custom, rule, law, <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=258482]</L>

ease, comfort, pleasure (अनु स्वधाम्, स्वधाम् अनु or स्वधा अनु, स्वधया, or स्वधाभिः, ‘according to one's habit or pleasure, spontaneously, willingly, easily, freely, undisturbedly, wantonly, sportively’), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls>; <ls>TBr.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=258483]</L>
own place, home (स्वधे <ab>du.</ab> ‘the two places or homes’, heaven and earth, <ls>Naigh. iii, 30</ls>), <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=258484]</L>

‘own portion or share’, the sacrificial offering due to each god, (<ab>esp.</ab>) the food or libation, or refreshing drink (<ab>cf.</ab> <hom>2.</hom> सु-धा) offered to the <s1>Pitṛ</s1>s or spirits of deceased ancestors (consisting of clarified butter &c. and often only a remainder of the <s1>Havis</s1>; also applied to other oblations or libations, and personified as a daughter of <s1>Dakṣa</s1> and wife of the <s1>Pitṛ</s1>s or of <s1>Aṅgiras</s1> or of a <s1>Rudra</s1> or of <s1>Agni</s1>), <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=258485]</L>

स्व-धा (-धा), <lex>ind.</lex> (with <ab>dat.</ab> or <ab>gen.</ab>) the exclamation or benediction used on presenting (or as a substitute for) the above oblation or libation to the gods or departed ancestors (<ab>accord.</ab> to <ls>Mn. iii, 252</ls> the highest form of benediction at a <s1>Śrāddha</s1>; with √ कृ, ‘to pronounce the exclamation or benediction स्व-धा’; स्वधा<स्र्स्>स्तु, ‘let there be a blessing on it’ [<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>RTL. 104, n. 1</ls>]), <ls>RV.</ls>; &c.<info lex="ind"/><L>[ID=258486]</L>
स्वधा <lex>f.</lex> (for स्व-धा see <pcol>p. 1278, col. 1</pcol>) an axe, knife, <ls>TS.</ls><info lex="f"/><info hui="c"/><L>[ID=258890]</L>
tagara: तकरी (also तगर, °रक or तगरी) = स्थकर or स्थगर, a <ab>partic.</ab> fragrant powder (<ls>Bloomfield</ls>'s, <ls>AV.</ls>, <ab>p.</ab> 311).<info n="sup"/>

तगर <lex>n.</lex> (<lex type="hwalt">m.</lex>, <ls>L.</ls>) = °रक, <ls>Kauś. 16</ls>; <ls>MBh. xiii, 5042</ls>; <ls>Buddh.</ls>; <ls>Suśr.</ls>; <ls>VarBṛS. lxxvii, 5 ff.</ls><info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=81637]</L>
Ajaka: आजक <lex>n.</lex> a flock of goats, <ls>Pāṇ. iv, 2, 39.</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=23039]</L>
paRa[m]: पण <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>) play, gaming, playing for a stake, a bet or a wager (with <ab>gen.</ab>; <ab>loc.</ab> or <ab>ifc.</ab>; पणं-√ कृ, to make a bet; पणे नि-√ अस्, to stake at play), <ls>Yājñ.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:f#A"/><L>[ID=114551]</L>
a compact, stipulation, agreement, treaty, <ls>Kathās.</ls>; <ls>Vet.</ls>; <ls>Hit.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=114552]</L>
the thing staked or the sum played for, wages, hire, reward, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Mṛcch.</ls>; <ls>Kathās.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=114553]</L>
a weight of copper used as a coin (= 20 <s1>Māṣa</s1>s = 4 <s1>Kākinī</s1>s), <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=114554]</L>
a house, dwelling (गृह <ab>w.r.</ab> for ग्लह?), <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=114561]</L>
me: <hom>1.</hom> मे <ab>cl.</ab> 1. <ab>Ā.</ab> (<ls>Dhātup. xxii, 65</ls>) मयते (<lang>ep.</lang> also <ab>P.</ab> मयति; <ab>pf.</ab> ममे <ab>Gr.</ab>; <ab>aor.</ab> अमास्त, <ls>ib.</ls>; <ab>fut.</ab> माता, मास्यते, <ls>ib.</ls>; <ab>ind.p.</ab> -मित्य or -माय, <ls>ib.</ls>). to exchange, barter (<ab>cf.</ab> अप-. and नि-√ मे) : <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> मापयति, <ls>ib.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Desid.</ab> मित्सते, <ls>ib.</ls> : <div n="vp"/><ab>Intens.</ab> मेमीयते, मामेति, मामाति, <ls>ib.</ls><info westergaard="meN,22.65,01.0676"/><info verb="root" cp="1Ā,1P"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=167462]</L>
<hom>2.</hom> मे (<ab>onomat.</ab>) imitative of the sound of a bleating goat (मे-मे-√ कृ, to bleat), <ls>Kāv.</ls><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=167463]</L>
Avaya: आवय <lex>n.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> <hom>2.</hom> अ-वी <ab>cf.</ab> आवि), pangs of childbirth, painful childbirth (?), <ls>AV. viii, 6, 26</ls><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=27000]</L>
vAra: <hom>1.</hom> वार <lex>m.</lex> (earlier form of वाल, <ab>q.v.</ab>) the hair of any animal's tail (<ab>esp.</ab> of a horse's tail, = <gk>οὐρά</gk>), <ls>RV.</ls><info lex="m"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=191586]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> वार <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>1.</hom> वृ) keeping back, restraining (also <lex type="hwifc">mfn.</lex> <ab>ifc.</ab> = difficult to be restrained, <ls>TBr.</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> दुर्-व्°)<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=191590]</L>
anything which covers or surrounds or restrains, a cover, <ls>MW.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
anything which causes an obstruction, a gate, door-way, <ls>W.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
anything enclosed or circumscribed in space or time, <ab>esp.</ab> an appointed place (<ab>e.g.</ab> स्व-वारं समा-√ स्था, to occupy one's proper place), <ls>R.</ls><info lex="inh"/>

the time fixed or appointed for anything (<ab>accord.</ab> to some <ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>2.</hom> वृ, to choose), a person's turn, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c. (often, <ab>esp.</ab> with numerals, = times, <ab>e.g.</ab> वरांस् त्रीन् or वर-त्रयम्, three times; भूरिभिर् वारैः or भूरि-वारान् or बहु-वारम् or वारं वारम् or वारं वारेण, many times, often, repeatedly)<info lex="inh"/>

the turn of a day (under the regency of a planet), a day of the week (they are <s1>Āditya</s1>-, <s1>Soma</s1>-, <s1>Maṅgala</s1>-, <s1>Budha</s1>-, <s1>Guru</s1>-, <s1>Śukra</s1>-, and <s1>Śani</s1>-<s1>vāra</s1>; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>IW. 178 n. 1</ls>), <ls>Gaṇit.</ls>; <ls>Yājñ.</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c. (<ab>cf.</ab> दिन and दिवस-व्°)<info lex="inh"/>
वार <lex>n.</lex> a vessel for holding spirituous liquor, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="n"/>
<hom>3.</hom> वार <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> √ <hom>2.</hom> वृ) choice (see वारे-वृत)<info lex="m"/><info hui="3"/><L>[ID=191688]</L>
anything chosen or choice or exquisite, goods, treasure, <ls>RV.</ls> (often <ab>ifc.</ab>; <ab>cf.</ab> अशस्त-, ऋधद्-, दाति-व्° &c.)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=191689]</L>
kamala: कमल <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>Comm.</ab> on <ls>Uṇ. i, 106</ls>) pale-red, rose-coloured, <ls>TS. vii, 3, 18, 1</ls><info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="a"/><L>[ID=43793]</L>
कमल (अस्), <lex>m.</lex> a species of deer, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="m"/><L>[ID=43795]</L>
कमल (अस्, अम्), <lex>m</lex> <lex>n.</lex> a lotus, lotus-flower, <bot>Nelumbium</bot>, <ls>Suśr.</ls>; <ls>Śak.</ls>; <ls>Bhartṛ.</ls> &c.<info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=43801]</L>
कमल <lex>f(ई)n.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of a metre (four times three short syllables)<info lex="f#I:n"/><L>[ID=43809]</L>
<ab>N.</ab> of a town built by <s1>Kamalā</s1>, <ls>Rājat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=43815]</L>
maDu: मधु <lex>mf(ऊ or उ or वी)n.</lex> (<ab>gen.</ab> <lex type="hwinfo">n.</lex> <lang>Ved.</lang> मध्वस्, मधोस्, or मधुनस्; <ab>instr.</ab> मध्वा; <ab>dat.</ab> मधुने; <ab>loc.</ab> मधौ) sweet, delicious, pleasant, charming, delightful, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>TS.</ls><info lex="m:f#U:f#u:f#vI:n"/><L>[ID=155768]</L>
bitter or pungent, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155769]</L>
मधु <lex>m.</lex> <ab>N.</ab> of the first month of the year (= <s1>Caitra</s1>, March-April), <ls>ŚBr.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m"/><L>[ID=155770]</L>
the season of spring, <ls>Var.</ls>; <ls>Kālid.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155771]</L>
<bot>Bassia Latifolia</bot>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155772]</L>
<bot>Jonesia Asoka</bot>, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155773]</L>
liquorice, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=155774]</L>

aSru: अश्रु <lex>n.</lex> (उस् <lex type="hwalt">m.</lex> only once, <ls>ŚBr. vi</ls> and once, <ls>R.</ls>) a tear, <ls>RV. x, 95, 12</ls> and <ls n="RV. x, 95,">13</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls> &c. with √ मुच्, or √ कृ [<ls>MBh. xii, 12491</ls>] or √ वृत्, <ab>Caus.</ab> [<ls>R.</ls>] to shed tears <info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=19823]</L>

anASam: <hom>1.</hom> अन्-आश <lex>mfn.</lex> (<ab>fr.</ab> आशा), hopeless, despairing.<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=5676]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of a sort of dramatic entertainment (in which only one of the interlocutors appears on the scene, or a narrative of some intrigue told either by the hero or a third person), <ls>Daśar.</ls>; <ls>Sāh.</ls>; <ls>Pratāp.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>IW. 471</ls>). <info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=149783]</L>
Atan: आ-√ तन् <ab>P.</ab> (2. <ab>sg.</ab> -तनोषि; <ab>impf.</ab> आ<स्र्स्>तनोत्; <ab>perf.</ab> -ततान; <ab>p.</ab> <lex type="part">m.</lex> <ab>pl.</ab> -तन्वन्तस्; <ab>perf.</ab> <ab>p.</ab> <lex type="part">m.</lex> <ab>sg.</ab> -ततन्वान्) <div n="to"/>to extend or stretch over, penetrate, spread, overspread (said of the light), illuminate, <ls>RV.</ls>; <div n="to"/> (<ab>perf.</ab> 2. <ab>sg.</ab> -ततन्थ) to seek to reach, <ls>RV. x, 1, 7</ls>; <div n="to"/>to be ready for, wait on (<ab>acc.</ab>), <ls>RV. v, 79, 3</ls>; <div n="to"/> (<ab>aor.</ab> <ab>Subj.</ab> -तनत्) to stop any one, <ls>RV. i, 91, 23</ls> : <ab>P.</ab> <ab>Ā.</ab> (3. <ab>pl.</ab> -तन्वते; <ab>perf.</ab> 1. <ab>sg.</ab> -ततने) <div n="to"/>to extend (a texture), spread, stretch (a bow for shooting), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls> &c.: <div n="to"/><ab>P.</ab> to diffuse; <div n="to"/>to bestow upon, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls> &c.; <div n="to"/>to effect, produce, <ls>Hariv. 4635</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls> &c.: <div n="vp"/><ab>Caus.</ab> (<ab>Impv.</ab> 2. <ab>sg.</ab> -तानया) to stretch, <ls>AV.</ls><info verb="pre" cp="PĀ" parse="A+tan"/><L>[ID=23343]</L>
yatam: यत <lex>mfn.</lex> restrained, held in, held forth, kept down or limited, subdued, governed, controlled &c., <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>comp.</ab> below)<info lex="m:f:n"/><info hui="b"/><L>[ID=170259]</L>
the spurring or guiding of an elephant by means of the rider's feet, <ls>L.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=170261]</L>
samaya: <hom>1.</hom> समय <ab>P.</ab> °यति (for <hom>2.</hom> See सम्-√ इ), to level, regulate, <ls>L.</ls><info verb="root" cp="0P"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=233271]</L>

<hom>2.</hom> सम्-अय <lex>m.</lex> (<ab>ifc.</ab> <lex type="hwifc">f(आ). </lex>) coming together, meeting or a place of meeting, <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>ŚBr.</ls><info lex="m:f#A"/><info hui="2"/><L>[ID=234792]</L>

coming to a mutual understanding, agreement, compact, covenant, treaty, contract, arrangement, engagement, stipulation, conditions of agreement, terms (एन or आत् or -तस्, ‘according to agreement, conditionally’; तेन समयेन, ‘in consequence of this agreement’; समयं <ab>acc.</ab> with √ कृ, ‘to make an agreement or engagement’, ‘agree with any one [<ab>instr.</ab> with or without सह]’, ‘settle’, ‘stipulate’; with सम्√ वद् <ab>id.</ab>; with √ दा, ‘to propose an agreement, offer terms’; with √ ब्रू or √ वच् or अभि-√ धा, ‘to state the terms of an <ab n="agreement">agr°</ab>’, ‘make a promise’; with √ ग्रह् or प्रति-√ पद्, ‘to enter into an <ab n="agreement">agr°</ab>’, ‘make or accept conditions of an <ab n="agreement">agr°</ab>’; with √ पाल्, or √ रक्ष् or परि-√ रक्ष् &c., ‘to keep an <ab n="agreement">agr°</ab>’, ‘keep one's word’; with √ त्यज् or √ भिद् or व्य्-अभि-√ चर् &c., ‘to break an <ab n="agreement">agr°</ab>’; <ab>abl.</ab> with √ भ्रंश् <ab>id.</ab>; <ab>loc.</ab> with √ स्था, ‘to keep an engagement’, ‘keep one's word’; <ab>acc.</ab> with <ab>Caus.</ab> of √ स्था or of नि-√ विश् ‘to fix or settle terms’, ‘impose conditions’), <ls>TS.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=234794]</L>
convention, conventional rule or usage, established custom, law, rule, practice, observance, <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>R.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=234795]</L>
(in <ab>rhet.</ab>) the conventional meaning or scope of a word, <ls>Kusum.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=234797]</L>

appointed or proper time, right moment for doing anything (<ab>gen.</ab> or <ab>Pot.</ab> <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 3, 68</ls>), opportunity, occasion, time, season (<ab>ifc.</ab> or <ab>ibc.</ab> or °ये <lex type="phw">ind.</lex>, ‘at the appointed time or at the right moment or in good time for’, or ‘at the time of’, ‘when there is’; तेन समयेन, ‘at that time’), <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info phwchild="234808.1"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=234798]</L>
juncture, circumstances, case (इह समये, ‘under these circumstances’, ‘in this case’), <ls>Pañcat.</ls>; <ls>Hit.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=234799]</L>
solemn address, harangue, speech, declaration, <ls>Viṣṇ.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=234804]</L>
(in <ab>gram.</ab>) a Vedic passage which is the repetition of another one, <ls>RPrāt.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=234805]</L>
(in <ab>dram.</ab>) end of trouble or distress, <ls>Bhar.</ls>; <ls>Daśar.</ls>; <ls>Sāh.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=234806]</L>
(with <s1>Śākta</s1>s) <ab>N.</ab> of the author of a <s1>Mantra</s1>, <ls>Cat.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=234808]</L>
stana: स्तन <lex>m.</lex> (or <lex type="hwalt">n.</lex> <ab>g.</ab> अर्धर्चा<स्र्स्>दि <ab>ifc.</ab> आ or ई; derivation doubtful, but <ab>prob.</ab> connected with √ स्तन्, from the hollow resonance of the human breast), the female breast (either human or animal), teat, dug, udder, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c.<info lex="m:n"/><L>[ID=254308]</L>

भ <lex>n.</lex> a star, planet, asterism, lunar <ab n="asterism">a°</ab> or mansion (and so also the number 27; <ab>cf.</ab> नक्षत्र), sign of the zodiac, <ls>GṛS.</ls>; <ls>Sūryas.</ls>; <ls>Var.</ls>; <ls>Śatr.</ls> &c.<info lex="n"/>
nAma: <hom>1.</hom> नाम <lex>ind.</lex> (<ab>acc.</ab> of नामन्) by name <ab>i.e.</ab> named, called, <ls>RV.</ls> &c. &c. (also with नामतस् and नाम्ना)<info lex="ind"/><info hui="1"/><L>[ID=105725]</L>
indeed, certainly, really, of course, <ls>ib.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
after an <ab>interr.</ab> = then, pray, <ab>e.g.</ab> किं न्°, कथं न्°, कदा <ab n="nevertheless">n°</ab>, what then? pray, what? &c., <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Kāv.</ls> &c.<info lex="inh"/>
after an <ab>Impv.</ab> = may it be so, no matter, <ab>e.g.</ab> <ls>Śak. v, 8</ls><info lex="inh"/>
अपि न्° at the beginning of a sentence = perhaps, I dare say, <ab>e.g.</ab> अप्य् एष नाम फलम् इच्छति, this man wants perhaps a reward, <ls>Mṛcch. viii, 25</ls><info lex="inh"/>
with <ab>Pot.</ab> often = would that, <ab>e.g.</ab> अपि नामै<स्र्स्>वं स्यात्, would that it were so, <ls>Vikr. v, 19/20</ls><info lex="inh"/>
<ab>opp.</ab> to मा न्° with <ab>Pot.</ab> would that not, I should think not, <ab>e.g.</ab> मा नाम अकार्यं कुर्यात्, I hope he will not do something wrong, <ls>Mṛcch. iii, 26.</ls><info lex="inh"/>
<hom>2.</hom> नाम in <ab>comp.</ab> for नामन्, <ab>q.v.</ab> (sometimes <ab>ifc.</ab> as in सत्य-, <ab>q.v.</ab>)<info hui="2"/><L>[ID=105726]</L>
vahas: वहस् <lex>n.</lex> the shoulder of a draught animal, <ls>ŚBr.</ls> (<ab>v.l.</ab> for वह). <info lex="n"/><L>[ID=189298]</L>
janman: जन्मन् <lex>n.</lex> birth, production (कृत-जन्मन् <lex type="phw">mfn.</lex> ‘planted’, <ls>Kum. v, 60</ls>), origin (<ab>ifc.</ab> ‘born from’ <ab>e.g.</ab> शूद्र. <ab>q.v.</ab>), <ls>RV. iii, 26, 7</ls>; <ls n="RV.">vii, 33, 10</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls> &c.<info phwchild="77118.2"/><info lex="n"/><L>[ID=77105]</L>

existence, life, <ls>Mn.</ls>; <ls>Bhag. iv, 5</ls>; <ls>Yogas. ii, 12</ls> (दृष्टा<स्र्स्>दृष्टज्°, ‘present and future life’), &c. (°म <ab>acc.</ab> <lex type="phw">ind.</lex> through the whole life, <ls>HPariś. iv, 7</ls>)<info phwchild="77118.1"/><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77106]</L>
birthplace, home, <ls>RV. ii, 9, 3</ls>; <ls n="RV.">viii, 69, 3</ls>; <ls n="RV.">x, 5, 7</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77109]</L>
(in <ab>astrol.</ab>) <ab>N.</ab> of the 1st lunar mansion, <ls n="VarBṛS.">civ</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77112]</L>
a creature, being, <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>TBr. ii</ls>; <ls>AitBr. iv, 10</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77113]</L>

the people of a household, kind, race, <ls>RV.</ls> (उभयज्° <ab>sg.</ab>, <ab>du.</ab> and <ab>pl.</ab>, ‘both races’ <ab>i.e.</ab> gods and men or [<ls n="RV.">x, 37, 11</ls>] men and animals)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77115]</L>

custom, manner (प्रत्नेन जन्मना, according to ancient custom), <ls n="RV.">i, 87, 5</ls>; <ls n="RV.">ix, 3, 9</ls>; <ls>SV.</ls> (<ab>v.l.</ab> मन्म्°, <ls>RV.</ls>), <ls>Hariv. 15718</ls> (दूत-जन्मना, ‘like a messenger’)<info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=77117]</L>

a shed erected in the sacrificial enclosure to the east of the <s1>Prācīnavaṃśa</s1>, <ls>AV.</ls>; <ls>VS.</ls> : <ls>Br.</ls>; <ls>MBh.</ls>; <ls>Hariv.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=230572]</L>

Ananam: आनन See under आन above.<info hui="b"/><L>[ID=24343]</L>

a technical term for all the tenses and moods of a finite verb or for the terminations of those tenses and moods (also applied to some forms with कृत् affixes construed like a finite verb, <ls>Pāṇ. ii, 3, 69</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls n="Pāṇ.">iii, 2, 124</ls>, and when accompanied by certain indicatory letters denoting each tense separately See लट्; लङ्; लिङ्; लोट्; लिट्; लुट्; ऌट्; लुङ्; ऌङ्; लेट्), <ls>Pāṇ. iii, 4, 69</ls>; <ls n="Pāṇ. iii, 4">77</ls>, <ab>Sch.</ab>
<hom>3.</hom> ल (in prosody) = लघु, a short syllable.<info hui="3"/><L>[ID=180315]</L>

<ab>N.</ab> of a son of <s1>Manu</s1> <s1>Svārociṣa</s1> or of the 3rd <s1 n="Manu">M°</s1> (together with <s1>Nabhasya</s1>), <ls>Hariv.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=103703]</L>

of a son of <s1>Nala</s1> (<s1>Niṣadha</s1>) and father of <s1>Puṇḍarīka</s1> (<ab>cf.</ab> नभस्), <ls>Hariv.</ls>; <ls>BhP.</ls><info lex="inh"/><L>[ID=103706]</L>
